story:
Circle of Life Network was founded in 2012 by Lisa McCall and Amy Owen, both birth doulas and moms, who wanted to find a new way to reach women and empower them to make the decisions that are right for them. Since our doula careers started, we’ve seen the bad birth trends increase, while the rights of women and babies during the childbearing year have been disregarded. Our mission is simple: Circle of Life Network is committed to providing women with the knowledge they need to become empowered and advocate for themselves by creating a safe, reliable, community that offers credible evidence-based information, resources and support from like-minded peers and birth professionals.

 

By creating a nurturing, safe and supportive community, we can begin to reverse the damage that has been done to parents and babies. Cesarean rate is still increasing and the business of being born has become priority.

 

We are motivated by simply providing access to the best, most reliable information.

 

The $2500 that we are raising will go towards the following:

 

  • Marketing expenses-in order to get the word out, we must advertise! We’re looking to make our mark on the world through blogs and other websites. We need printed marketing supplies (business cards, flyers,  and mailers). We’ll also need to advertise toward our social media audience as well.

 

  • Blog and guest writers-Even bloggers have to eat!

 

  • Possible guest appearances-We’ll be asking for leading experts to visit us for open chats.

 

  • Administrative costs-shipping expenses, travel expenses, etc.

 

Our perks are simple! We figure that we have more time than money, so we’d be happy to use our talents to benefit you! Birth plan writing, customized website services, a personalized childbirth ed class, and Lactation Counseling services are what we can do for you by helping us to help others.

 

We believe that Peace on Earth begins at Birth. We can make a huge impact, together, by getting the most reliable, evidence based information to the parents that want it.

 

Please spread the word by posting our links and thank you for your support through this awesome mission!

story:
Click on the image below to watch the campaign video:

 

My name is Cathi Locati and this is NIPPLELODEON!  I am CEO and  Areola Architect of Cathi Locati Co. in Westchester county, NY. The inspiration for this Indiegogo.com crowd funding campaign comes from the growing group of breast cancer survivors I work with daily, who are missing their nipples and areolas and who have no way to get them back without your help! As a professional fine artist and aerola tattoo artist, I want to give them something free of charge that they can not afford on their own and something very few artists in the world can give them: photorealistic areolas and nipples tattooed in 3D.  Together we can give 5 breast cancer survivors their sexy back!

You might be asking yourself, “What the heck is an areola anyway? What does it mean to be an Areola Architect?” Well, areolas are the circle of colored skin that rings the nipple. We all have them and  they  play a vital part in the aesthetic presentation of the breast on women or men. When breast cancer patients undergo breast cancer treatments or surgery, their main priority is to get rid of the cancer. Yet, once that is accomplished, they are left with scarred breasts or no breasts at all, and even after plastic surgery reconstruction, whatever IS left is often lacking nipples and areolas. These breast cancer survivors are grateful to be alive, but many of them don’t feel feminine anymore; that feeling that made them look and feel sexy. This is where I come in, the areola architect. I am highly specialized in tattooing photorealistic areolas and nipples in 3D in the style of Michaelangelo.  The areola and nipple tattoos are permanent and wont fade like 90% of  areola tattoos being done today by surgeons and tattoo artists alike.  

And this is where you come in!  Providing Areolas and nipples for 5 deserving, worthy women can NOT be done without YOUR help. We need to raise $10,000 to cover the cost of 5 areola and nipple procedures.  Every one of your donations acts like a stone thrown into a very still pond,  creating the ripple effect “or should I say  “nipple effect”” quickly growing the outreach to other Breast Cancer Survivors worldwide.  Wont you help me spread the good word and educate more women about their breasts and options for micropigmentation and watch the smiles grow, watch the sensual woman return. Together, we will  bring their sexy back!

But we need your help!

We set our goal at $10,000 to cover all costs but besides accepting monetary donations, we would love your social media help as well  in telling more BCS about their tattooing options.  Feel free to post, tweet, forward and tell everyone  you know, because unfortunately, everyone knows someone affected by breast cancer.  And because I deal with these brave women every day I agree that breast cancer is a whole lot more than a pink ribbon.

A small portion of funds raised are seed capital for Cathi Locati Co.  helping me pioneer this budding industry of areola tattooing or micropigmentation, exponentially increasing the education desperately needed about breasts in general, helping BCS know their rights and inform them about the simple, quick tattooing procedure which provides permanent color verses more surgery which cant provide permanent color, regardless of the technique.

So We’re turning to you, our strongest supporters for contributions to make this happen.

There are aesthetic perks for you too in return for helping these women get their areola tattoos free of charge, you will receive a myriad of fine art works by me, Cathi Locati to hang in your home or office or give as gifts.  These pieces come from my personal artist’s collection ranging from sketchwork, and original paintings to large format Giclee reproductions.  To see the photorealistic imagery offered as perks go to www.cathilocati.com click on Early Works.

I have accumulated over 30 years experience as a photorealism portrait and figurative fine art painter where my work is seen all over the world and ranges in retail from $3000 - $125,000.  I’ve exhibited in Monaco in the French Riviera, New York City in Chelsea at Amsterdam Whitney Gallery, The NY Art Expo, all over the west coast, the Cayman Islands and beyond, I turn my fine artist photorealist savant tattooing skills to tattooing in 3D, so real they make you want to touch them, gorgeous, plump areolas and nipples in full living color. 

When the breast cancer survivors that you helped look in the mirror, they will wipe away tears of joy, because in their shock and awe, when they see themselves for the very first time with areolas and nipples in full living color, they come back to life.  And they will thank you for it every day of their lives.  When you bring BCS back to the sensual side of being female, feeling like a sexy woman again,  it counts as your own personal pay it forward! 

We can do this one nipple at a time when we exceed our Indiegogo goal of $!0,000 – for every additional $1000 raised over and above, another BCS gets her sexy back!  So many of them, so little time….

I also provide facial cosmetic tattoos for chemotherapy patients in the form of eyebrows, eyeliner and lips using the tattoo machine and my portrait abilities.

Check out my areola site at: www.cathilocatico.com.  Thank you for helping us pioneer a brand new industry and making life better one breast cancer survivor at a time – because each one counts.  Let’s welcome them back into the land of living color and hope!!

Thank you for your consideration of this worthy project.

story:
What:  A child can disappear in the blink of an eye!... "It is estimated that a child goes missing every 40 seconds in the United States. This is why we set out to create the KiD iD!

We are a group of friends with different backgrounds but shared ideals. We  saw that even with all of the recent advances in technology, there was not a good solution to help parents keep their children safe so we took a shot at it...

For the last 9 months we have dedicated our lives and every resource we have to making this dream come true. 

 

"The KiD iD bracelet is an innovative solution that provides your child a wearable form of iD".

 

 

How:

Each KiD iD Bracelet has a unique Quick Response Code (QR code) which is linked to the KiD iD online profile. The KiD iD can be easily scanned by any camera-ready smartphone. Once scanned, your child's KiD iD profile will be displayed with all of your child's vital information and an easy method to contact you at the push of a button.

 

 

"We are dedicated to creating innovative solutions that help parents protect what matters most in the world."

 

 The KiD iD:


The KiD iD will be available to the public at a retail price of $30 dollars once we have received our initial inventory. The KiD iD  will also provide the KiD online profile for a full year after activation and each additional  year can be bougth  for only $14.99

 

Activate: Activating the KiD iD is simple. Go to www.kidid.me, follow the easy activation instructions and register your child's information. You can also register from your mobile phone by scanning the KiD iD bracelet!

Empower:  Provide your child with a wearable form of id and a plan of action if he gets lost.  

Alert: Whenever your child's  KiD iD bracelt is scanned, you receive an email notification  with  the GPS location of where the KiD iD was scanned. 

 

 

Resource:The KiD iD online profile is a valuable resource that keeps your child's vital information at your fingertips and ready to be shown to authorities if they ever get lost. You can easily update your child's photo, description, allergies, medical conditions and any other additional information you want to provide. 

Response:  In case of emergency, the KiD iD online profile can provide valuable medical information. First responders can be aware of any medical conditions just by scanning your child's bracelet.

 

 

 

 

Why:. With the KiD iD, we believe we can truly make a difference. If we can increase the odds parents and their children will be reunited by just 1%, if we can provide that valuable piece of information that can save a child's life, if we can help parents protect what matters most in the world, then we have acomplished what we set out to do.

story:
We are the only cow milk dairy on the island of Oahu and will soon be the first cow milk cheese production in the state of Hawaii EVER! We are aiming to create signature cheeses, made from milk from Hawaiian cows, that celebrate the flavors and terrain of our unique and beautiful islands. Some of the cheeses we are right now testing and working on perfecting include a soft young brie-type cheese, several styles of gouda including some made with local herbs and spices, and a kiawe (Hawaiian mesquite) smoked mozzarella type cheese! Soon, with your help, we can have these tasty beauties at the market and on your table!

The Impact

 

Hard Fact #1:  To achieve longed for stability as a family owned and operated agricultural business, Naked Cow Dairy direly needs to start making cheese!  By securing the waiting cheeselover market, this dairy will be able to thrive and grow.

Hard Fact  #2:  100% of cow milk cheese in Hawaii has been imported, some cheeses from more than 10,000 miles away.  Hawaii currently imports at least 80% of the food that we eat.  Let's put a dent in these numbers!


Semi-Soft Fact:  You will be helping Naked Cow Dairy make history by being the first cow milk cheese making operation in Hawaii.  


Soft, Spreadable Delicious Fact:  Imagine these cheeses made fresh, right here on the island with milk from pasture-raised cows: mozzarella, jack, cheddar, gouda, brie, camembert, and more! mmmmm.....


The Naked Cow Story and Vision

 

Naked Cow Dairy is a women-owned, family run cow dairy on the island of Oahu whose mission is to keep the art of caring for dairy cows alive and well in Hawaii and to bring Island-made, signature, local, fresh-churned butter and artisan cheeses to the table. Hand-crafted dairy products ensure the health and happiness of the cows as well as the high quality of the product.


Started by sisters Monique van der Stroom and Sabrina St. Martin, Naked Cow Dairy is a labor of love that fills a void left by the closure of 75 (!) dairies on Oahu in the past  50 years. 

Monique came to the decision to start Naked Cow after working in other dairies on Oahu and watching each of them struggle and fail to compete with the cheaper mainland imports. She realized that in order to be viable it would be necessary to maximize the potential of the milk by creating value added foods like butter, yogurt and cheese. 

Sabrina, after leaving New Orleans post Hurricane Katrina, came to the dairy with a vision to expand the culinary reach of the product to restaurant chefs passionate about locally produced food and farmer's market shoppers eager to support local farms.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

This campaign’s goal is to raise $15,000 to equip our kitchen with a heating element for our 230 gallon cheese vat & low-temp pasteurizer. This part costs about $7000 to purchase and install. 

In addition we need to build and outfit a cheese aging room that will keep our delicious cheeses at the right temperature and humidity until they go to market. The equipment and buildout of the space we need is estimated to cost about $8000. 

With these parts of the puzzle in place we will be on the way to making Hawaii cheesy!!


As valued members of our food community your donations will be rewarded with awesome perks like your name in print on our cheese aging room “Wall O’ Moohalo” ! 

Or how about a one-of-a-kind cheese board on which to taste our fromage made from reclaimed Hawaiian hardwoods! 

Or bring the family to Hawaii and experience an incredible day on our Wai’anae farm, learning to make cheese, milk cows and enjoy a Wai’anae sunset with cheese in hand! 

Check out our “perks” to choose yours!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

- Make it a point to get your butter, yogurt and cheeses from Naked Cow Dairy - available at KCC & Kailua Farmers' Markets; Kapolei Farmer's Market; Ala Moana  & Haleiwa Farmers' Markets; Windward Mall Farmer's Market; Whole Foods Kahala, Maui (and soon Kailua); R. Field: Aina Haina, Beretania&  Kailua; Down to Earth; Kokua Market.  

- Tell your friends to make sure to stock their fridges with local milk (real local milk - which is only Big Island Dairy sold as Hawaii Fresh at the moment), butter, yogurt and cheeses.  Let's grow our dairies instead of losing them!

- If you're on twitter help spread the word by following us @nakedcowdairy - hashtag for this campaign is #cheesyhawaii

- If you are on Facebook, please like us! "Naked Cow Dairy Hawaii" (listed as a Farm/Agricultural Business)
You and your cheese loving friends can come along for our cheesemaking ride :)

- Buy locally grown and locally made always! Know your farmer know your food!!

---MOOOOOOHALO from Naked Cow Dairy!!

story:
Gracias!

On Behalf of Susan  A heartfelt "Gracias', to all who have contributed to help us reach and pass our fundraising goal. Your words of encouragement and unbelievably generous contributions are much appreciated.  I know we all look forward to seeing Susan's happy face at school in the Fall!   

más sinceramente agradecidos, Team Saludad

..........................................................................................................................................................

Help Susan Beat Cancer

Many have asked how they can help Susan/Susie Hackett, our wonderful relation, friend and teacher. We, a group of concerned parents and friends of Susan, have put together this donation page to help alleviate the financial burden that she, like all people dealing with serious illnesses, faces.

For those who don’t know, on Friday, January 13, Susan was officially diagnosed with breast cancer: Stage III, infiltrating ductal carcinoma (which includes her lymph nodes). The good news is that the PET scan doesn't show the cancer in other parts of her body. For you scientists and doctors: her cancer is estrogen positive, her2neu positive, and progesterone negative.

Susan’s approach to beating cancer is similar to her approach to life. She is actively researching her cancer and taking care of her mind and body. She exercises daily (when she is able) and has transitioned her diet to highly nourishing foods to rebuild her immune system while she undergoes chemotherapy, surgery, more chemotherapy, and radiation treatment.

She continues to be focused on others, sharing positive news by focusing on progress at all points. Susan has expressed a huge amount of gratitude for the outpouring of support and get-well wishes she’s been receiving.

The Impact

It’s amazing how kids have clarity that we often lose as adults. Susan, ever the teacher, has honestly and openly shared her illness with her classroom of 7–9 year olds. Her positive and determined attitude clearly was communicated to her students, “I’m not afraid, so you shouldn’t be afraid. I will be sick but I will beat this cancer and be back to teach again.”

For the kids, it’s been clear that their teacher has gone away to get better. She is not a victim; she is a champion.

Susan is a role model not only to children, but also to adults. She is spending her time reading cutting-edge research about cancer and it would be no surprise if she becomes an advocate for all people fighting, coping with and defeating this terrible illness.

Sadly, due to the nature of her cancer, and at the recommendation of her doctors, Susan had to take off from work for almost a year to focus on her treatment: chemo, followed by surgery, more chemotherapy, radiation (a combined minimum of 42 weeks), and then months of healing.

Needless to say, Susan leaving to go through treatment has not only impacted her family and friends, but also a classroom of children, parents and fellow teachers.

What This Pays For

As a teacher and friend, Susan has brought light to so many lives, and what we want more than anything is to “pay it forward.” Susan has expressed her immense gratitude for the messages, gifts and cards she’s received. We all wish for her speedy recovery, but unfortunately, cancer recovery is neither speedy nor cheap. She knows she will need any financial support she can get and sends a sincere "thank you" to everyone who is able to contribute.

No contribution is too small. Independent of Susan, we’ve set a goal of raising $7,000 with our overall goal of raising as much as possible.

Ideally with everyone's help, we'll be able to offset a small percent of the total medical and support expenses she will have including her post-cancer surgeries and recovery.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially, please spread the word! Send this to all your friends and family on Facebook. And please keep her in your hearts and prayers.
story_txt:
Gracias!
On Behalf of Susan  A heartfelt "Gracias', to all who have contributed to help us reach and pass our fundraising goal. Your words of encouragement and unbelievably generous contributions are much appreciated.  I know we all look forward to seeing Susan's happy face at school in the Fall!   
más sinceramente agradecidos, Team Saludad
..........................................................................................................................................................
Help Susan Beat CancerMany have asked how they can help Susan/Susie Hackett, our wonderful relation, friend and teacher. We, a group of concerned parents and friends of Susan, have put together this donation page to help alleviate the financial burden that she, like all people dealing with serious illnesses, faces.For those who don’t know, on Friday, January 13, Susan was officially diagnosed with breast cancer: Stage III, infiltrating ductal carcinoma (which includes her lymph nodes). The good news is that the PET scan doesn't show the cancer in other parts of her body. For you scientists and doctors: her cancer is estrogen positive, her2neu positive, and progesterone negative.Susan’s approach to beating cancer is similar to her approach to life. She is actively researching her cancer and taking care of her mind and body. She exercises daily (when she is able) and has transitioned her diet to highly nourishing foods to rebuild her immune system while she undergoes chemotherapy, surgery, more chemotherapy, and radiation treatment.She continues to be focused on others, sharing positive news by focusing on progress at all points. Susan has expressed a huge amount of gratitude for the outpouring of support and get-well wishes she’s been receiving.The ImpactIt’s amazing how kids have clarity that we often lose as adults. Susan, ever the teacher, has honestly and openly shared her illness with her classroom of 7–9 year olds. Her positive and determined attitude clearly was communicated to her students, “I’m not afraid, so you shouldn’t be afraid. I will be sick but I will beat this cancer and be back to teach again.”For the kids, it’s been clear that their teacher has gone away to get better. She is not a victim; she is a champion.Susan is a role model not only to children, but also to adults. She is spending her time reading cutting-edge research about cancer and it would be no surprise if she becomes an advocate for all people fighting, coping with and defeating this terrible illness.Sadly, due to the nature of her cancer, and at the recommendation of her doctors, Susan had to take off from work for almost a year to focus on her treatment: chemo, followed by surgery, more chemotherapy, radiation (a combined minimum of 42 weeks), and then months of healing.Needless to say, Susan leaving to go through treatment has not only impacted her family and friends, but also a classroom of children, parents and fellow teachers. What This Pays ForAs a teacher and friend, Susan has brought light to so many lives, and what we want more than anything is to “pay it forward.” Susan has expressed her immense gratitude for the messages, gifts and cards she’s received. We all wish for her speedy recovery, but unfortunately, cancer recovery is neither speedy nor cheap. She knows she will need any financial support she can get and sends a sincere "thank you" to everyone who is able to contribute.
No contribution is too small. Independent of Susan, we’ve set a goal of raising $7,000 with our overall goal of raising as much as possible.
Ideally with everyone's help, we'll be able to offset a small percent of the total medical and support expenses she will have including her post-cancer surgeries and recovery.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot help financially, please spread the word! Send this to all your friends and family on Facebook. And please keep her in your hearts and prayers.

story:
Our Story

Hello,

I do not want to abuse of your time so I will cut to chase. Since 2007 I have in mind this project called “The Green    Island”. It's a Driving Range. It would be normal to hit golf balls down a field but wait there's no field, there is a LAKE !!!  Projects like this, more often do not receive help (economic aid)  from local politicians (even though after all they would like to take some credit, once everything  is done and running).

That’s why I’d need your help. If I wait for the local government support, oh well, I might grow roots waiting on the spot.

PLEASE! IF YOU VISIT LEAVE A COMMENT! ANY SUGGESTION IS WELCOME EVEN IF YOU JUST WANT TO TELL ME HOW CRAZY I AM, I'D REALLY APRECIATE IT.

The Impact

Projects like this can only generate a positive impact, tourism attraction and most important generates jobs' spots.

This project wants to be an attraction for visitors and locals so that everybody might have a new meeting point and have something different to do.

What if the project does not take place? Oh well, it would not cause any effect on the town’s life. Everything would be the same in its usual, boring way of being. 

What We Need & What You Get

The Green Islands Project consist of Floating Greens, Teeing Spots, a whole lot of floaters (floating golf balls), a tent roof, a small refresh area. Initially we are talking of four greens and at least 10 tee off,  if we can reach the goal the project will be done at once, if only part of the funds is raised than we will complete the works thru the revenues’ reinvestment until the project meets its goal. The items needed includes among others: Metallic Floating Structures, Synthetic pitch, Islands decorations, Golf Clubs, Floaters (floating golf balls), Balls’ Rescue Boat. We calculated a minimum breakdown and we came up with a figure close to 30.000 dollars. A whole lot of money, that’s why we need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would like you to pass the word. A friends chain is the most powerful way to get to a final target, please let your friends know that with a small donation they can be part of a dream came true. Along with the perks we offer, we would like to know everybody’s donors email as well, in order to get directly in touch and thank each and everyone.

story:
9/25/12

Well our hearth may still only be a vision on paper and in chalk lines, but it is so much closer to reality now…


Thanks to the huge community effort to raise the house frame, we now have a space in which to locate the heart of our home, and thanks to the generous contributions to this campaign, it is all the more financially feasible.


This is how the house will sit for some weeks, as I reluctantly prepare to depart to Connecticut for work, and Briis for New Jersey, at a time of year that is so clear and pristine it nearly stops your heart….
But what a wonderful stage at which to leave, married to a wonderful woman, a beautiful house standing, and the echoes of that amazing weekend still strong…


Thanks again for all who contributed in so many ways. We will have pictures of the wedding and frame raising available soon! And as the heater starts to materialize (next spring) we will keep you all posted. By then, if all goes to plan, we will have walls, windows, doors, and the beginnings of a roof.


We aim to move in by next winter, so be prepared for a house-warming party, in the fullest sense!

 

Much love, peace, and respect to you all, and...

thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

 

9/16/12 Update:

Well the big wedding/frame-raising wave finally reached the shore, and rolled gently up onto the beach, rather than crashing hard.  Some friends stayed on here and helped put on the roof boards, and covered the whole structure with a rugged tarp to protect the frame until we get a proper roof on (see photo updates). 

We only have 6 days left of this campaign, and we likely won't reach our goal, but what we have raised is nevertheless a huge help in getting us closer to a warm home.  Thanks to all who have contributed financially, physically, spiritually, or some combination thereof.

As fall sets in, and the pressure of organizing the (for us) huge set of events two weeks ago has lifted, I've finally been finding some time for wandering and reflection.  Invariably I am drawn toward our house, and I often find myself just gazing at the frame, not entirely sure how it all came together, but so grateful that it did.  I can't thank you all enough for participating in what will no doubt stand out as a couple of the best days of our lives that we will remember vividly as long as we are around.

 

9/3/12 Construction Update:

SUCCESS!!!!!!

After an utterly magical wedding day, made possible by the diligent hard work of dozens of friends and family, we had an equally incredible frame raising.  With delicious wood-fired pizza keeping us fueled (courtesy Teddy, Stalin, and a whole crew of volunteers), we assembled our house frame, piece by piece.  I've never experienced such a sense of community, a group working toward a common goal, and it gives me a glimpse of what is possible, and what has been achieved throughout history, wherever people work hard, together, and with joy.

A huge thank you to all those who participated, either physically or in spirit, and you are truly woven into the existence of this house.  We have much work left to do, but this is now distinctly a house, rather than a house site.

This has been an unforgettable weekend, and could not have happened without the collaborative effort of many many hands and hearts.  Thank you all.

 

_______________

 

We have established this fundraiser in an effort to channel enthusiasm and support for our marriage toward something we truly need.

If everything comes together as we hope it will, on September 2, 2012 we will raise our house frame with our family and friends.  It is such a powerful symbolic event---our loved ones helping to put our house together.   It occurred to us that our family and friends helping us to fund our masonry heater would also be symbolic, helping to bring light and warmth into the very center of our home. 

For those of unfamiliar with masonry heaters, they are a very different way of heating with wood than we are accustomed to in the U.S.  A very hot fire is made that burns for perhaps an hour and a half.  But instead of all of the heat rushing up the chimney, as with fireplaces and wood stoves, the hot gases move through a series of channels, heating up all the brick in the process (including, in our case, an oven and 2 heated benches).   The masonry soaks up most of the heat, and releases it slowly for many hours.  In the coldest weather, we will probably only need 2 fires per day.  Masonry heaters burn very cleanly, and very efficiently.  There are no moving parts, and only require being cleaned of ash occasionally. 

We have also included a masonry cookstove in our plans, which will enable us to cook all winter using wood, at the same time heating water for dishes, bathing, and, eventually, our commercial goat cheese creamery, all with wood from our forest.

This heater/cookstove unit represents about a third of the total budget of our house.  Though the initial cost is quite high, it is an investment that should give returns through generations of Maine winters.  They are designed to last, and where they have been used for centuries, they have lasted well.

The most expensive aspect of this project is the cast iron and tempered glass elements (fire door, oven door, cooktop, etc.), which are imported from Finland, where masonry stoves are very common.  To have this built for us would cost somewhere around $25,000.  For us to do it ourselves it will be more like $15,000.  We have set our goal lower to be realistic and make it achievable.

Check back on this site, as we will continue developing it, adding information, links, and pictures.  There are many good examples of some similar heaters at www.mainewoodheat.com/masonry-heaters/masonry-heater-project-diaries/ and www.mha-net.org/html/gallery.htm

We thank you deeply for contributing, and it goes without saying you are always welcome in our home, and must come in the deep of winter to sit on a warm stone bench by the firelight, eating soup cooked with wood heat, and bread fresh from the oven.

story:
My name is George Doulos and I have been in the hospitality and retail industries for over 13 years. I am here helping my friend and colleague Cornelia Teodorescu gather some funds to send in support of the rehab facility her mother is currently residing in, after suffering a stroke. Enough about me and here is the real reason we need the funds.........

We are the Missionary Sisters of the Passions of Jesus

Our monastery (home) is situated in Villanova Mondovi (Cuneo, Italy), while our foreign mission houses are in Romania (Oradea, Butea and Scheia) and Ecuador (Loja).

Now we are writing to you from Butea and Scheia, which represent two different realities, but inseparable because they both try to face the problems which are affecting this community: poverty and alcohol.  

Many families live in terrible conditions, both regarding dwelling, but also hygiene.  

The employment opportunities and, therefore economic ones are non-existing; the people are trying to survive by raising animals and farming a piece of land.

Winter is the most difficult time of the year, because the temperature goes to -20 or – 23 degrees Celsius and not all the inhabitants can buy fire wood to keep them warm. This affects mostly old people and children as young people try to improve their living and they immigrate, abandoning children and parents, often leaving without a trace.

We have been staying here for 14 years, working especially for the needy.  

Our activities in Romania:

Shelter for children with difficult family situations, now there are 25 persons;

A home for old and sick people, now there are 42 persons;

Medical transportation service, with an ambulance, to the hospital;

Distribution of food, clothing, teaching materials, medicines to the poor; 

Oratory (it is educating children, young people in cooperation with the pastoral life of the parish);

 Initiatives to promote and encourage the economic activities of the poor (agriculture, tailoring);


A new project is in progress: a home for the recovery of young people, slaves of alcohol and for the treatment of the sick and the old without family.

Has been created in 2004 for helping children with serious family problems or those abandoned by their parents, forced by great poverty to immigrate. At first the structure allowed only girls in, but in order to satisfy the received requirements and not to separate brothers and sisters, very close to each other and already traumatized by their parents' separation, little by little we also accepted boys. We are trying to give moral and also material support to all "our" children, in "an environment as quiet as possible".   Our wish is to offer them affection and education, to ease the pain they carry in their soul, however we will try to teach them to take care of smaller children and to visit old people because we believe that it is important for them to grow up taking care of those around them.

We are trying, to the allowed extent, to improve the relations with their natural families.

THE HOME OF THE OLD AND THE SICK

 It is a home that can host approximately 42 people. Unfortunately we cannot satisfy all the requirements we receive every day, but the house is always full.   

In Italy, the homes for old people usually host persons over 70-75 years, in Romania the physical decay comes much earlier, due to the hard work in the field, the difficult hygiene and sanitary conditions and the alcohol which continues to be a serious problem for this country.  Our program includes a physical (physical therapy), psychological, mental and moral recovery. Together with the children from the House of Mother Carla's Family and with those from the country side we often organize plays, concerts and dances to offer them a smile and to make them feel less the burden of sickness and old age.

THE MEDICAL CENTRE

The Medical Centre is offering the possibility, to those in need and especially to poor families, to benefit from a medical examination performed by specialists in gynecology, cardiology, ultrasound, physiotherapy, ophthalmology, neurology, etc.

With an ambulance (donated by Italy) we provide transportation to the hospital (which is at a distance of approximately 70 km).

Since starting the mission in Butea we have offered home care to the sick and the old; as most of them are alone, their children having migrated in search of a job. 

Together with the pastoral life of the parish we are educating young people from the country side to be generous and to visit the poor children and the old and sick people from Butea.

Every day children, old people and entire families come to our monastery to ask for food, clothing, teaching materials and medicines. 

NEW PROJECT: Scheia, 8 km away from Butea 

We want to bring to your attention a new project, meant to help the young people who are the slaves of alcohol, a problem which has destroyed many families from this country. 

The severe regime Romania had to endure left many wounds in peoples' hearts. Therefore, these people look for consolation in alcohol, keeping all the sorrow inside of them and isolating themselves from the world. 

In Scheia, a village located at 8 km away Butea, lived a well-known priest, Father Iosif Andrici, who in his life always helped the needy, trying to offer them physical, economical and spiritual help. 

Father Andrici wanted us to help him continue this project of supporting the poor and, after his passing, Bishop Petru Gherghel trusted us with this mission. 

It's been three years since we are trying to reorganize, with the help of some volunteers, the old house and now it is functional.  

In the night of 3rd to 4th of May 2013, we have been put to a difficult test: the house renovated with enormous sacrifices, which already had been inhabited by young people unemployed and with severe family problems and some rooms which some of the volunteers, with great effort, arranged to be appropriate for dental, eye and periodontal examinations, all free of charge, have been lost in a powerful fire. 

After a few days of sorrow and pain, we have been abandoned to God's will.  

We started by rebuilding the house in the memory of Father Andrici. For our mission any economic and volunteer help is of the essence. Now we should build a new roof for the building where the medical studies are conducted. 

We haven't let this ordeal stop us, but we continued to accomplish Father Andrici's will, with a very specific project of 40 beds for paralyzed persons, older people and for the recovery of young people, slaves of alcohol.  

Now we are in January 2014, the diggings for the foundations are finished and we have started the actual construction.

 

We only need to keep our hand stretched and to present to you our serious economic needs, with the purpose of completing these works for those in need. 

We have trust in your good heart, being confident that the nobleness of your heart will give an answer to our call, with the hope of being capable to finish this building as there are so many people in sorrow, sometimes desperate, and which expect your help and ours. 

Thank you in advance and please receive my warm wishes 

Sister Elizabeth Barolo and community

We are trying to make the lives of all the patients a little easier, more comfortable w successful rehabilitation program, help us achieve this goal and bring smiles to all. Especially the young orphans who have no one.

Butea we have offered home care to the sick and the old; as most of them are
alone, their children having migrated in search of a job. Together with the pastoral life of the parish we are educating young people from the country side to be generous and to visit the poor children and the old and sick people from Butea.Every day children, old people and entire families come to our monastery to ask for food, clothing, teaching materials and medicines. NEW PROJECT: Scheia, 8 km away from Butea We want to bring to your attention a new project, meant to help the young people who are the slaves of alcohol, a problem which has destroyed many families from this country. The severe regime Romania had to endure left many wounds in peoples' hearts. Therefore, these people look for consolation in alcohol, keeping all the sorrow inside of them and isolating themselves from the world. In Scheia, a village located at 8 km away Butea, lived a well-known priest, Father Iosif Andrici, who in his life always helped the needy, trying to offer them physical, economical and spiritual help. Father Andrici wanted us to help him continue this project of supporting the poor and, after his passing, Bishop Petru Gherghel trusted us with this mission. It's been three years since we are trying to reorganize, with the help of some volunteers, the old house and now it is functional.  In the night of 3rd to 4th of May 2013, we have been put to a difficult test: the house renovated with enormous sacrifices, which already had been inhabited by young people unemployed and with severe family problems and some rooms which some of the volunteers, with great effort, arranged to be appropriate for dental, eye and periodontal examinations, all free of charge, have been lost in a powerful fire. After a few days of sorrow and pain, we have been abandoned to God's will.  We started by rebuilding the house in the memory of Father Andrici. For our mission any economic and volunteer help is of the essence. Now we should build a new roof for the building where the medical studies are conducted. We haven't let this ordeal stop us, but we continued to accomplish Father Andrici's will, with a very specific project of 40 beds for paralyzed persons, older people and for the recovery of young people, slaves of alcohol.  Now we are in January 2014, the diggings for the foundations are finished and we have started the actual construction.  We only need to keep our hand stretched and to present to you our serious economic needs, with the purpose of completing these works for those in need. We have trust in your good heart, being confident that the nobleness of your heart will give an answer to our call, with the hope of being capable to finish this building as there are so many people in sorrow, sometimes desperate, and which expect your help and ours. Thank you in advance and please receive my warm wishes Sister Elizabeth Barolo and communityWe are trying to make the lives of all the patients a little easier, more comfortable w successful rehabilitation program, help us achieve this goal and bring smiles to all. Especially the young orphans who have no one.

story:
About Aiding-AJ:

AJ was working 2nd shift as a facility supervisor when he fell through a poorly constructed mezzanine (over 10ft to a cement floor) and destroyed two discs in his spinal column. He has been out of work since 2010 due to the severity of this injury.

I (and many of you) have been blessed with being one of AJs friends. He is one of the most caring, honest, hard working, multi-talented and dedicated people I know. Since the accident it seems that life does not want to give him a break. Not only has this injury caused physical damage, but it has been an emotional and financial struggle as well.

All the money we raise will go directly to AJ to cover his medical and recovery expenses; we will literally be helping him “get back on his feet again”.

What We Need & What You Get:

The goal of “Aiding-AJ” is to raise $1,000 (or more!) to cover post-op expenses like mobility equipment, medications and first aid supplies, doctor/lawyer fees, even gas money for trips to-and-from physical therapy. AJ will be in recovery for 3 months, maybe more, and even after that there is still only a 60% chance that this surgery will be a long term success.

If you can’t give a monetary donation, just spreading the word will help! Or you can help us by giving “perks” to help raise funds, whether it be your time, talent, or treasure. Please contact me (Chris) for how you can help! Some examples of what you’ll get if you donate:

-Signed thank you card with photo of AJ in his hospital bed, and Lurch in a nurse outfit

-A signed CD of Dark Days Here by AJs band In The Red

-Your name will be included in the album cover of next printing of Dark Days Here

-Significant donations will get you (2) hours of DJ entertainment for a private party hosted by Do It Up Productions DJ & Karaoke Services!

 

About AJ:

“The accident happened in August 2009 when I fell through the floor of the mezzanine and fell 10ft onto a concert floor and landed on my back. I was out for a month, but it started to show in May 2010. I was at work on my computer and got up and something popped in my lower back. It felt like electricity was shooting down my spine and down my legs, I couldn't move. I went to talk to my doctor and he ordered my original MRI and that's what it came up with [herniated discs]. The result was determined from my original accident. I did physical therapy, spinal injections, pain medications, and nothing helped make it better. So now they want to try this procedure hoping it helps and I won't have to come back anytime soon for a fusion or artificial discs” - AJ

For more information on endoscopic discectomy please visit:

http://www.laserspineinstitute.com/spinal_orthopedic_procedures/percutaneous_endoscopic_discectomy/

http://www.stmh.org/

A.J. has been singing his entire life; it runs in his family. His father being the lead singer in the church choir and his sister was also blessed with a beautiful voice. A.J. and his sister sang for the youth choir at church every week when he was a teenager, but he was always into heavier music. His influences are Alice in Chains, Staind, Cold, Stone Sour, Slipknot, Disturbed, Korn, Killswitch Engage, and Parkway Drive. A.J. was in a few bands but they never really got where he wanted. So to fulfill his music needs he started going to karaoke nights every week and just kept singing. Constantly getting compliments about his voice and people saying he should go on American Idol, A.J. just kept true to himself and his music. After replying to an add from Pete Rizzo of "In the Red" about an audition for the lead singer, A.J. went to the audition and got the position for the band the first night! A.J. is very passionate about music and loves to play in front of a crowd. He wants to do what his influences have done for him: write music that connects with someone. Music that can help them out with their problems, or even just to get them through the day.

story:
Short Summary

Hej Hej! My name is Bektu and I'm a student in my final year of a masters programme in Public Health Sciences, in Stockholm, Sweden. 

Instead of taking a well deserved vacation after graduation.. I'll be heading to Kisumu, Kenya this summer! I will be working as a health project manager with Students for International Development (http://www.sidcanada.org/). It's a wonderful organization that allows students to pursue their interests in a number of sectors in low income countries. I'll be working in the health sector, in partnership with the Kenya Ministry of health to implement a public health camp and jiggers campaign in that community (see the gallerry tab for visuals).

SID is also a charity organization that counts on fundraising to achieve its project goals. My aim is to raise $1500 for my work in Kenya... and I need your help to make that possible!

Here's the low down on the work I'll be doing...

  • Jiggers (Deworming) Campaign: Jiggers is a skin disease caused by the ‘jigger flea’, which is found in tropical regions around the world. The disease itself is relatively easily treated, but because it is the by-product of a multitude of other factors (socio-economic status, education, etc), it is generally overlooked by major development agencies. Locals in Kenya called it a ‘disease of poverty’. Without treatment, individuals who are heavily infested suffer from malnutrition, and the open sores can lead to gangrene, tetanus, and death. In 2013, SID ran a jiggers campaign to treat those in the community suffering from jiggers; beyond treatment, SID conducted education and cleaned/fumigated houses in the hopes of creating a more lasting impact. This year, SID is looking to continue but also expand on the work done last year, and in particular look to develop initiates that the community can sustain on its own throughout the year. 
  • Public health camps: Access to care in Kenya is limited for many due to financial constraints. For many, the ability to have basic and primary healthcare is beyond their means. Public health camps provide a segway into the health system, giving people a point of access to otherwise unaffordable care. Public health camps aim to provide those in the community with basic treatment; each year, SID treats at least 500 people in a single day, providing disease testing for malaria and HIV, conducting cervical cancer screening for women, vaccinating children, and providing basic medications. 
  • My fundraising goal is $1500. 
  • Your donation will help pay for community health workers, nurses, clinical staff, as well as drugs and medical supplies!
  • Did I mention SID is a recognized charity organization and your donation is TAX DEDUCTIBLE?! :) 

The Impact 

  • You will be providing people with an opportunity to receive health services that they would otherwise not receive, and in some cases not even think to seek out!
  • You are supporting my professional development dreams! I've always wanted to do health field work. Now I am with your help! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • PLEASE spread the word about this campaign to family and friends and tell them that you know me and that this project is worth it.
  • Let me know of any alternative methods to fundraise this money. I am open to any and all possibilities!

story:
Devera Naturals, Est. 2006

Devera Naturals is a brand of skincare products that are 100% natural, vegan, and paraben free. We are driven to bring women and men the cleanest, and safest skincare products, because we believe that what you put on your body is as important as what put in your body. We strive to promote garden to skin in everything we do. After all, nature provides some of the best ingredients for for replenishing and rejuvenating skin.

Meet Linda

Hello, My name is Linda Joffe. I am the founder of an all-natural vegan-friendly skincare line, which I proudly call Devera Naturals. My friends say I'm ambitious, tenacious, and a lover of all things fashion and beauty related. My husband says I have a wonderful sense of balance in personal beauty and a great sense of humor. I say that I am a survivor with a zest for life. Skincare and garden products have been a passion of mine for many years. The culmination of this passion came in 2006 when I began researching and developing my products and then launched Devera Naturals.


The Catalyst for Devera Naturals

My quest for truly natural beauty products began with a diagnosis of breast cancer in June of 2004. While battling cancer and chemotherapy, I coped with a variety of side effects including hair loss, dry patchy skin and considerable weight loss. It was a struggle to feel beautiful especially when the beauty products I used to love contained chemicals and parabens which were harmful to my body. This led me to the creation and launch of Devera Naturals skincare line in 2006. Not only are my products  100% natural, they are made with cutting edge natural ingredients, such as plant stem cells and goji berry extract, with proven results.

Ingredients Glossary

Since the establishment of Devera Naturals, we have experienced success  connecting with recovering cancer patients at post mastectomy boutiques and hospitals across the country.

Some boutiques that carry Devera Naturals are:

  • Hope's Boutique at the Stephanie Spielman Comprehensive Breast Cancer Center at The Ohio State University
  • The Boutique at Yale at the Smilow Cancer Hospital at Yale University
  • The Boutique of Hope at Banner MDAnderson Cancer Hospital
  • The Fitting Room at Cancer Treatment Centers of America
Hear from a seasoned make-up artist, and cancer survivor about why pure skin cleansing products are best for beauty and health: 



Now our campaign is to help enhance the beauty of ALL women... naturally.

                                                                                                                                                                      But my dreams have exceeded my current reality and a larger production and distribution site is needed in order to achieve that dream. Based on our current customer loyalty I am confident we can expand our retail base to include salons, spas, and beauty stores. With your help in backing my project, we can reach our goal.  So, with the truest form of sincerity, we hope you will find our cause worthy of your generosity. We need your help! 


What We Need & What You Get

Our first financial goal is $60,000. This would allow us to increase our marketing to a much broader customer base. Additionally, we would expand our production and add several new products. 

Select one of our perks to support our growth ambitions! Most importantly get the word out! We believe that everyone should equally be as conscious about what they put on there bodies as well as in them.


The Impact

An annual mammogram saved my life. Now Devera Naturals is a proud sponsor of the National Breast Cancer Foundation. NBCF's mission is to save lives through early detection by providing mammograms for disadvantaged women and follow up care should they need it. A percentage of each Devera Naturals product sold is donated to the National Breast Cancer Foundation. Your contribution will make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

We have seen how successful our products are in our current market and now I am dedicated to the expansion of Devera Naturals. We have chosen Indiegogo as our pathway to growth. Every donor will impact our success in creating safe and healthy products that are results driven.

By backing this campaign you are helping an established boutique brand to grow. We currently have the capabilities to fulfill all orders coming from this campaign, so the only risk is that we don't get enough attention to bring our products to a store near you.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute to our cause, that doesn't mean you can't help! It would be greatly appreciated if you follow and interact with our social media accounts (@DeveraNaturals on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook). You can do this by sharing, commenting, and liking our posts or creating your own posts and tagging us! We want you to help us make some noise about our campaign. You can also utilize the Indiegogo share tools!

    Featured On

    Capital Style 

    Columbus Underground

    The Metropreneur Columbus

    Natural Awakenings Magazine

    Ask A Salon: Beauty Crew Review

    USA Today Modern Woman! 

    Devera Naturals is featured in the Emmy Awards gift bags! 

    Celebrate Local, Columbus Ohio

story:
31 Videos For Mental Illness

I would first like to thank you, from the bottom of my heart for visiting this page and actively taking a part in something that is very important to me.  First, I would like to explain to you what I am planning on doing and then of course the most important component why I am doing this campaign.

What are you planning on doing?

Well, I thought about this idea for a while and decided to use my knowledge and skills in video for good and change.  I came up with the idea to create a video every day during the month of May (31 videos) all with a mental health theme on my YouTube channel.  Since May is both Mental Health Awareness Month and my birthday it seems to be the best time to get the message out and spread the word.  If you cannot donate to this campaign, that's completely fine I understand, even if you just share the videos and spread the word about mental illness and mental health you are greatly helping the movement.  I appreciate that dearly.

Why are you supporting mental health and ActiveMinds.org?

Mental illness is something that has affected me ever since I can remember.  I was diagnosed with OCD (Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder) and later developed an anxiety disorder that put me in the hospital several times.  These disorders ran my life to the point where I had trouble doing and enjoying normal activities.  I was afraid to tell my friends and even some people in my family what I was going through because I was embarrassed and most of all afraid that people would treat me differently.  I know there are so many people out there that have to deal with so much more than I do without a great support system.  That's why I am raising money for ActiveMinds.org and trying to help remove the stigma of mental illness.  So people feel like they can talk about it and get help when they need it.  Active Minds is an excellent charity working on removing the stigma associated with mental illness and dedicated to helping those in need.

Quick Details:

Charity- Active Minds (activeminds.org)

Charity Type- Mental Health/Illness

Contact Email- samrobertkirkegaard@gmail.com


Thank you for participating in the mental health and awareness movement.  The more you donate the better the perks and even if you cannot donate share the videos and spread the word! :)

story:
Hello, my name is Jessie Carlson and I am a soul adventurer. I have found many things that have sparked life and art in me, and I love to gift them and share them as often as possible. It can be very hard for me to accept financial support because the services I offer come from a place of genuine generosity. I love to share healing vibrations.

However, I know that there is a support network out there that would be willing and honored to pave the way for a smooth transition and receive the gifts that I have intentionally created. No matter what your support is, thank you. I appreciate the prayers and the words and the money/gift exchange so very much. I feel it all.

Namaste <3
story_txt: Hello, my name is Jessie Carlson and I am a soul adventurer. I have found many things that have sparked life and art in me, and I love to gift them and share them as often as possible. It can be very hard for me to accept financial support because the services I offer come from a place of genuine generosity. I love to share healing vibrations.However, I know that there is a support network out there that would be willing and honored to pave the way for a smooth transition and receive the gifts that I have intentionally created. No matter what your support is, thank you. I appreciate the prayers and the words and the money/gift exchange so very much. I feel it all.Namaste <3

story:
More than 80% of the children working in Cameroon’s three leading cities, Yaounde, Douala and Bamenda, are victims of child trafficking (UNICEF report). Additionally, UNICEF and other independent NGOs report that the North West Region of Cameroon is the leading recruitment region in central Africa.  This is where we are located.

Multiple stakeholders are engaged in awareness creation, which has helped give victims of child trafficking the courage to speak out and oppose exploitation.  Unfortunately, this awareness has not been properly followed by an alternative to the ‘pull factor’.  The ‘pull factor’ is the desire of many children to acquire marketable skills, such as a trade or an education.  Traffickers often deceive children by promising them work, training, or study opportunities in secondary schools.  Eventually as victims grow older and break off from their masters, many are forced to become survival sex workers.

GLOWA wants to address this problem by creating a survivors support center.  The center will provide these children with counseling, mentoring, vocational training, and job support services. We are looking for passionate people to join us on this journey!


WHAT WE NEED

The survivor support center is still in its start-up phase.  However, space is available in our current offices where vocational rehabilitation can take place. We also have an instructor and many rescued victims of child trafficking waiting to begin training. We risk losing them through secondary trafficking if we do not address the pull factor as soon as possible.  It is worth noting here that these youths are easily targeted by traffickers when they are lost and unoccupied.

The initial goal of this campaign is to acquire two manual sewing machines to kick-start vocational training.  This will create a sustainable alternative to the pull factor for children rescued from trafficking.


THE IMPACT

Vulnerable children often fall for the recruitment scams of traffickers, who usually promise an opportunity to learn a trade or go to secondary school. These children are disconnected from the greater community without friends.

Counter trafficking organizations are doing a great job to break the silence and raise community awareness, but this budding group of informed survivors cannot compete in the rough labour market of Cameroon, especially without marketable skills. As such, many engage in survival sex work, especially those who become pregnant.

These groups of suffering survivors (breakups) send bad signals to those still trapped in exploitation and play to the advantage of traffickers. Victims prefer to cling to their exploiters rather than embrace freedom because they can’t support themselves.

Your donation will help us address the problem in a sustainable way.  Working as a group, the voices of survivors will amplify to eradicate this tragedy.


HOW THE CENTER WILL SCALE UP

The center hopes to scale up by adding more vocational training options, such as hairdressing and shoe making.  The center will also be open to the public, who can help support these children by paying for the services they provide.  A “MADE BY SURVIVOR” brand is expected to be put into the Cameroonian market that will help fund the running of the center.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

•  Donate a used sewing machine or any other equipment that can be used in the rehabilitation center.

•  Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote the project on your web sites and social networks. Invite your family and friends to support the project.

•  Connect us with any foundation that gives in-kind support to charities in Cameroon

•  Discuss the project with your friends and meeting groups

story:
“Ours is not the task of fixing the entire world all at once, but of stretching out to mend the part of the world that is within our reach.”

-- Women Who Run With Wolves, Clarissa Pinkola Estés

a b o u t . m e

I am an educator and leader in the Women's Empowerment Movement, helping women and girls connect to and understand their female anatomy and physiology and how it relates to their creativity, fertility, sexuality, and personal power. Through a local non-profit venture, I currently teach women-specific yoga classes and workshops related to women's empowerment for teens and for women in recovery from addiction.

My experience has led me to believe that accessing our personal power through body-centered awareness is the key to healing the body and mind in order to actualize our fullest potential and effect positive change in the world. Therefore, my work as a yoga teacher/therapist and women's health educator emphasizes psycho-somatic (mind-body) healing techniques.


h o w . y o u . c a n . h e l p


With a B.A. in Holistic Health and Personal Development under my belt I am now seeking funds to support additional alternative educational opportunities related to women's holistic health. In this way, I can deepen the breadth of knowledge that I gained through my self-designed undergraduate education.

I am crowd funding in order to take my next step as a yoga therapist and become certified to teach prenatal yoga...

Please know, however, that EVERYTHING that I raise beyond this amount will go toward other training programs, certifications and/or apprenticeships directly related to women's alternative healthcare... and so I invite you to back me in support of this vision as well.

Funds beyond those needed to attend my prenatal yoga training will go toward:

  • certification as a birth doula and/or fertility awareness educator
  • an apprenticeship with a midwife or women's empowerment leader
  • attendance fees for workshops related to natural gynecological healthcare and/or women's sexual empowerment
  • other related opportunities

Funding is essential for continuing my education as I am not pursing a traditional path through graduate school and, for this reason, I do not have access to the traditional funding methods of student grants and loans. Instead, at this time, my educational goals will be fulfilled from study outside of university institutions, through certification and training programs in prestigious alternative educational settings, apprenticeships (both national and abroad) and rigorous self-study. 


p r e v i o u s . e d u c a t i o n


My undergraduate studies were an exploration of healing modalities from the ancient Eastern and modern Western worlds. I explored topics ranging from Ayurvedic medicine, yoga philosophy and practice, dance and movement therapy, eco-psychology and eco-therapy, eastern spirituality, and nutrition science. I am currently seeking to deepen my breadth of knowledge regarding these alternative techniques through further education; however, my long-term career plans will unfold in the fields of yoga therapy and women's holistic health.

As an undergrad I was awarded my college's prestigious Dean's Scholarship for 21st Century Global Leaders. I was further recognized when my senior project - an alternative guide to women’s sexual and reproductive health and empowerment called, “Radical Fertility," won the honor of a Baccalaureate Presentation. It is my intention to live up to the potential that my school's Dean saw in my application and that my professors saw reflected in my senior project.


m y . g r a n d . v i s i o n


I currently practice Thai Massage and Reiki and work with women and teens teaching yoga. I want to reach a wider range of women and so I intend to be a change agent in the field of women's healthcare by practicing as a Birth Doula, Fertility Awareness Educator, and Women's Wellness Empowerment Coach.

I will help women understand and take ownership of their fertility cycles. I will teach women and girls how to regulate them when necessary with proper nutrition, exercise, and with a range of healing therapies. It is essential that we learn how to related to our cycle as a sacred and empowering part of being Woman. This body-awareness empowers us in all areas of our life -- from our sense of creativity and personal power to a more holistic understanding of our sexuality -- and it enables us to conceive naturally and easily when we may choose to do so.

As a birth doula, I will offer emotional and spiritual support for women through the phases of their pregnancy with yoga, movement, and art therapy to help each woman balance mind-body-spirit and to claim her birth process. Today, many women are choosing to give birth with midwives, but as a doula, I would also make my support available to those women who decide to give birth in a hospital setting, which can sometimes be an overwhelming and dis-empowering, if not traumatic, experience for a woman in the throws of labor! In this way, I make myself an emotional ally and advocate for a wide range of women.

I believe a healthy woman is more fully empowered as a mother, friend, educator, leader, partner, and that the gifts of her balanced feminine energy are essential to healing the many challenges facing her world, society, community, and family today. I seek to support the whole woman and I know that when women support each other, we can better balance the many roles, phases and transitions of womanhood with greater ease and tranquility.

We have 4 different variations of these bracelets!


The first is a light blue bracelet with "Trans* Rights are Human Rights" written on it


The second design to purchase is purple with "Trans* Rights are Human Rights" written on it:



The third is light blue with "#bravetran: Some Assembly Required":



The Forth is purple with "#bravetran: Some Assembly Required":



100% of the sales here go to Parker's top surgery! Each bracelet cost $5 each (add $1 extra for shipping please!) therefore they will be $6 total with shipping!!!



If you want to buy more, you save!

If you want to buy in bulk, please email me at: uppercasechase@gmail.com


Here is a link to Parker's top surgery funding page

Please donate generously as this is saving his life!

Thank you,


Chase Ross

story:
How it all began

19 Years ago, when I was just 14 years old, I had a stroke that required brain surgery to stop the bleeding and save my life.  It took months of therapy to learn to talk, read, and write again, and eventually to miraculously walk again.  Then, 10 Years ago, while I was 8-1/2 months pregnant I suffered another stroke, this one leaving me with complete numbness and almost no control of the right side of my body, robbing me of the use of my arm and hand.  I suffered from crippling pain, cognitive disabilities, and depression over what I had become and what I could no longer do.  Finally, after nearly 9 years of suffering, I decided it was time to fight back. I threw down the cane I had been walking with and stepped outside, forcing myself through the slowest jog ever.  The next day I did it again, and over a few months I eventually trained myself to run.  I have a limp, struggle immensely, and I’m not very fast, but more importantly I no longer let my disabilities hold me back.  Now I use my past and what I’ve overcome as motivation to help others with their struggles, in particular a sweetheart named Dominic, whom I’ve never even actually met.

A Special Little Boy

8 Years ago, Dominic was born with Cerebral Palsy.  He is unable to walk, talk, or eat on his own, and has very little control of his body.  With no real form of communication, it can be nearly impossible to understand what Dominic’s thinking or feeling at any given time.  Relying on his mother and family for everything, Dominic’s life is hard to comprehend.  Still though, his spirit is strong and his smile can be outright infectious, making it clear that despite his many medical issues this is still a little boy both capable and deserving of love and everything else other little boys enjoy.

Dominic’s Wish

Nearly 1 year ago, Dominic’s mom signed him up with the IRun4 non-profit organization, matching him with a runner who would write to him and dedicate all their miles run to him since he cannot run himself.  That runner is me.  Having a major medical history of my own, I was deeply touched by Dominic’s story and felt a connection through his smile.  My family and Dominic’s have been in constant contact- I have been chatting, sending mementos of runs and other gifts, and dedicating hundreds of miles to him, including 5K, 10K, and half-marathon races.  Recently, Dominic’s family and I were contacted by My Team Triumph, a non-profit organization that allows the disabled opportunities to participate in official race events, using specialized chairs and able-runners pushing them the entire distance.  We have officially been invited to be members of their team in the Las Vegas Rock N’ Roll Half-Marathon this November.  This is truly an amazing opportunity to connect face-to-face for a life-changing experience, over 13.1 miles that will surely be full of smiles, tears, and indescribable joy.  Seeing his face when his mom talks about our families meeting and about running with “Ms. Krissy” is absolutely amazing- he truly lights up at the thought.  I have suffered devastating medical issues, I know what it means to be told what you can’t do, and I have felt the wonder and joy of accomplishing and experiencing those things… to be able to give Dominic that kind of experience and those feelings would be a real blessing.  To do that that though, I need your help.

Your help

Having medical issues and a family of my own, unfortunately I can’t afford the costs involved in this amazing opportunity. That’s why I’m asking for your kindness and generosity to help me get to Dominic and push him through this race.  I have set our target fundraising goal at $1000, but to make this dream come true in total we actually need to come up with $2095 ($1795 for travel and lodging, $300 for race entry fees.)  100% of the funds raised will go directly toward covering these expenses and providing Dominic with priceless memories.  Not only will your support help make this dream come true, but it will provide Dominic as well as me and my family with precious memories for the rest of our lives. As a heart-felt thank you and show of appreciation I will also be sending meaningful, personal perks to you for your help.

Please help donate whatever you can- no amount is too small or big when it’s going toward such an amazing cause.  Also, whether you are able to donate or not, please share this with your friends and family over Facebook and other social media, and leave us comments here to help us reach others.

Thank you so much for your time and your help, have a happy, healthy day.

God Bless,
Krissy

story:
Her Story

Karice Beatty is a 34 year old Mother of four, and has a heart of gold. She's the type of person that would help anyone, no matter how poorly off she happened to be. Now Karice is reaching out and is in need of some extra cash to help her get back and forth between cancer treatment sessions. 

                           The News

I personally, don't know Karice Beatty. I'm friends with one of her cousins, and just happened to notice a post in my Facebook feed about Karice. It stated that she was diagnosed with cancer, and now has to go back and forth between two cities everyday for treatment. Needless to say, that's a strain on anyone. Not to mention the gas, and wear and tear on their vehicle.

                          The Impact

Now you're are most likely asking yourself why I'm helping someone I don't even know? Well, not only do I believe in paying it forward, and being a good person. I too have been through what Karice is going through. My Mother was diagnosed with cancer when she was 30, and had to make the same trips back and forth on the VERY same road that Karice is going to be taken. A part of me wishes that someone would have been there to help my Mom.

My Mother missed many of her appointments because of financial issues, and she tried going for a year till she was 31. Sadly, she never made it to see 32, and that was now nearly eleven years ago. I think my Mom would have wanted me to do this for Karice, and help her in any way I possibly can, to give her the chance that maybe my Mom had missed.

                  The Long Road Ahead

I set the goal for this fundraiser at it's minimum to make it easier on people that'd like to donate. If we shoot over the goal, that's great, all the donations will still go towards Karice and help her with her trips. That also goes for if we don't reach our goal, whatever money is made will still be going to the cause. I'd like to thank everyone who donates, and I know Karice does too! THANK YOU ALL!

If we shoot over the goal, that's great, all the donations will still go towards Karice and help her with her trips. That also goes for if we don't reach our goal, whatever money is made will still be going to the cause. I'd like to thank everyone who donates, and I know Karice does too! THANK YOU ALL!

story:
Short Summary

Nate was diagnosed with a brain tumor several weeks before he was to start his senior year in high school. It was a very rare kind of brain tumor (anaplastic ependymoma) located in the fourth ventricle and into his brain stem. He had surgery to remove this egg-sized tumor on August 2, 2013. The surgeon was able to get about 95% of the tumor. The remaining 5% is on the brain stem. You can see all the details here:

http://www.caringbridge.org/visit/natesgrosso

When Nate got out of the hospital on August 27, 2013 he weighed 97 lbs (he is 6'1" tall). His tongue, vocal chords and parts of his hands had varying degrees of paralysis due to damage done to two of his cranial nerves. He also had double-vision and had to keep a patch over one eye and he had to be fed through a feeding tube in his stomach. In addition to going after the cancer, Nate continues to get therapy for the complications resulting from the surgery.

Due to the very poor prognosis Nate has with going the radiation and chemotherapy route we had to find another course of treatment. We are so very blessed to have found it.

The treatments Nate receives are very advanced and as you can see by the video, Nate's body is responding very well to it. The cancer is continuously getting weaker. Our doctors have also found the underlying encephalitis virus which caused the cancer in the first place and we are making that virus weaker and weaker with each treatment.

What We Need

We have health insurance but the only cancer treatment options covered by insurance is surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Nate had surgery already but radiation and chemotherapy are not options for him. So, all of our treatments for Nate since he left the hospital are paid out of pocket. The ongoing maintenance is $3K/month and things are moving in the right direction with these treatments but we could be fighting this cancer a lot more aggressively if we are able to treat Nate at home and get him IV Nutritional Therapy. Here is how we will spend the money raised with this campaign:

  • First $30,000 - Bio-electrical medical equipment so Nate can get daily treatments for the ependymoma, the encephalitis virus, as well as his damaged cranial nerves.
  • Next $6,000 - Three IV Nutritional Therapy sessions (each 2-day session costs $2K)
  • Next $48,000 - to be applied towards on-going herbal, enzyme, weekly acupuncture and bi-weekly advanced energy treatments. Nate's treatments are expected to be needed until July 2015 at a rate of $3K/month.

The Impact

Cancer is dangerous. The treatment course we've chosen has helped build Nate's immune system to the point where it is able to slowly beat the cancer. We know that if we can take these treatments to the next level, Nate will get better more quickly and be able to get back to living the life of a normal 18-year old. 

With all Nate has gone through, he continues to work towards graduating with his class in June. He's an amazing kid and deserves the best treatment we can all afford to give him. This summer he will start college at a nearby community college- he can't leave home to attend a school (as much as he'd like to) because of his strict dietary, supplement and treatment program. Once he is able he wants to get into a Nutritional Doctorate program.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we believe a big part of what we've been able to do has come from prayer, so please pray for Nate's health.
