story:
Short Summary

Hello World!  My name is Nicole Lundy and I am on a MISSION!!

                             

When I started working on my skincare line in 2009, I knew that it had to positively impact and directly help others in need.  Fast forward - 4 years later- and as we prep for launch, we are supporting one of the most amazing organizations by the name of charity: water to provide clean water to developing countries around the world.

The World Health Organization has reported that dieseases from unsafe water and lack of basic sanitation kill more people every year than all forms of violence, including war.

I absolutely love the mission and transparency of charity: water! Every funded project is documented and certified with a completion report.  (see more details about charity: water below).

So, this campaign serves a dual purpose. 1) To provide CLEAN water to a community in a developing country AND 2) launch an amazing collection of healthy skincare products that are GREAT for your skin, the environment and your life.

[PLEASE READ ON]

 

Introducing the Ne`lani Skincare Debut Collection - 

           

'Oh, My Goodness' CLEANSER:  

Our cleanser is formulated with potent anti-inflammatory, anti-bacterial and anti-irritant ingredients that cleanse your skin without excessive drying or irritation.  

The combination of key proteins, vitamins and minerals in this complex penetrate the skins basal layer to replenish devitalized cells.

Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:

Aloe Vera Leaf Juice - Aloe vera is very high in polysaccharides which act as a shield over the skin that keeps moisture in and pollutants out.  This makes aloe one of the most effective topical defense ingredient against the damaging effects of our environment.

Centipeda Cunninghamii Extract - An herb from the daisy family and potent with anti-inflammatory and anti-bacteraial properties as well as soothing anti-irritant benefits.  A series of clinical tests conducted at the Wellington School of Medicine demonstrated that this extract produced 50% more stimulatory growth in skin cell fibroblasts, which is the foundation of cell renewal.

Oat Protein - Oat protein has the ability to absorb excess oil, and help your skin retain moisture.  This natural starch also aids the skin as an anti-inflammatory ingredient.

 

'Now That's Amazing' TONER:

Our amazing toner is designed to improve the moisture levels in your skin as well as smooth and renew your skin.  The powerful extracts help combat the effects of stress, sunlight and other forms of environmental damage.

92.85% of the ingredients in our formula are from organic farming.

Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:

Pancratium Maritimum Extract - The source of this extract is a rare white lily native to the islands off the Brittany Coast of France.  This ingredient influences the dendrites that are responsible for the movement of melanin into skin cells, thereby inhibiting hyperpigmentation caused by UV exposure and stress.

Sodium Hyaluronate - Derived from fermentation of a vegetable source, this product mimics the exact structure of Hyaluronic Acid, a necessary constituent found in body tissues and fluids.  Its regenerative functions are effective in treating prematurely aged skin, induced by exposure to extreme climates and stress.

Rose Flower Water - Its origin is the famous Valley of the Roses in Bulgaria, where the roses are hand-harvested at the perfect time of year.  The water has been used as a soothing aid for centuries to protect and preserve many of the most famous faces in history.

 

'What A Delight' MOISTURIZER:

Now you can protect your skin with this rich and nourishing face creme loaded with antioxidants of Vitamin A, C, and E, combined with plant oils for maximized penetration, moisture retention and anti-inflammatory benefits.

Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:

Borage Oil - This oil is said to be one of the best sources of gamma linoleic acid (GLA).  GLA is noted for its effects on the skin and its ability to reduce dryness and keep skin healthy, supple, and young-looking by regulating the hydration of the skin.

Oat Beta Glucan - A fiber-type complex sugar derived from the cell wall of oats is very effective at activating white blood cells and provides the immune system's first line of defense against foreign invaders.  Oat beta glucan helps to remove cellular debris resulting from oxidative damage and speed up the recovery of damaged tissue.

Shea Butter - Shea butter is a remarkable, all-purpose moisturizer and skin protector, particularly useful for smoothing fine lines and wrinkles.  It leaves the skin feeling soft and well-moisturized yet not greasy.  The producers of our shea butter are women farmers belonging to farming groups and cooperatives of northern Uganda and southern Sudan.  Our support of these producers increases the value of the living shea tree engendering conservation of indigenous African woodland for future generations.

 

'My Saving Grace' SERUM:

Now you can balance your skin everyday with this powerful antioxidant hydrator.  Our luxurious serum brings a maximum amount of moisture to the surface while delivering cell-renewing nutrients deeply into the subcutaneous layers of the skin.

Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:

Phospholipids - Phospholipids are substances, which contain fatty acids, glycerol, a nitrogenous base and phosphoric acid.  A balance of sterols and phospholipids is important to healthy skin.  As skin cells die as a part of the natural process of keratinization, this balance is upset, and if the phospholipid-cholesterol balance is not restored, new cells will not regenerate or will regenerate more slowly.

Tocopherol Acetate - A form of Vitamin E, it performs as an internal moisturizer and acts as a free-radical scavenger to help combat lipid peroxidation.  Vitamin E is also well known for its antioxidant properties.

Rosemary Leaf Extract - This extract is naturally produced by super-critical carbon dioxide extraction and contributes antioxidant protection for the skin.

 

What We Need & What You Get

YOUR generous contribution will fund:

  • Our Product Production Costs 
  • Our eCommerce Website 
  • Secure our Intellectual Property 
  • Our 2013 Launch!
  • ...AND sponsor a water project in a developing country through our support of charity: water (www.charitywater.org).  See details below.

 

                                      

 

We are counting on friends, family and supporters to help us make our launch a great success!

No GOOD DEED Goes Unrewarded!

In exchange for your generous support, we will be rewarding you with some really cool gifts of gratitude.

$1- A Little Goes a LONG Way

  • Virtual Hug!
  • A BIG Thank-You and our utmost gratitude for your donation.

$10- Many Thanks!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)

$25- Good Karma!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $5 of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)

$50- THANKS a Bunch!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $8  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • Personal Toiletry/Cosmetic Bag (perfect for traveling - and great for men and women!) 

$75- You're AWESOME!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $12  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • T-SHIRT (S,M.L.XL,2X,3X,4X) with one of Nicole's favorite mantras - "You deserve to look gorgeous every single day no matter how crazy life gets. Period." 

$150- Hip Hip HOORAY!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $25  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • Personal Toiletry/Cosmetic Bag (perfect for traveling - and great for men and women!) 
  • T-SHIRT (S,M.L.XL,2X,3X,4X) with one of Nicole's favorite mantras - "You deserve to look gorgeous every single day no matter how crazy life gets. Period." 

$500- You are our NEW Best Friend!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $75  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • One (1) Complete Set of Ne`lani Skincare debut collection
  • Induction on our Wall of Fame on NelaniSkincare.com

$1500- Complete State of APPRECIATION :)

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $225  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • One (1) Complete Set of the Ne`lani Skincare debut collection
  • Induction on our Wall of Fame on NelaniSkincare.com
  • 1-Hour Gorgeous Living Beauty Consultation with Nicole on Skype (don't worry if you are a guy, you can transfer this perk along to a special lady in your life)

$5000- HAPPY Dance Celebration!

  • Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
  • Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
  • $750  of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)
  • Personal Toiletry/Cosmetic Bag (perfect for traveling - and great for men and women!) 
  • T-SHIRT (S,M.L.XL,2X,3X,4X) with one of Nicole's favorite mantras - "You deserve to look gorgeous every single day no matter how crazy life gets. Period."
  • One (1) Complete Set of the Ne`lani Skincare debut collection
  • Induction on our Wall of Fame on NelaniSkincare.com
  • 1-Hour Gorgeous Living Beauty Consultation with Nicole on Skype (don't worry if you are a guy, you can transfer this perk along to a special lady in your life)
  • Beauty Shopping trip with Nicole in NYC (products not included)

 

 The Impact

It is a great time to support small businesses! Ne`lani Skincare is doing its own little part to stimulate the economy.  Even a small business like ours can make an impact.  We are currently working with web designers, graphic artists, marketing/branding professionals, professional service vendors and manufacturers.  Our products will then have to be transported by carriers, which continues the cycle and keeps money moving.

[COOL IMPACT ALERT]: We will be donating 15% from each pledge of $25 or more to charity: water (www.charitywater.org).  90% of the $30,000 deaths that occur every week from unsafe water and unhygienic living conditions are children under 5 years old - reported by the World Health Organization.  Our goal is to support an entire water project in a community of a developing country.  Just so you know, a typical water project can serve 150-300 people in a community.  We will be recognized by charity: water as a supporter and we will recieve a completion report when the project that we supported is completed.  The completion report will be posted on nelaniskincare.com

                    
You may be wondering why we at Ne`lani Skincare chose to support charity: water.  Here's why.  Water is vital for life. It's also very important in helping our bodies flush out deadly toxins and keep itself regulated.  It's very easy to take having clean water for granted.  As a Beauty Expert and a Gorgeous Lifestyle Advocate, I preach all of the time that water is a key ingredient for maintaining your beauty.  From the bottom of my heart, I want every single person in the world have access to CLEAN water.  Everybody deserves it!

Make sure check out the [VIDEO] link - WATER CHANGES EVERYTHING 

Last but not least, we are making really fun and cool products that are GREAT for your skin, environment and your life.

 

**YOU can make a difference and be a part of this positive chain reaction**

**YOUR generous contribution can do something BIG** 

 

 Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word...pass along our IndieGoGo campaign via email, facebook and twitter.  It's easy to forward! Share buttons and links to this campaign are located directly under our video at the top of this page.

You can even tell your friends in person about what we are doing (if people still do that *smile*).  Tell your local spa and favorite beauty store about our products!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello World!  My name is Nicole Lundy and I am on a MISSION!!
                             
When I started working on my skincare line in 2009, I knew that it had to positively impact and directly help others in need.  Fast forward - 4 years later- and as we prep for launch, we are supporting one of the most amazing organizations by the name of charity: water to provide clean water to developing countries around the world.
The World Health Organization has reported that dieseases from unsafe water and lack of basic sanitation kill more people every year than all forms of violence, including war.
I absolutely love the mission and transparency of charity: water! Every funded project is documented and certified with a completion report.  (see more details about charity: water below).
So, this campaign serves a dual purpose. 1) To provide CLEAN water to a community in a developing country AND 2) launch an amazing collection of healthy skincare products that are GREAT for your skin, the environment and your life.
[PLEASE READ ON]
 
Introducing the Ne`lani Skincare Debut Collection - 


           
'Oh, My Goodness' CLEANSER:  
Our cleanser is formulated with potent anti-inflammatory, anti-bacterial and anti-irritant ingredients that cleanse your skin without excessive drying or irritation.  
The combination of key proteins, vitamins and minerals in this complex penetrate the skins basal layer to replenish devitalized cells.
Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:
Aloe Vera Leaf Juice - Aloe vera is very high in polysaccharides which act as a shield over the skin that keeps moisture in and pollutants out.  This makes aloe one of the most effective topical defense ingredient against the damaging effects of our environment.
Centipeda Cunninghamii Extract - An herb from the daisy family and potent with anti-inflammatory and anti-bacteraial properties as well as soothing anti-irritant benefits.  A series of clinical tests conducted at the Wellington School of Medicine demonstrated that this extract produced 50% more stimulatory growth in skin cell fibroblasts, which is the foundation of cell renewal.
Oat Protein - Oat protein has the ability to absorb excess oil, and help your skin retain moisture.  This natural starch also aids the skin as an anti-inflammatory ingredient.
 
'Now That's Amazing' TONER:
Our amazing toner is designed to improve the moisture levels in your skin as well as smooth and renew your skin.  The powerful extracts help combat the effects of stress, sunlight and other forms of environmental damage.
92.85% of the ingredients in our formula are from organic farming.
Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:
Pancratium Maritimum Extract - The source of this extract is a rare white lily native to the islands off the Brittany Coast of France.  This ingredient influences the dendrites that are responsible for the movement of melanin into skin cells, thereby inhibiting hyperpigmentation caused by UV exposure and stress.
Sodium Hyaluronate - Derived from fermentation of a vegetable source, this product mimics the exact structure of Hyaluronic Acid, a necessary constituent found in body tissues and fluids.  Its regenerative functions are effective in treating prematurely aged skin, induced by exposure to extreme climates and stress.
Rose Flower Water - Its origin is the famous Valley of the Roses in Bulgaria, where the roses are hand-harvested at the perfect time of year.  The water has been used as a soothing aid for centuries to protect and preserve many of the most famous faces in history.
 
'What A Delight' MOISTURIZER:
Now you can protect your skin with this rich and nourishing face creme loaded with antioxidants of Vitamin A, C, and E, combined with plant oils for maximized penetration, moisture retention and anti-inflammatory benefits.
Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:
Borage Oil - This oil is said to be one of the best sources of gamma linoleic acid (GLA).  GLA is noted for its effects on the skin and its ability to reduce dryness and keep skin healthy, supple, and young-looking by regulating the hydration of the skin.
Oat Beta Glucan - A fiber-type complex sugar derived from the cell wall of oats is very effective at activating white blood cells and provides the immune system's first line of defense against foreign invaders.  Oat beta glucan helps to remove cellular debris resulting from oxidative damage and speed up the recovery of damaged tissue.
Shea Butter - Shea butter is a remarkable, all-purpose moisturizer and skin protector, particularly useful for smoothing fine lines and wrinkles.  It leaves the skin feeling soft and well-moisturized yet not greasy.  The producers of our shea butter are women farmers belonging to farming groups and cooperatives of northern Uganda and southern Sudan.  Our support of these producers increases the value of the living shea tree engendering conservation of indigenous African woodland for future generations.
 
'My Saving Grace' SERUM:
Now you can balance your skin everyday with this powerful antioxidant hydrator.  Our luxurious serum brings a maximum amount of moisture to the surface while delivering cell-renewing nutrients deeply into the subcutaneous layers of the skin.
Cool [Healthy + Good For You] in this formula include:
Phospholipids - Phospholipids are substances, which contain fatty acids, glycerol, a nitrogenous base and phosphoric acid.  A balance of sterols and phospholipids is important to healthy skin.  As skin cells die as a part of the natural process of keratinization, this balance is upset, and if the phospholipid-cholesterol balance is not restored, new cells will not regenerate or will regenerate more slowly.
Tocopherol Acetate - A form of Vitamin E, it performs as an internal moisturizer and acts as a free-radical scavenger to help combat lipid peroxidation.  Vitamin E is also well known for its antioxidant properties.
Rosemary Leaf Extract - This extract is naturally produced by super-critical carbon dioxide extraction and contributes antioxidant protection for the skin.
 
What We Need & What You Get
YOUR generous contribution will fund:

Our Product Production Costs 
Our eCommerce Website 
Secure our Intellectual Property 
Our 2013 Launch!
...AND sponsor a water project in a developing country through our support of charity: water (www.charitywater.org).  See details below.

 
                                      
 
We are counting on friends, family and supporters to help us make our launch a great success!
No GOOD DEED Goes Unrewarded!
In exchange for your generous support, we will be rewarding you with some really cool gifts of gratitude.
$1- A Little Goes a LONG Way

Virtual Hug!
A BIG Thank-You and our utmost gratitude for your donation.

$10- Many Thanks!

Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)

$25- Good Karma!

Personalized Thank-You note from Nicole 
Public Shout-out on Facebook and Twitter (let me know if you want to remain anonymous)
$5 of the proceeds from this contribution will benefit charity: water, a non-profit organization bringing clean and safe drinking water to people in developing nations.  100% of the proceeds given to charity: water will directly fund clean water solutions. (www.charitywater.org)

 The Impact
It is a great time to support small businesses! Ne`lani Skincare is doing its own little part to stimulate the economy.  Even a small business like ours can make an impact.  We are currently working with web designers, graphic artists, marketing/branding professionals, professional service vendors and manufacturers.  Our products will then have to be transported by carriers, which continues the cycle and keeps money moving.

story:
What is Fittr?

Fittr is an exercise service meant to help everyone reach their fitness goals more effectively and intelligently.  After 8 months of development time we plan to officially launch Fittr's service on our website and an iPhone app on January 1st.  With your help we feel confident we can hit the ground running and help people of all types get in shape.

How Fittr came to be

Fittr is the result of a need we found in the fitness industry to help people, at any fitness level, to reach their fitness goals.  We believe people should have more options than only hiring a personal trainer to get personalized workouts, and we believe it should be much less expensive than the hourly rates we have come across.  We have found that many personal trainers cost between $25 and $75 dollars an hour, and this could get you in a group with strangers doing the same workout with people who may have different fitness goals.

So we created a pretty cool workout generator powered by artificial intelligence to help anyone reach their fitness goals more effectively and intelligently.  There are other websites and apps that offer a big list of exercises and some services offer a few pre-made workouts that may or may not apply to everyone.  What Fittr does that’s different from anyone else is that we ask you what your fitness goal is, how many days a week you are willing to work out and what equipment you have available.  All of this creates a very specialized workout program that improves with feedback from each user as they let us know what is working and what is not.

How the Fittr engine works

The Fittr engine provides it's groundbreaking workouts from a real time neuro cortical simulation that runs on a GPU supercomputing cluster.  The simulation's organization is based roughly on the major human cortical regions and includes the thalamus, basal ganglia, Perirhinal Cortex, Entorhinal Cortex, Parahippocampal Gyrus, Hippocampus, motor cortex, and our own speculation of the pre-frontal cortex which supports long term decision making.

By working just like a brain, Fittr's engine is able to work like no other system available. Through looking at data given by millions of interactions, it is able to make distinctions that are not able to be seen by even human eyes. By bringing together users weight inputs, Fittr correlates results with averages in other similar users and generates a workout plan that will get individuals better results.

The user experience

In order to understand what is and isn’t working we felt it was necessary to highlight progress for our users.  As you work out you can enter the weight you lift for each exercise on your iPhone and it will automatically track everything you do.  The idea is to enable all our users to better understand the improvements they have made which we hope will encourage everyone to keep working hard.

As a result of users’ improvements we have established a wide range of trophies that are rewarded for certain accomplishments and achievements.  Since everyone is at a different level of fitness and everyone has very different fitness goals we tried to offer trophies that apply to anyone.  So if you have a goal of losing 75 pounds and it seems like an insurmountable goal, Fittr offers trophies for losing 10 pounds, 20 pounds, and so on.  Our intention is to keep people on track with tangible goals in a series of benchmarks, and encourage people to reach their ultimate goal in a safe and healthy way.  And if trophies don’t get you motivated we have added a fun accountability feature that will share with all your Facebook friends that you missed a workout which we believe will get people going.

What makes Fittr truly unique is our variable process.  There are many exercises that can be applied to different fitness goals.  Take bench press which is a widely used exercise in most people’s programs.  If you were to do 3 sets of 10 reps you will get different results than if you completed 6 sets at 1 rep each.  To take it another step further if you were complete each rep moving the bar 3 seconds up and 3 seconds down you would have an entirely different workout.  Fittr offers millions of combinations like these which help anyone more specifically reach their fitness goals more intelligently. 

Our plan and what we're asking for

We have been working on Fittr for 8 months and we are nearing completion of our first operational version with many additional updates on the horizon.  Our website is currently up and with ability to create an account, so check it out and create a completely free account to learn more while we are finishing everything.  

We are asking for your help so that we can prepare for server costs, begin a basic marketing campaign, and essentially keep the lights on until we finish the project.  We foresee our biggest hurdle, initially, will be getting awareness so we have made plans to create a Facebook and Google ad campaign as well as contracting a search engine optimization company to help us reach larger audiences.  

How we plan to grow (Stretch Goals)

If we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal we have a long list of ideas we plan to make a reality.  Here are a few we hope to accomplish soon.

  • Make an Android app (iPhone app scheduled for Jan 1st launch)
  • Hire a nutritionist as a consultant to provide our users with excellent nutritional support for their fitness goals
  • Create opportunities for high school coaches and athletes to enable teams to receive instruction from strength coaches and allow coaches to monitor athletes' progress.  (more info to come soon)
  • Eventually embark on a larger marketing campaign

story:
Hi, everyone... my name is Kendra L. Saunders. Some of you know me from work, some of you know me from tumblr or twitter, some of you know me from steampunk conventions or concerts. Maybe you've heard me interview your favorite musician, author or fashion designer. Maybe you've read one of my books. Maybe you don't know me yet.


I'm about to turn 27 in a couple weeks and have struggled for the last 4 years with various health issues following a stressful period and an accident at work that landed me in the hospital briefly. A large part of the struggle has been faulty sinuses... my doctor has recently taken an MRI of my head and discovered that my sinuses don't drain properly because the tubes are extremely small. Much smaller than they should be! This has made an impact on my health in many ways including:

*headaches that sometimes become migraines

*vision problems

*hearing problems

*tinnitus

*dizziness

*trouble concentrating/sleeping

*pressure in my head

*chronically stuffy nose

*weakened immune system

*low energy

*panic/anxiety issues

 

I need to have endoscopic sinus surgery done so that my sinuses will drain. I've gotten progressively sicker over the last 3 years and over this last winter, I had two sinus infections and was sick for about 4-5 months straight. The doctor has already had me on several rounds of heavy antibiotics. Summer usually is better for me, and the doctor has determined that I NEED the surgery done by the end of summer or I could end up back on antibiotics or even in the hospital in winter.

At this point, I have applied for all of the financial help I can, but because I don't have insurance and because this surgery is considered 'elective', I can't get financial help. This is the most discounted price the hospital could offer me.

 

Before all of these health issues, I was a hard working go-getter with a huge personality and a lot of energy to spare. People even said they wished they had half the ambition and energy I had! I've lost my energy and a lot of my confidence. While this surgery won't fix some of the other health issues I struggle with, it will certainly help a large handful of them and help me to get back to writing books, building up my friends, sharing energy with others, interviewing people you love, making jewelry and trying to create a more glittery world.

 

The website only allows me to list a certain amount of pledge prizes but I would also like to mention that if you donate $150, I will write a short story for you, based on a word or phrase you choose. If you would like to do this, simply mention in the donation field that you're taking the "short story" option, and I will get in contact with you after the campaign ends.

Anything and everything you can contribute will be more appreciated than you'll ever know.

story:
EB is overwhelming emotionally and financially:

Eli's parents, Jessica Spicer (20) and Randall Burkhart (21), were completely caught off guard with Eli's EB. Jessica was just preparing to go off to college when she found out she was pregnant. Now with Eli's condition that will have be put on hold. Eli will require around the clock care. Daily wound care can take hours just for dressing changes. The costs of supplies are both substantial and unpredictable.

Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB) is a very rare genetic condition in which the skin and internal body linings blister at the slightest knock or rub, causing painful, open wounds. The risk of infection is so great that most severe cases have to completely bandage from neck to toe. The worst forms of EB lead to eventual disfigurement, disability and often early death. 
As the USA does not have anything in place for these patients, most are forced to go without vital medical supplies as well as parents working crazy shifts JUST to cover the extortionate bills each month as their insurance only covers part of the bill. All of this is on top of regular living expenses.

The only treatment for EB is daily wound care and bandaging. The daily routine is a grueling, multi-faceted daily regimen lasting up to 4 hours in more severe patients. Caregivers, often parents or family members of EB children, must work in tandem with medical professionals to determine and administer different treatment methods to care for EB wounds. 

Georgia, Eli's home, is the worst state as far as the help they provide for medical supplies. We have to do all we can to change this, medical care should be a human right in this day and age, especially for young babies with EB.

Genetic testing and dependable transportation:

There will be many miles traveled from Eli's Carrollton home to Atlanta and Lithia Springs where Eli's doctors are. Gas costs are high, car maintenance is expensive and there may even be times Randall will not get to work because of things required for Eli's care. He has already missed more than a month since Eli's birth.

Every cent raised for Eli and his family will be needed for all this and so much more that I'm sure we aren't aware of yet.

Genetic testing will need to be done on Eli to find out what sub-type EB Simplex Eli has. Finding out his sub-type is important to know because it will help doctors and his family know more about how to treat his EB. This is a huge expense that is not covered by any insurance.

Your contribution matters!

Every donation makes a difference. There is no amount too small and every cent will go towards Eli's care.

Your voice matters!

Every dollar helps but so does your voice. If you can't donate you can use the share tools here on Indiegogo to get Eli's story out. Eli has a page on facebook as well called Prayers for baby Eli. Prayer is the single most powerful thing one can do and it changes things. Share Eli's story and help promote EB Awareness. Thank-you so much!
story_txt:
EB is overwhelming emotionally and financially:
Eli's parents, Jessica Spicer (20) and Randall Burkhart (21), were completely caught off guard with Eli's EB. Jessica was just preparing to go off to college when she found out she was pregnant. Now with Eli's condition that will have be put on hold. Eli will require around the clock care. Daily wound care can take hours just for dressing changes. The costs of supplies are both substantial and unpredictable.
Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB) is a very rare genetic condition in which the skin and internal body linings blister at the slightest knock or rub, causing painful, open wounds. The risk of infection is so great that most severe cases have to completely bandage from neck to toe. The worst forms of EB lead to eventual disfigurement, disability and often early death. As the USA does not have anything in place for these patients, most are forced to go without vital medical supplies as well as parents working crazy shifts JUST to cover the extortionate bills each month as their insurance only covers part of the bill. All of this is on top of regular living expenses.
The only treatment for EB is daily wound care and bandaging. The daily routine is a grueling, multi-faceted daily regimen lasting up to 4 hours in more severe patients. Caregivers, often parents or family members of EB children, must work in tandem with medical professionals to determine and administer different treatment methods to care for EB wounds. 
Georgia, Eli's home, is the worst state as far as the help they provide for medical supplies. We have to do all we can to change this, medical care should be a human right in this day and age, especially for young babies with EB.
Genetic testing and dependable transportation:


There will be many miles traveled from Eli's Carrollton home to Atlanta and Lithia Springs where Eli's doctors are. Gas costs are high, car maintenance is expensive and there may even be times Randall will not get to work because of things required for Eli's care. He has already missed more than a month since Eli's birth.
Every cent raised for Eli and his family will be needed for all this and so much more that I'm sure we aren't aware of yet.
Genetic testing will need to be done on Eli to find out what sub-type EB Simplex Eli has. Finding out his sub-type is important to know because it will help doctors and his family know more about how to treat his EB. This is a huge expense that is not covered by any insurance.


Your contribution matters!
Every donation makes a difference. There is no amount too small and every cent will go towards Eli's care.


Your voice matters!
Every dollar helps but so does your voice. If you can't donate you can use the share tools here on Indiegogo to get Eli's story out. Eli has a page on facebook as well called Prayers for baby Eli. Prayer is the single most powerful thing one can do and it changes things. Share Eli's story and help promote EB Awareness. Thank-you so much!

story:
Short Summary

I have worked with Corey at my job now for almost two years. During that time I have learned a lot about him and his determined and hard-working attitude. But merely working with someone just scratches the surface on the window into their life. We all deal with pain and suffering in our lives, each coated in different circumstances. Whatever you can do to help is already immensly appreciated. Though Corey might not realize it, he is loved. There is a community watching out for him, willing and able to help. 

What They Need

Anything you can give. Christina stays home with their three kids while Corey is at work making it difficult for them to pay for things. They can't afford to be on the health insurance plan at Corey's job so they rely on Medicade.  

Give from your heart

If you feel the desire to give, then please give what you can. When a community comes together for the sake of others it is a powerful thing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Post this fundraiser to as many sites as you can and let your friends and family know there is someone in need.

story:
For all of you who have asked...

This campaign was a HUGE SUCCESS even though we did not meet the goal.  We are still accepting donations through our fiscal sponsor, the NATIONAL INDIAN YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROJECT. (www.niylp.org)  All donations are a tax-deduction.  

This site will remain online, so please leave a comment, click "FAVORITE" so that you receive our updates.    Mitakuye Oyas'in -                          

                         

 

 

                            “Our children are sacred; they're our future. 

          If we don’t save our children, then our culture won't survive.”

                                  Donald Warne, MD, MPH, Oglala Lakota

                                                                            

THE ISSUE - 

It's difficult to convey the  human challenges that people on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation in South Dakota are facing.  The infant mortality rate (IMR) is the number of deaths of babies under one year old per 1,000 live births.  The IMR on Pine Ridge is 300% higher than the national average - the highest in the US.  Moms face racism, poverty and psychological challenges.

WHY I STOPPED FILMING TO RAISE THIS MONEY:  After years of research regarding the history and reasons American Indians have the worst health disparities in the US, Kitty Farmer is producing a documentary film, What's in the Heart - Can't be Taken. (trailer) 

"The statistics on Indian health are heartbreaking - American people have no idea the unimaginable and preventable suffering our American Indian neighbors are enduring.  It's as if we're talking about a third world country." 

 

           New York Times/Wall Street Journal Statistics -

            Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, South Dakota

 

- 97% of of the population on Pine Ridge live below federal poverty line.  

- Unemployment rate vacillates from 85% - 95%.

- Death due to heart disease: twice the national average.  

- Elderly die each winter from hypothermia.  

- Median income on Pine Ridge is approximately $2,600 to $3,500 per year.  

- 60% of homes are substandard, no water, electricity, adequate insulation,  and sewage systems.  

- Teen suicide is 4 times the national average.

- Average life expectancy is between 45 years and 48 years for men and 52 years for women, the shortest in the Western hemisphere outside Haiti.

 

Indians are not welfare receipients.  The land and resources that have made the USA the most powerful country in the world were not lost in warfare, but rather exchanged for basic social services - healthcare, housing and education.  The exchange that took place is documented in 494 legally-binding treaties (contracts) and is included in the US constitution.


It's fair to say that after 200 + years, the government may never fulfill its' legal trust responsibility to American Indians.  In the meantime, our Indian neighbors need our help.  Programs like Healthy Start are critical to supplement the abysmal failure of the government to honor this responsibility.  Secretary of Health and Human Services, Kathleen Sebelius, calls the government's treatment of American Indians, "a historic failure."

Natalie White Plume & Angelina, Oglala Lakota - Photo Credit: Deanne Fitzmaurice

FASTEST WAY TO HELP IN THE MEANTIME -

One of the wisest investments regarding this crisis is in Maternal/Child Health. To allow Lakota babies a "healthy start" from pre to post-natal means a lesser chance of developing all the preventable diseases that cause lives to be lived very sick, short and full of suffering.  

HOPE and the SOLUTION - 

With Pine Ridge serving as a case study for the film, Kitty became familiar with the remarkable Healthy Start Program (HS). The Oglala Sioux Tribe (OST) HS program with barely enough money for pens and copy paper is turning the despair and statistics around - through education, nutrition, traditional Lakota values and emotional support for the at-risk moms and babies.

Last year, Roberta Ecoffey, coordinator of the OST HS program was told they had to vacate their offices due to asbestos.  A mold-infested trailer was given as a replacement.  Obviously unaccepetable, they quickly moved into a storage room behind a video store.  Recently, an engineer from the Indian Health Service inspected the room and declared that it was a health hazard due to high levels of rat feces,  which can cause the Hanta Virus.  Because of this, the heat cannot be turned on!

Roberta and one other co-worker serve over 380 mothers.  Shocked by what the HS program was going through, Kitty stopped production of the film, and became determined to raise the money for a new HS home. 

The new Healthy Start Center building will provide not only a space, but hope for a brighter future.  

Just down the highway from where the new HS Center will be located is the site of the Wounded Knee Massacre where 123 years ago,  290 unarmed Lakota women, children, babies and elders were massacred by the US 7th Cavalry.  Despite this unimaginable loss and trauma, the Lakota have a resilient spirit that is undeniable - they need our help in providing a 'healthy start' for the future Lakota Nation.

Many tribes are wealthy because of casinos, but Pine Ridge is not one of them.  Programming for HS comes from the federal government. The idea of a new building seemed hopeless.  So, the quest began – where would HS find a warm, safe office?

 

AMAZING TEAM FOR THE SOLUTION - 

 

While on Pine Ridge, Kitty also met with Henry Red Cloud, Oglala Lakota, winner of the 2012 World Energy Globe Awards, the world's most prestigious environmental award. Henry, a "modern-day Lakota solar warrior" builds sustainable houses and unique solar heating systems.   While speaking with Henry about the state of the HS office,  the idea was born that he could help by creating a sustainable, culturally-relevant building that is easily replicable on other reservations.

After reading about the needs of the program, Ritch Voss, AIA, LEED-A, Senior Associate/Architect of the Dahlin Group asked for his firm to be chosen to draw the plans for the new HS center.  This was a dream come true - one of the nation's leading architectural firms combining their expertise with Henry's ingenuity and vision to provide the Lakota with a better future!  The OST tribal council has granted 5 acres located in the center of Pine Ridge village for the new HS Center - a very convenient location for moms who often have no car. 

 

Your donation will not only prevent unnecessary deaths of Lakota babies, but provide jobs and training for Lakota men and women.  

The team will make certain to provide training and jobs first and foremost to Lakota men and women during construction. 

 This team has agreed to pursue the funding, design and construction of the new HS Center, which has the support of the OST Tribal Council. The team is uniquely qualified to see this project through. The National Indian Youth Leadership Project, a 501 (c) (3) will fiscally sponsor the project, so all donations are a tax deduction.

We're beginning PHASE 1 of a 2-phase project to see this building completed.

In PHASE 1, we'll finalize the design, sustainability features, permits, engineering and ultimately have architectural drawings to further raise money to complete the project. (PHASE 2.) In the event the goal is exceeded, all donations will be placed into a separate account for Phase 2 (construction.)

How your donation will move this project forward.

-Full architectural drawings and Engineering

-Coordination of all permits

-Marketing for Phase 2 fundraising, Travel

-Basic expenses for the myriad tasks associated with pulling this project together

Untold hours of work have been contributed and out of pocket travel expenses personally incurred to get this project to this point. We now need help.  

-Check our perks, some of which are made by Lakota artists.    Donations will also provide income for them.

 

Mitakuye Oyasin,  'We Are All Related'  (Lakota)

  Kitty Farmer - for the Healthy Start Center Building Team

 

TEAM -

Henry Red Cloud, Oglala Lakota, direct 5th generation descendent of Chief Red Cloud, one of the last Lakota war chiefs and one of the most famous Native Americans in history.  Henry was born and raised on the Pine Ridge Reservation where living conditions are extremely difficult.  For 10 years, Henry has devoted himself to developing his expertise with renewable energy applications that are environmentally sound, economically beneficial, and culturally appropriate. Today, Henry is a 21st century Lakota Warrior, bringing green technology and employment to Native American communities.

As Henry says, “This is a new way to honor the old ways." Henry’s efforts to bring renewable energy  to tribal lands have been recognized nationally.  In 2009, he was named an  Innovative Idea Champion by the Corporation for Enterprise Development (CFED). Henry recently was awarded the world’s most prestigious environmental award, 2012 World Energy Globe Awards.  

 

  Roberta Ecoffey, Oglala Lakota, coordinator of the OST Healthy Start program has worked as a research analyst for the OST Health Administration; the Health & Human Service Committee; Family Preservation Program; directed and managed the Oglala Sioux Tribal Youth Shelter; the Oglala Lakota College Project STAR that oversaw the development of a recovery program combining best practices with the wisdom of Lakota Elders regarding tradition and culture; Director and founder of the Oglala Sioux Tribal Crisis Center of the first chartered organization to contract under the Indian Self Determination Act, Public Law #93-638 to establish the first of its kind emergency shelter for abused and neglected children; implemented the Indian Child Welfare Act for the Oglala Tribe, and provided services for women in crisis; Lead instructor and director of research for the Columbia School of Social Work, Northwest Research Office in Seattle ; and worked at the Indian Health Services Mental Health Clinic while gathering information from Lakota Winter Counts (buffalo hides that tell a person’s history) to follow the effects of alcohol on the Lakota since it was first introduced.

Roberta is the great granddaughter of Chief Red Cloud and has fostered 42 children, 4 of whom she has legally adopted, one with severe disabilities.

 

Kitty Farmer has a life-long interest in the well being of children.  She holds a master’s degree in psychology and child development and taught special education in rural communities where she saw first hand the toxic combination of racism and poverty.  As a literary agent, she placed several books on the New York Times bestseller list and placed the title, Crossfire, with Oliver Stone, that led to the creation of the film, JFK.  For 20 years, she represented Larry Dossey, MD,  physician and author who is credited for over 100 of our country’s 135 medical schools now teaching courses in spirituality to medical students.  She was deeply involved in organizing 1,000 lectures during the transition while medical and nursing schools began introducing courses in spirituality and alternative medicine.

 

Lacey Gaechter serves as Trees, Water & People’s National Director where she oversees all the organization’s National Programs. These include the Tribal Renewable Energy Program, through which she coordinates the distribution of renewable energy systems to tribal families, organizes renewable energy trainings for Native Americans, and facilitates sustainable business development. . Before beginning her life with TWP in 2009, Lacey graduated with a BA in Environmental Studies from the University of Colorado, then went to work for the Roaring Fork Conservancy, the City of Aspen Environmental Health Department and the Aspen Global Change Institute.

 

McClellan Hall, founder and director of the National Indian Youth Leadership Project which holds the highest and only “model” status by the Substance Abuse and Mental Services Health Administration (SAMSHA/NIH) in Indian country for teen prevention.  Mac Hall knows better than any the issues Indian kids are faced with and has collected 20 years of data that shows his methods not only work, but in phenomenal ways.  His Project Venture program is in 18 states in the USA and in 10 providences across Canada.  Mac has received numerous awards, but most recently, the “Behavioral Health Award from SAMSHA.  He's also a member of the National Action Alliance for Suicide Prevention.  NIYLP, which is a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit foundation will act as the fiscal sponsor for all donations.

 

 Ritch Voss, AIA, LEED-A, Senior Associate, Senior Architect of the Dahlin Group brings more than 30 years of architectural experience to this project.  During that time, he has been responsible for project management, constructions, documents and construction administration.  Previously, Ritch has worked with Fort McDowell and Tohono O’odham Indian Tribes.  Currently, he functions as the primary coordinator for sub-consultants and manages all construction support services. Additionally, he is LEED-AP for eco friendly designs and is NCARB certified.  Fellow Dahlin architects, Michael Suchocki and Eric Muzzy will join Ritch in the design and creation of the Healthy Start Center.

 

 Donald Warne, MD, MPH, Oglala Lakota an adjunct professor at the Arizona State University College of Law where he teaches American Indian Health Policy and is assisting in the creation of an American Indian Policy Center.  He received his MD from Stanford and his MPH from Harvard with a focus on health policy.  He is a Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE), and a Diplomat of both the American Board of Family Practice and the American Board of Medical Acupuncture. He has completed fellowships in Alternative Medicine from the Arizona Center for Health and Medicine and in Minority Health Policy from Harvard Medical School.  He is currently Director of the MPH program at North Dakota State University. He is a recipient of the Dr. Fang Ching Sun Memorial Award for Commitment to Underserved Communities from Harvard School of Public Health.  Dr. Warne serves as policy and medical advisor for the Healthy Start project.

 

 

 Photo Credit for Mother/Baby buffalo and Miranda and baby Jasper, Oglala Lakota

Deanne Fitzmaurice  www.deannefitzmaurice.com

campaign_city: Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, United States

story:
Support Arch Supports!

My name is Lindsay Jack, which is in fact my first name, and I'm starting this campaign because I need new arch supports. Health problems with my feet began shortly after I was born when my parents noticed that I had inward turned feet, or pigeon toed feet. Some children's feet self correct but mine were not self correcting. As a result, I was required to wear steel reinforced braces on my feet every night to bed for two years between the ages of two and four. One result of having pigeon toed feet is that I also have flat feet. It might not seem that having flat feet is really all that impactful but it's a condition which affects my health every day. Having flat feet means that I experience chronic foot pain in the form of bunions (big toe pain), plantar fascitis (arch pain) and achilis tendinitis (back of the foot pain). Having flat feet also means that my entire skeletal structure is out of alignment and has resulted in both knee and lower back injuries. My custom made arch supports greatly reduce my daily pain and help me to walk comfortably but after four years I have worn them through. I'm asking for help, something I don't do easily, because I work a low paying job as a waitress and I am already thousands of dollars in debt due to related medical treatments such as physiotherapy. As my family are from a working poor background they are unable to contribute to my campaign in any major way. Your help will mean that I can get a new pair of arch supports which will have a noticeable, long lasting impact on my quality of health and my peace of mind. 
 
The links below will take you to my performaces pages as slam poet LtwothaJ and as one of the community organizers of the KW Poetry Slam.
 

Where's this all going?

For helping me I want to help you in return so I'm offering some bonuses most of them are skill sharing based and aimed at people who live in or near Kitchener-Waterloo. I am an acclaimed and winning slam poet and am willing to offer slam lessons. I'm also a trained bartender and eager teacher. I'm a certifide reiki practitioner and more than happy to offer distance healing to campaign contributors.
 
Custom made arch supports cost 400$ plus tax and come out to loosely 450$. I'm asking 500$ also to off set the costs of using the services of this website, about 50$. If I reach my goal I break even and can get my arch supports at no cost to me. If I don't make the full 500$ I'm still planning on getting my arch supports though this will likely cost me in the form of continued medical debt. I'm very eager not to indebt myself further.

The Big Picture

The reality is that I am a person with chronic pain and that I was born on the wrong side of a system that favors those with priviledge. Most likely I will experience some form of pain on a regular basis for the rest of my life. This doesn't mean that getting arch supports is futile though. On the contrary, any improvement to my daily quality of life is a BIG improvement for me. Right now, I'm on my way back to school and hoping to become a naturopath. I want to spend my life helping people who experience chronic pain conditions like mine and educating individuals on self care as well as communities on how to create better circles of care for those in need. By helping me today you are part of that work tomorrow. You're making the future now and helping me be better able to help others.

No Money, No Problem

I get not having money and it's hard when you really want to give money but you don't have it. There are a lot of ways you can contribute to my health and well being without money. If you are a distance healer please send me healing energy (indicate the date and time before doing so). Give me a gentle hug. Offer me your seat on the bus since riding the bus standing is painful for me. If we're comfortable enough I like foot rubs and they help. Most importantly, you can help me by asking me about my health and talking to me about my life so I don't feel so alone in what I'm going through :)

Most importantly, you can help me by asking me about my health and talking to me about my life so I don't feel so alone in what I'm going through :)

story:
Eight years ago, Carl Miron opened the gates on Colorados first real Offroad park, this was to provide a place for various types of offroading enthusiasts to come and play, from 4x4s to motocross, and everything in between. However that wasnt the only reason, Carls son, Collin has cystic fibrosis, a deadly lung disease with a high mortality rate. It was one of Collins major desires to be able to race cars, specifically desert racing. With the help of the Make-A-Wish foundation, Collin was able to build a great running racecar, and race competitively for the last few years, but that is going to come to an end, unless the park gets some outside help.  Over the last few years, insurance, fuel, and the overall weak economy has put the park in the hole financially, this year resulting in not being able to come up with the money to cover expenses. Carl, and family, along with a couple of other people, have covered everything out of pocket for a long time to keep the gates open, and provide this great playground for all of us in the offroading community, but the savings are gone, and the pockets have run dry. All of us that enjoy CORE will be without anywhere to play next year, unless we help out now. Please help give back, to someone who has given it all to provide us with this great facility!!!

 

We would love to find some corporate sponsors to assist in keeping the park open, so if you have any connections in marketing, for your companies, please contact Carl, or Clyde thru COREs website  WWW.ColoradoOffroadExtreme.com

 

Thank you everyone,

Clyde Roper.

story:
Short Summary

I am Steven Kopstein, Sharon Spiegel's brother and of course was quite surprised to learn last March (2012) that my sister was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer.  Sharon has always been an inspiration to me.

Although Sharon has good insurance, many of the costs of her treatment are not paid by insurance.

She chose a clinic in Spain that has had good success treating cancer with nutrition and other non-invasive therapies that seek to use the body's own healing powers.

The family supports Sharon in her decision and we seek your help in covering these expenses.

Your contribution will have an enormous impact in making Sharon and the family able to obtain the care she desires without worrying about money.

What We Need

We are seeking $5,000 (or more) to help pay for flights and treatments.

Any help you can provide, even small donations, will be greatly appreciated by Sharon and the family.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute, there are other ways you can help:

1 - Get the word out about this campaign - please use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANKS!

story:
A Smashing Good Time to Benefit Vagabond Kitchen.

Wheeling, West Virginia, United States  Food

It's All About the Experience

There are dozens of factors contributing to a phenomenal dining experience. When we serve folks at Vagabond Kitchen, we concern ourselves with everything from the way diners are first greeted to their experience paying their bill. One thing we think would enhance the experience we offer, is a new set of plates and dishes.

Vagabond Kitchen opened on June 8, 2014, in Downtown Wheeling’s historic McLure Hotel, after the Kitchen's Head Chef and Co-Owner, Matt Welsch, completed a year of interstate travel developing his culinary travel blog, Vagabond Chef.

Welsch visited over sixty different restaurants and culinary communities interviewing and working in the most diverse and superb eateries the country has to offer, and when he returned to his hometown of Wheeling, WV, he was primed to offer the area’s most unique and premier dining experience.

Welsch and his wife, Katie, opened Vagabond Kitchen with dreams of pursuing handcrafted food rooted in local community while participating in the revival of the downtown area nestled on the banks of the Ohio River. They brought years of experience and passion to the table but lacked the capital that most restaurant startups are afforded..

Bootstrapping the operation has been challenging, but the Welsches firmly believe they made the right choice. The response from the community has been astounding, even thoughit's still a daily uphill battle. A pile of maxed-out credit cards, along with the continual challenge of operating a high-end restaurant hidden away in the basement of a hotel in the recovering downtown area of Wheeling have left some goals unrealized.

One of the biggest of these unrealized goals is the improvement of the Kitchen's dinnerware. And for that, we're asking for your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Because the Vagabond Way is always a bit unorthodox, and in trying to give everyone a fun, we're funding our new plates by breaking old ones. At the end of January, we're going to have a party where we'll break old and donated plates. We're asking you to donate money for the opportunity to break the old ones, and the proceeds from that event will be  used  to the new dinnerware that really fits the quality of experience our patrons have come to expect.

We've done a lot of research into what plates would be best. We've considerd price, shape, color, durability, and style. We've learned that we need at least a grand to get just the basics of what we need. If we can raise more, we'll have the opportunity to further improve our presentation with more glassware, different plates for different menu items, etc.

If the campaign goes really well, we'd like to put some money into redoing the bar area and wait station of the restaurant. This would include a new bar with seating, shelves for display and merchandise, and a metal Vagabond Kitchen sign hanging over the space. We would need several thousand to accomplish this, but hey, we're dreamers, and we’ve seen first hand how Wheeling can make dreams come true.

The core perks for our campaign are the plates you get to break. However, at higher donation levels, we have spiced things up a bit by including t-shirts and catered dinners. We want to offer you value for your much appreciated help. Let us know how we can. Without you, there would be no us!

The Importance of Presentation

It may seem a simple thing to help a local restaurant buy some new plates. However, this subtle change in presentation will allow us to augment our presentation and improve everyone's experience.

By helping us buy these needed accessories, we'll be afforded the opportunity to divert our limited resources into other areas like staying current with bills and payroll, dressing up our space, pursuing our liquor license, or developing new exciting menu items.

We've come a long way in the past seven months, and that says a lot about the potential for not only us at the Vagabond Kitchen, but for Wheeling’s ability to really get behind and support a downtown business it believes in.

The Big Picture & Local Economy

The Kitchen is not just a place to eat. We offer a unique experience and strive to be a valuable part of our community. As Wheeling reinvents itself and we all seek a viable economy and healthy place to live, grow, raise our children, and pursue our dreams, there is little more important than funneling your hard-earned green back into local businesses. Every dollar that goes outside the Ohio Valley does simply that while dollars spent within the Valley continue to circulate and build foundations for our future.

By supporting us, we can afford to support other local ventures: farmers and producers, charities and organizations, people and families.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are innumerable ways to help both the Kitchen and Wheeling. In a city this size, one person truly can make a difference. Support the growing positive action in our area. Contribute to something established, or start your own. Know the path ahead may not be easy, but as challenging as it may be, it will be even more rewarding.

Thank you for your time, your support, and your belief in crafting a better tomorrow.

story: Hi my name is Lue and I am the owner of LueFit. Ive been part of the fitness industry for over 4 years and helped many people towards their goals of getting into shape. Recently my father had heart surgery that ultimately was lead by the lifestyle he lived which did not consist of eating clean and exercising. Upon doing more research of his medical condition I've also discovered some alarming information. We in fact are dealing with an epidemic of obesity in America. The numbers are "Astronomical" and diseases associated with obesity, such as heart disease, cancer, and especially diabetes is surging. 31% of adults are obese and 15% of children and teenagers age 6-19 are overweight. And despite obesity being a problem for all groups and genders, it is particularly severe among certain groups. For instance, 50% of non-Hispanic black women are obese. The numbers are shocking and unless we take control now, its only going to get worse. So I decided to be part of the solution and started LueFit to combat the problem. I currently work with 8 people under LueFit and they've made huge progress losing an average of 10 pounds a month by exercising and eating healthier. I am so happy and thrilled to be part of their achievements, however my goal is to help a lot more, especially the youth in our area. Our trainings are usually done outdoors, and unfortunately mother nature usually change such plans. Which is why I want to rent a warehouse and purchase the necessary equipments so that LueFit can continue towards the goal of fighting obesity one pond at a time and getting people healthy and fit.

story:
Welcome to Bam•Brush

At Planet Essentials, we make innovative, eco-friendly products that benefit not only the consumer, but also the planet.

We were brainstorming ideas for a product, and came across an article from about.com stating that 50,000,000 pounds of toothbrushes go to U.S. landfills annually. It was safe for us to assume the massive majority of these were harmful plastics. Plastic doesn't break down for hundreds of years, and our landfills are growing full of it at alarming rates.

Solving a 50,000,000 Pound Problem

This statistic stood out to us, 50,000,000 pounds is truly a mind boggling number. We began looking for a solution to this problem. 

Our solution is Bam•Brush. With Bam•Brush, eco-friendly meets practicality and affordability. Some eco-friendly products push the limits of being green so far, they become impractical. We made it our mission to not cut corners on making the brush eco-friendly, while also prioritizing the effectiveness of the brush, the brush's durability, and keeping the costs to a minimum.

Bam•Brush is made from freshly harvested bamboo, while the bristles are made of an innovative quickly biodegrading compound of nylon called nylon 4.  We've been using the brushes for months and we're pleased to announce the durability of the brush is top notch. The American Dental Association recommends replacing your toothbrush every 3 months. This is what we recommend as well, although if you do choose to use a single Bam•Brush longer then 3 months, we're confident it will go the distance.

Bam•Brush is Available in 4 Colors

Bam•Brush is 100% Biodegradable. From the handle, to the bristles, to the packaging.

Bam•Brush feels wonderful to hold. The handle is made from freshly harvested bamboo.

Bam•Brush is effective. Bristles are made of high quality biodegradable Nylon-4.

Eco-friendly doesn't have to mean impractical. Bam•Brush was designed with durability in mind. Each brush lasts 3+ months.

Each brush comes in an individual box. Orders of 12 will include the larger box. All packaging is 100% biodegradable.

Colors of Bam•Brush

Blue

Pink


Green

Natural

 For our Indiegogo video, thank you to Christiaan Welzel for releasing his beautiful footage with a creative commons license. Here is a link to his wonderful original video. Please check out his other work. https://vimeo.com/122393741

For our Indiegogo video, audio was provided by The Most Epic Music on Soundcloud. The song used is called "Tree of Life". Thank you to The Most Epic Music for licensing his wonderful work via a creative commons license. Check out their other work! https://soundcloud.com/themostepicmusic/tree-of-life

Project Risks
We have a wonderful relationship with our supplier, and we have already received samples of the final Bam•Brush product. We are fully confident in our abilities to provide Bam•Brush by the promised delivery time of June, 2015.

story: We have set up this fund to help support my dad's godson Jorde and the Nicaraguan family that he adopted while spending the last seven years in Costa Rica and Nicaragua.     They were all invaluable in helping my dad acclimate to life in Central America.    In the last year of his life my dad had relocated to Nicaragua to be more involved with this family and was helping to support them.     In lieu of flowers for the Memorial,  we ask for any contributions to help this family that was so kind and generous to my dad.

story:
Our Story

We're Marianne Murphy (English) and Pepijn van der Knaap (Dutch). We met 5 years ago in the UK where together we ran the kitchen of a busy pub alongside catering for numerous private events and dinners. Six months ago we decided to return to Pepijn's mother country The Netherlands and moved to the capital Amsterdam

   Beautiful Amsterdam  

 

Coming Home

The feeling of 'coming home' was slightly tainted by noticing the changes that have been taking place over the last decade. The European economy is facing a difficult time and as a result unemployment figures have reached record highs. With a population of 16 million people, a vast one million Dutch now live at or under poverty levels. The National Foodbank hands out 1,200,000 food parcels yearly and is sadly our fastest growing bank.

15.5% under 25 is unemployed, in 2008 this figure was only 7%

 

The Project

A few months ago Marianne mentioned that it would be a great idea to set up a business that would structurally give something back to society. With this in mind and our long term plans to start a catering business, the concept of AmstelKitchen was born. 

 

If we all could be of a helping hand...

 

AmstelKitchen will offer freshly cooked meals delivered to the doors of busy Amsterdammers. For every five dishes ordered we will cook a free dinner for someone facing a difficult time.

Once established we aim to receive around 100 orders a day. This would enable us to fund more than 5,000 free meals per year. Think of the positive psychological effect this would have. By putting a smile on their faces, we hope that the people we help will find the strenght to keep on searching for jobs and turn their lives around.

 

Our Partner

To make sure our free meals will end up on the right plates, we contacted the Foodbank Amsterdam. This organization embraced our project and the Foodbank has decided to partner up. 

Mr R. Keeldar (Food Bank Amsterdam) and Pepijn

AmstelKitchen's fresh meals will be a welcome addition to the current food parcels 

 

Our Food

Many people in modern society lack the time and/or skills to cook nutricious and tasty food on a daily basis. On top of that, supermarket ready-meals are not the freshest alternatives whilst take-away fast-food is high on fat and low on nutricion.

No time to cook?                                                    Can't cook?

AmstelKitchen's Head Chef Pepijn has worked all over the world up to Michelin level and is delighted to put all is expereince and passion in creating delicious and nutricious meals. Every working day, the menu will consist of a meat or fish dish and a vegetarian option. Additionally there will be two soups of the week, kids-meals and a dessert.

Just a glimpse of what's coming... 

 

Your Help

With our personal savings and the help of friends we've so far raised $ 10,000 but this is not enough to start AmstelKitchen. The total amount needed for a (reconditioned) professional kitchen, a functional website, delivery bikes and first stock is $ 26,000.

Therefore we'd like to ask for another $ 16,000 through this crowdfunding platform. We have listed a number of perks to show you our appreciation.

Thank you so much for your donation!

 

Marianne Murphy & Pepijn van der Knaap

story:
North Soccer Club

North Soccer Club (NSC) was established in 1992 to provide a competitive travel soccer program for the youth of North Attleborough, Massachusetts.  NSC competes in BAYS for the Fall and Spring outdoor seasons with our Winter season taking place at a variety of facilities throughout Southeastern Massachusetts and Northern Rhode Island. 

The club also runs Fall and Spring Academy programs for grades K-2, introducing these players to the game and developing the skills needed to move into competitive travel Soccer.

Devoted to maintaining this level of competition and success, NSC strives to provide reliable facilities and services to those interested in the game. 


Our Situation

Our fields need some work, to say the least. This past spring was the worst they've been in recent memory.  We are now in the process of implementing a series of fundraising campaigns to renew and rebuild our fields.

With your help, we hope to improve the conditions of the fields and ultimately, the satisfaction of our players and families.


Our Plan

For the purpose of renovating our facilities, we need your help and support. The renovations will occur periodically based on the money raised during each phase of the campaign. Our initial goal of $30,000 will help fund the following improvements:

  • PHASE  1 – FALL 2014

·  Renovating the U10 and U12 fields at Amvet

·  Repair irrigation system at Amvet

·  Work with NA Electric to install flood lights on the poles at Amvet to allow for practices when dark

·  Develop and document a yearly maintenance plan and have contractual obligations in place for that work (Amvet and Rose)


In order to fund the next two phases of the renovations, the subsequent campaigns will allow for the following improvements starting in September 2014: 

  • PHASE 2 – SPRING 2015

·  Renovating the U9 field at Amvet

·  Renovate track area at Amvet  (will become the new home of NSC Academy)


  • PHASE 3 – FALL 2015

·  Install fencing at Amvet

·  Repair fencing at Rose

·  Install sheds at Amvet and Rose

·  Install permanent team benches at Amvet and Rose

·  Install bleacher style seating at Rose


Risk

Our goals and timelines are aggressive.  The initial campaign amount will not cover the entire renovation, which is why we have implemented the separate phases of fundraising. 

The amount we plan to raise seems like a considerably large sum of money, however, we believe that with your help it can become a possibility. Our goal will provide us with the minimum amount we need to successfully fund these fields.  

Throughout this campaign, you have the commitment of the NSC board to continue to look for donations of services, time, equipment, etc, not just funding. This is just part of what we are doing and your help is greatly appreciated.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Along with your donation, it would be a huge help to us if you "like" the Facebook page www.Facebook.com/NorthSoccerClub and invite others to like it as well! Communicating our goals and incentives to as many people as possible is important. Spread the word!

We are also looking for supporters who can provide product to NSC such as loam, seed and fertilizer or services such as field repair, fence installation, sign installation, etc.  If you can provide any of these services please email president@northsoccerclub.com

Lastly, any questions regarding this campaign or future plans can be directed to Chris Hinckley, NSC President, at president@northsoccerclub.com.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
