story:
Asthma Sentinel tracks your location, activities, local weather, pollen, pollution, and more, to give you advanced warnings of situations which might trigger an Asthma or Allergy attack.


Using machine learning artificial intelligence along with data warehousing technologies, Asthma Sentinel is able to evaluate your current and future situations and alert you if an Asthma or Allergy attack might be imminent.

Asthma Sentinel will be available on Android, iOS (iPhone / iPad), and WP8.


Jump To: Technology | Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks | FAQs



Asthma Sentinel aggregates data from many sources, then runs this data through machine learning algorithms to find patterns and trends in your locations, behaviors, and activities. Using this data, Asthma Sentinel can determine if an attack is possible given your location and activities.

Asthma Sentinel is already collecting data across the country. Data has been collected since January 2014. In addition, we have found several sources of archived data, which we have already imported into Asthma Sentinel's database.

Jump To: Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks | FAQs


In making Asthma Sentinel, we have three rules that we adhere to:

  1. Make it for sufferers of Asthma and Allergies - Sometimes it's easy to add so many features and widgets, that the primary reason for the app can get lost. We focus solely on what is necessary for tracking and using data from asthma and allergy sufferers.
  2. Make it for busy people - Let's face it. Everyone is busy. Asthma Sentinel runs in the background tracking your location, weather, and more. You only need to launch the app if you want to record your activities. Asthma Sentinel warns you with alerts on your mobile device when possible triggers have been identified.
  3. Sleek design - You want an app that looks modern, is responsive, and just works.
With Asthma Sentinel, you can:
  • Automatically track your location, and time per day of visit (NOTE: This data is never shared with anyone)
  • Track your daily activities, such as exercise, working, grocery shopping, etc. Some asthma triggers are more common during or after activities
  • Receive notifications on your mobile devices when a possible asthma or allergy trigger is identified
  • View all the current conditions at your location (weather, pollution, pollen, possible triggers, etc)
  • Record when you have an asthma or allergy attack, its severity, and duration
  • View a history of your recorded data and asthma/allergy attacks


Jump To: Technology | Why We Made It | Perks | FAQs



  • In November 2013, Philip's daughter, Hannah, had her first asthma attack. She was 18 months old. She was rushed to the hospital when her breathing became too difficult. At the time, the doctors weren't sure if it was asthma or a more common childhood disease called Bronchiolitis.
  • In January 2014, Hannah had her second asthma attack. Another trip to the ER, this one requiring stronger medications and several hours to get her breathing back to normal. She was 20 months old.
  • In early April 2014, Hannah had her third and most serious asthma attack. She stayed in the pediatric ICU for a week, on oxygen and medications 24/7 for the first few days.
After her second attack, we started writing Asthma Sentinel to track her activities and find possible triggers for her asthma attacks. It took four months of work to find the data sources, build the machine learning algorithms, and regression testing, before Asthma Sentinel was ready - for Hannah.

When Hannah had her third attack, Asthma Sentinel's machine learning algorithms were able to identify changes in weather conditions as the culprit for her attacks. Her doctors agreed the weather was the most likely trigger for her attacks.

Our goal for this campaign is make Asthma Sentinel available for everyone to use. Everyone deserves to know in advance if a possible asthma or allergy trigger could affect them.

Jump To: Technology | Perks | FAQs



Philip Pierce is a software and game developer with twenty plus years experience in web, mobile, desktop, server, database design, and game development. He has certificates from several top universities (such as Stanford) in A.I., cryptography, and robotics. He has been licensed for development on three console platforms (Wii, PS3, and XBox 360).
Philip recently worked to port Temple Run 2 and Rail Rush from their Android versions to Arcade.

Mary Burge is a 2D and 3D graphic designer, with artwork featured in some of today's hottest mobile games and apps. For over twenty years, Mary has created UI and 3D models for desktop, web apps, and games. In her spare time, she designs 3D models for movies and short films.


Damian Montero - As Senior Developer & Software Architect, Damian Montero has been part of the revolution which is The Web and mobile for over 15 years. Always in the know with the newest gadgets and technologies. He not only develops for it but is a user of all mobile platforms and is in love with the field. You'll find him at all the major conventions talking with the most influential people. Having joined this team over 8 years ago; he believe's strongly in what the team can achieve because of all the great projects and all the great Hackathon winnings we've gotten over the years.

Mark Tennenhouse has over 16 years of software development for the web, desktop and server using the latest and greatest tools from Microsoft to build practical solutions for small and large companies.



Jump To: Technology | Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks | a> | FAQs




  •   Asthma and Allergy Buttons
  •   Limited Edition, Inhaler Carrying Case
  •   Limited Edition, Inhaler Carrying Case
  •   Limited Edition, ClipOn Waterproof Inhaler Case
  • Buttons and pins are courtesy of Chase The Button Guy
  • Inhaler carry cases and Waterproof Inhaler cases are courtesy of Alert Wear


Jump To: Technology | Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks | FAQs


We completely understand that some of you are just not able to contribute, even if you want to. However, you can still help us out. Here's how:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Use your Facebook status updates, Tweets, Instagram, etc. to create awareness
  • You can use Indiegogo's share tools to spread the word
That's all there is to it! This would really give us the boost we need while also making people's lives more convenient and less cumbersome. After all, that's what we're here to do. Thank you!

Jump To: Technology | Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks | FAQs


How does it work?
As our developer Mark says, "When you download Asthma Sentinel, it creates 10 tiny scientists inside of your device. If one of them feels an urge to sneeze, he pulls a wire which causes your on-screen indicator to display a warning. If all of the scientists sneeze at the same time, you get a much bigger warning. Of course, you have to supply tissues to the scientists after an event like this."

How it really works - Asthma Sentinel gathers data for weather, pollen, pollution, AQI, flu and cold trends, and more, for your area and areas you have visited while using Asthma Sentinel, in addition to tracking your activities. When the machine learning A.I. determines that an attack or symptom is likely in your area or for a given event, you receive a warning.

Will it tell me whether I am at risk when I go outside?
Yes, Asthma Sentinel will warn you hours before you go outside. It will even warn you when you are outside, if new data has been calculated after you stepped outside.

Are there events or activities Asthma Sentinel might miss?
At present, Asthma Sentinel is not omniscient. It only knows about places you've been, activities you've logged, and the associated data for those activities and locations. Asthma Sentinel can warn you about weather and outside conditions, but it may not have enough data about a new place the first time you visit it.



Jump To: Technology | Main Features | Why We Made It | Perks

story:
What is MX FX?

Hi, I'm Betsy Keithline and I'm the principal of MX FX, a solution to some of the most frustrating communication barriers that exist in the air travel industry today. With 15 years in customer service for a major airline, I'm the front line worker that travelers come to with any issues that arise beyond the security checkpoint.
One of the biggest challenges to my work is being uninformed of maintenance delays within the airline. Travelers often know about delays before gate agents because so many apps now exist to keep consumers informed. This disconnect often leads to frustration, confusion and inability to provide the best customer service possible. 

But, there's a solution to this headache!

MX FX is an internal notification system that will be initiated by pilots when a maintenance issue is discovered. Rather than the issue being recorded in a single log book that has the potential to create notification delays through human error, the MX FX system will immediately notify all affected departments within the airline, reducing time delays by allowing more timely responses and eliminating the confusion created between a gate agent unaware of an issue and a traveller who knows of a delay through their own notification system. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm very excited to have recently advanced to the second round of the Duke Startup Challenge! I have been invited to attend a summer innovation program in North Carolina, where I will be able to work with mentors and tech experts to bring my vision of MX FX to reality. I created this campaign to raise the $5,000 required by Duke in order to fully participate in the 2015 summer program.

I'm also excited for the opportunity to partner with friends who are also fellow entrepreneurs to offer fun perks for this campaign. Please check out the 6 categories offered. All support is incredibly appreciated!

The Impact

I love the work I do and know that the implementation of MX FX will only enhance the travel experience for people all over the world.

  • Flights that experience maintenance delays will be more likely to depart within a reasonable timeframe
  • Communication between airline departments will be seamless and will allow for better response times and fewer human errors
  • Frontline staff will have the most updated information to share with travelers 

Other Ways You Can Help

I truly appreciate that you've taken the time to read about MX FX. If you're unable to offer monetary support at this time, please know that I would be overjoyed if you would share this campaign with your personal networks.

Other Ways You Can Help I truly appreciate that you've taken the time to read about MX FX. If you're unable to offer monetary support at this time, please know that I would be overjoyed if you would share this campaign with your personal networks.

story:
We invite you to our new concept of a Fanclub Social Network Service through our launching campaign; Super Editor Season 1 

If you join our world changing revenue sharing program you can become a Super Editor of your favorite interest fanclub! The funding we’re raising will be used for the prevention of “Mobile Gaming Addiction”.

Time is precious and each moment you spend in our app we will  equally reward you back for it. Actively participate and promote us whenever you can. After taking in all the information we hope you will consider supporting us and fund us.

Tokata Reward Program
For more information and how to participate we refer you to the attached file which you can find HERE. 

Whoever joins our event and starts talking about their hobbies on Tokata through our Reward Program will be able to simply get a share of our profit.

How the idea of a profit sharing SNS started.

In Tokata users can leverage the content they already have on other social networks.
The problem that we see nowadays is that the social networks we use aren't giving back to society a share of their profits. While they seem to grow bigger year after year we haven’t seen any of them to share that with their users.

Big social networks like Facebook and Twitter are getting a lot of profit and rely on their users being active. You, as a user however, won’t see anything of the profit. But, what if you could take bite out of that profit?

We feel that if we created a community than we should show the users our gratitude which is why we decided to launch the first so-called Reward-SNS. 
Three principles of a Reward SNS

1.  Accessibility : The users shouldn't have to rely on using a website or application.

2.  Rationality : The user should get a reasonable reward for its efforts.

3.  Durability : Revenue for the user has to increase constantly.

In other words we feel it’s only reasonable and fair to be able to share the company profits in an easy and convenient way.

The difference of a revenue sharing program

In the current market there exists things like CPC (cost per click), CPP (cost per point), CPI (cost per install) and various affiliate programs but for the general public such earning schemes don’t exist. For those that have installed Tokata will be able to talk about their hobbies and make a decent earning, simple and fast.

How to participate in the revenue sharing program

1.  Help us fund this through Indiegogo with any amount you’d like and manage a fanclub of your choosing.

2.  After funding please install the ToKaTa application.
* Have a look at your desired fanclub beforehand.

3.  After the funding round has ended we will first give out the desired fanclubs to those who participated in our funding round.

4.  Within your fanclub interact with your members and feel free to invite others to join your fanclub
*Tokata supports Facebook fanpages, so people can log in with Facebook and they will automatically be connected to their corresponding fanclubs on Tokata.

5.  Profits will be distributed among those that manage a fanclub and according to the membercount.

6.  Those that participated in this program and bring in the highest number of people for their fanclubs will receive an extra price which is explained in detail in our document.

For whom this is more interesting

1.  Particular fields of interests like; powerbloggers, forum enthusiasts or just those that want earn an extra income.

2.  For those that really feel like “It sounds fun and would like to try it!”

3.  Those that want to have a fun interactive time with others.
*Regardless of nationality, age and gender we welcome those with an enthusiastic mind to be a Super Editor of a fanclub.


PDF Information

For more information and how to participate we refer you to the attached file which you can find HERE.

Who are we supporting?

*To be clear, the money raised in this funding round will be used fully for a good cause.

With the rapid development of the internet and mobile phones it’s easy to acquire a lot of information and with various people we can have fun interaction. But we are we also aware of the negative effects this brings such as; mobile gaming addiction. With this project we are raising funds for those that have problems getting connected back again with the offline world. During the campaign we will find a suitable charity or institute to donate the money to.

What is Tokata?

 Download

1.  Tokata is an interest based fanclub social network service.
Tokata gives people a place for people to come together and talk, share information on the interests that matters to them the most.

2.  We aim for Tokata to be a comfortable and fun place to communicate.
There’s also no need for any awkwardness when finding new people since you are already connected with those that share the same interest. The world’s most convenient and fast way to make friends.

3.  You can see Tokata as a general information center.
You can check up on the things that you like, the things that you need and the information which my friends like all within Tokata.

      
Download
If you have any questions or would like to contact us feel free to do so. Thank you for your interest.

story:
Je me nomme Nathan Fortin,

Je suis un jeune papa de 28 ans de Montréal.

Je travaille fort chaque jour et tente de faire mon chemin avec sourire.

Comme la vie dans ce monde coûte parfois plus cher que ce que l'on y gagne,quand les factures sont payées,il ne reste que souvent des miettes.

Avec ces miettes,on décide souvent de faire sourire ceux que l'on aime autour de soi,étant un papa.

Ce que j'ai toujours trouvé important et ce que je vous souhaite aussi d'avoir comme but dans la vie.

Mon sourire,dans mon cas,je n'ai  eu la chance de le voir que quelques années par un semblant complet peu confortable qui cassait trop souvent.

Étant handicapé dentairement de naissance.

Je n'ai rien négligé maladroitement.

Il surprenait déjà les gens a l'enfance.

                                                                     

Il me coûterait plus de 5000$ en frais dentaire après vérifications pour avoir un sourire qui égale celui que je rêve de donner aux gens autour de moi.

Si vous y contribuez.Vous saurez que réellement.

Vous avez donné un sourire.


Merci.

Nathan 


*Mon but n'est pas de vider les poches des gens pour mes problèmes dentaires,mais si seulement 1$ ne vous sert a rien en ce moment vous aurez le sentiment d'avoir fait beaucoup pour un humain.




Pour chaque DON. Je donnerai au suivant 10 sourires! 
Bientôt sur

***************************************************************************

                                                                     

My name is Nathan Fortin,

I am a young 28 year old dad from Montreal.

I work hard every day and trying to make my way with a smile.

As life in this world sometimes cost more than what we gain, when the bills are paid, there are only occasional crumbs.

With these crumbs, often decides to smile those you love around you, being a dad.

I have always found it important and what I want you also to have a goal in life. 

My smile, in my case, I did not get a chance to see him a few years by a full uncomfortable pretending. 

Being dentally handicapped from birth. 

I have neglected nothing awkwardly. 

He has already caught people's childhood.

It cost me more than $ 5,000 to have a smile that matches the one I dream of giving people around me.

                                                                    

If you really know that . 

You give a smile.

Thank you.

Nathan


* My goal is not to empty people's pockets for my dental problems, but if $ 1 does you nothing right now you will have the feeling of having done much for a human.


 For each donation. I will give the next 10 smiles! 
Soon on

story:
Did you know that in every 3 minutes somewhere in the world a child is born into the uncertainty of life with a facial deformity?

There is an urgent global need for surgery in low-income countries.

Families in poor countries don’t have access to free medical care and can’t afford to pay for the operation on their own, so children have no choice but to live with their disfigurement, if they livepast their first birthday. Sadly one in ten children born with a cleft will die before their first birthday.

The biggest business and leadership conference in Central Europe "FORUM ONE" accepted a “1000 SMILES CHALLENGE” from international medical charity organization “Operation Smile”.

Our goal is to raise enough money for 1,000 surgeries for children born with cleft lip, cleft palate and other facial deformities.

Together with our main speaker Seth Godin, celebrity guest Jean-Claude Van Damme and all other speakers of FORUM ONE we invite you and hundreds of thousands of people across the planet to unite and bring back 1,000 smiles for children!

A SMILE CHANGES EVERYTHING



How much does it cost to bring back 1 smile?
$240 helps "Operation Smile" to provide 1 life-saving surgery for a waiting child.

HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE
We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our social mission.

If you contribute to our social mission campaign we will give you a FREE access to FORUM ONE livestream.

It will allow you to join most innovative minds, receive fresh ideas, insights, inspiration and a possibility to experience FORUM ONE event from your office or at home as you were seated in the first row.

You can see our perks on the right side of this page.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can't contribute at this moment, that doesn't mean you can't help us:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    (it's easy to do that using Indiegogo share tools)
  • You can download, read and pass on a valuable eBook from New York Times bestselling author Seth Godin. It's called "GRACEFUL" and it's about making a difference in a world that needs you.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION AND HELP WILL MAKE A REAL DIFFERENCE
Together we can bring back 1,000 smiles to children who, due to facial deformity, can’t smile!

To learn more about FORUM ONE social mission, visit our website:
www.forumone.co/1000-smiles


YOUR QUESTIONS, ANSWERED

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the Operation Smile, Inc.?
With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes towards Operation Smile, Inc.

Why the $24,000 figure?
It's our minimum goal to raise money for at least 100 surgeries. The ambitious goal is to raise money for 1,000 surgeries. So, the actual figure we are aiming to achieve is $240,000. That would allow Operation Smile to bring back 1,000 smiles more to children, who were born with facial deformities.

What payment methods does Indiegogo accept?
Major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely!

When will I receive my perk?
- if you contribute on or before 21st of October, 2014 we will send you email with login details and instructions how to access FORUM ONE livestream on 22nd of October;
- if you contribute on or after 22nd of October, 2014 we will send you email with login details and instructions how to access recordings of FORUM ONE on 27th of October.

Is shipping included in the perks?
No, all perks are digital and access to them will be sent to you only by email.

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?
Yes.

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse this campaign or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?
Please email Darius Jonauskas, who can discuss this further with you.

Do you have any further questions or queries about this social campaign?
Feel free to write us: support@forumone.co

story:
Short Summary

  • We are a group of USMNT fans, sick and tired of the regression we've seen with our National Team.  There is no direction, no guidance, and no observable tactical plan in each and every game.
  • Since Sunil Gulati has given Klinsmann a blank check, there is no accountability.
  • An airplane ad banner flying before (and possibly during) the match will make a statement that we're fed up with the direction (or lack thereof) Klinsmann is taking our national team.

What It Will Say

  • There is a 39 Character limit, not including spaces.
  • Currently, the banner will say: "Fire Klinsmann! We deserve better."
  • Got a better idea?  Join the FB group. 

What We Need

  • It will cost $800 to purchase 2 hours of flying time (approximately 80 minutes at the site)
  • If we get enough funding, we will purchase another plane at the T&T game, as well.
  • Donors of $40 or more will receive a cheesy "I helped save USMNT" award.

Be a part of saving the USMNT!  Donate today, spread the word!

story:
Who We Are.

Thanks for stopping by! We're The Pink Duckies, a group of motivated and passionate people who are on a mission to fundraise money for an upcoming 5K Race for the Cure walk for Susan G. Komen. Although we're well on our way to raising our ultimate goal, we still have a little ways to go... so that's where you come in. Breast cancer has become a well known disease, and the cure can't be found without the efforts of people just like you and me. 

So who are The Pink Duckies?

  • A husband and wife pair with an overly passionate wife who would give every paycheck to charity if she could. 
  • A mother, stepfather and sister who were persuaded in to this by the above passionate wife, and have grown to accept their 5K fate with open hearts.
  • The spirit of those closest to the walkers who have lost their lives battling breast cancer, and left this earth too soon.

We realize that every penny counts, and even if you only have a couple of cents to donate, please know that we would be extremely grateful for you to donate to our efforts to eradicate cancer once and for all. 

What You'll Get For Helping Our Mission.

Our goal is to raise $800 through IndieGoGo. Plain and simple. No catches, no gimmicks. 100% of what we raise will go directly to the Race for the Cure event hosted by the Susan G. Komen Northwest NC Affiliate in Winston-Salem, NC. Depending on your donation you could receive:

  • Cupcakes or strawberries.
  • A t-shirt with the name of a breast cancer battler, survivor or someone who left us before their time.
  • A deco-mesh wreath or fancy monogrammed frame & key hanger.
  • That warm and fuzzy feeling in your heart and stomach that comes from doing something really awesome.
  • A lifetime of gratitude.

Shipping and delivery will be determined after the fundraiser has completed. We'll contact you and work out the details! For those of you wondering from the $50 perk what the monogrammed frame and key hanger will look like, here are two photos:

                


How Your Money Will Help.

It's always nice to really know how your money will make an impact. Here is what your donations will help aid in not just the national fight, but the local fight against breast cancer:

  • $50 Will Help Provide: Transportation to/from treatments or doctors visits; co-payment assistance; translation services for language barriers; child care for a woman who will be undergoing chemotherapy infusion; informational products about breast cancer, risks, early detection and screening.
  • $100 Will Help Provide: Funding for a mammogram for one woman without insurance
  • $150 Will Help Provide: Education materials to ensure early detection.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know money doesn't grow on trees, so we understand that it may be difficult for people to donate to our cause. But there are other ways you can help the fight for breast cancer:

    • You can spread the word about our fundraising campaign. Share it on Facebook, post it on Twitter, email five friends... it all helps.
    • Go online and research breast cancer facts to be more educated in case you ever need to know.
    • Donate your time to a local Susan G. Komen Affiliate.
    • Start your own fundraiser and donate to your local Affiliate.
    • Register to walk in your hometown.
    • Stand on the roof with a blow horn and tell everyone one fact about breast cancer.
    • Or whatever else you can think of.

    And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for any help you can give us on our journey towards this 5K walk. 

    "I tell people I'm not just a survivor, I'm a thriver because I'm not just surviving life, I'm thriving in the midst of the journey."

We'll contact you and work out the details! For those of you wondering from the $50 perk what the monogrammed frame and key hanger will look like, here are two photos:                   How Your Money Will Help. It's always nice to really know how your money will make an impact. Here is what your donations will help aid in not just the national fight, but the local fight against breast cancer: 

$50 Will Help Provide: Transportation to/from treatments or doctors visits; co-payment assistance; translation services for language barriers; child care for a woman who will be undergoing chemotherapy infusion; informational products about breast cancer, risks, early detection and screening.

$100 Will Help Provide: Funding for a mammogram for one woman without insurance 
$150 Will Help Provide: Education materials to ensure early detection.
  Other Ways You Can Help We know money doesn't grow on trees, so we understand that it may be difficult for people to donate to our cause. But there are other ways you can help the fight for breast cancer: 
You can spread the word about our fundraising campaign. Share it on Facebook, post it on Twitter, email five friends... it all helps. Go online and research breast cancer facts to be more educated in case you ever need to know.
Donate your time to a local Susan G. Komen Affiliate.
Start your own fundraiser and donate to your local Affiliate.
Register to walk in your hometown.
Stand on the roof with a blow horn and tell everyone one fact about breast cancer.
Or whatever else you can think of.  And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for any help you can give us on our journey towards this 5K walk. "I tell people I'm not just a survivor, I'm a thriver because I'm not just surviving life, I'm thriving in the midst of the journey."

story:
My name is Elouise Claxton and my nickname is Wheezy.  I’m 6 years old and love gymnastics!  

I’ve been doing gymnastics since I was a toddler.  In fact when I was 10 months old, I did my first somersault and from that point on there was no turning back.  I quickly taught myself how to do razor sharp cartwheels, back-bends, walk-over’s, handstands and back handsprings. I often get in trouble for flipping around the house.  What can I say, I love gymnastics and I can’t get enough!  I’m extremely eager and excited to learn more and compete.  My parents and I have found a great gymnastics facility that will set me up for success and they have accepted me as their student.  I don’t have any Gold medals or trophies yet, but I do have a passion and love for the sport.

We’re a single income family of five living in a two bedroom apartment in Southern California and my mom and dad do a great job making it work. They bring me to the park to practice my bars (on monkey bars), we use our friends’ trampolines, and Santa Clause even made me a balance beam (check out the Gallery).  I’m really grateful they've been so creative in keeping me going in the sport that I love, but in order for me to hit the next level I need the proper training. 

I am trying to raise $3,400.  I know… Gymnastics is an expensive sport and I wouldn't be able to do this without your help.  The money will be used for:

·  Partial Gym Training Fees (Tuition) - $1,000

·  Competitive meets\Competition (Total 9) - $1,800

· Team Leo, Jump-suit & Gym bag - $300

·  Travel and Lodge (competitions) - $300

You can see me my pictures on the gallery tab and I promise to put together a short video of the things I’ve learned and my competitions at the end of the year for all to see.

I’m thankful for your generous donations that will help me to excel and provide me with an opportunity to continue to do what I love.  I can’t say it enough, without your help this would not be possible.  Any size donation will help.  

Love,

Elouise (Wheezy) Claxton

story:
Thanks for clicking!

My name is Isis, and I have been riding horses for 3 years.  I would love for the opportunity to go to this spectacular camp! Because I am now 13, I have limited time to attend this camp.  Please support me in my journey to have the experience of a lifetime!

About Rawhide

Rawhide Ranch is a week-long, sleep-away camp for both boys and girls ages 7-15. The above video from Rawhide Ranch shows all the things they offer.  Rawhide Ranch was established in 1963 in North San Diego County.  It sits on 37 scenic acres of land.  They offer lessons in bareback western riding, vaulting (which is  gymnastics on horseback), shooting sports, animal and horse science, and so much more! Campers also have the opportunity to take care of animals at the EZ Stock Farm, which features animals such as goats, sheep, pigs, cows, and sometimes even Llammas!  Rawhide even has a swimming pool with a waterslide to cool off in the summer!  At Rawhide Ranch, technology such as phones and video games are not allowed.  Kids learn to enjoy themselves (gasp!) without the electronic gadgets they rely on at home. 

What your money will do

Your donation will be used for the camp fee of at least one attendee.

Anything over our target amount will be donated to sponsor other kid s to the camp program at Rawhide!

Rawhide Ranch is a place where you can grow as a person, and create friendships that will last a lifetime.

story:
Pancreatic Cancer has one of the highest fatality rates of all cancers and is the 4th highest cancer killer in the US.

 

Project Purple was created with the goal towards raising awareness and funds towards a cure for Pancreatic Cancer. Pancreatic Cancer has one of the highest fatality rates of all cancers and is the 4th highest cancer killer in the US. It is estimated that in 2010 more than 43,000 individuals in the United States were diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer, and 36,800 died from this disease.

We started Project Purple to raise awareness and funds towards the cure of Pancreatic Cancer by working alongside various local and national organizations. With the goal of bringing people together through different events involving an assortment of different running activities.

Help us in this cause to rid the world of this horrid disease.

story:
Update

After finding out news that Evelyn was facing much more challenges than we first thought.. We held out hope.. But she was not able to overcome everything and passed away January 27th 2013. We believe that she is in the comforting arms of God. Although she was here for 19 days she forever changed the hearts of so many. 

This campaign has turned into help for funeral expenses. We Thank you for supporting and praying for sweet Evelyn.

 

 

Who is Baby Evelyn?

Baby Evelyn is my cousin, she was born weighing 5lbs., 7 oz., and 17inches on Tuesday, January 8th.  Evelyn was scheduled to have heart surgery on January 14th because she was born with atrioventricular canal defect.  Her surgery had to be postponed, so the doctors can review all her tests and have a better understanding of what can be done to help her.  As of today January 17th the family was informed that she would need an additional surgery on her pulmonary arteries to remove tissue that is blocking it. Evelyn's family is being incredibly strong with the Hope that Evelyn will receive her surgery and be able to come home soon.

What We Need

I am starting this campaign to help give her family some relief.  Though I feel helpless in this situation, I want to raise enough money to ease some of the financial stress regarding transportation to hospital, unexpected bills, and wages loss from missing work. 

I have set a goal of $2,000.  I have never been in this situation, but I know the last thing I would want to spend my time thinking about is money when my baby is sick.  We will do our best to keep you updated on her progress and when she has surgery. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help.

If you are not in the position to make a monetary donation, that is okay.  We ask that you pray for baby Evelyn and pass this message on to your friends & family.  Thank you.

The Instabeat Team

Press Coverage

NEW! TechCrunch Instabeat Is Revolutionary HUD For Swimming Goggles You Can Back On Indiegogo

NEW! Mashable Instabeat Is Google Glass and Nike FuelBand for Swimmers 

NEW! SwimSwam SwimSwam has several partners and friends who might like to license this technology, sell the product, or simply buy it for personal use.

NEW! Gizmodo  5 Wearable Concepts Worth Taking a Chance On 

NEW! PSFK  Google Glass For Swimmers

More below in the Press section.

-

Instabeat is a ground breaking heads-up display that monitors your heart rate, calories, laps and turns during your swim. 

'a breakthrough in the swimming world' WSJ   WIRED UK   Huffington Post   TED   Quantified Self

Real-time tracking is crucial to achieve your training and fitness goals, but at the same time it shouldn't disturb your head and arm motion during your swim. Instabeat's sleek design reduces friction in the water.

It fits on any pair of swimming goggles

 Instabeat is designed to fit on your favorite pair of goggles.

It reads your heart rate from the temporal artery, getting rid of the (oh, so annoying) chest belt!

 The sensor automatically turns on when the device is placed on your head.

It projects a color on your lenses in real-time to know how close you are from your target zone

Each color has three levels to indicate whether you are in the beginning, middle or upper limit of the zone.

Instabeat is the must have for every single swimmer:

It also measures your calories, number of laps and flip turns and syncs with your personal dashboard to track your progress over time. 

 

This first version syncs to the dashboard through your USB port.

Features

  • Hydrodynamic
  • Minimal Friction
  • Waterproof
  • Sleek
  • Easy to use (no ON/OFF buttons)
  • Comfortable to wear
  • Real-time accurate Heart Rate feedback

Specs

  • Size: 14 mm L x 5.3 mm W x 5.2 mm H
  • Weight: 30g
  • Heart Rate Accuracy: 97%
  • Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery: 8 hours

 

We love swimming and we think it's time to revolutionize the way we swim!

Swimming is one of the only two complete sports, that lenghtens your muscles, tones your body 12 times more and makes you burn 5 times more calories than running for the same effort!

We are done trying to adapt technologies for bikers and runners to the water, it's time we did things OUR way! 

 

Whether you are a professional swimmer or just looking to get fit, Instabeat will help you reach your goal.

 

Awards

We were the first prize winners of the MIT Enterprise Forum Pan Arab Business Plan Competition (2012) and the third prize winner of the Stars of Science competition organized by Qatar Foundation (2010).

We are one of the hottest startups in the Pan Arab region!

Where we are now:

Over the past year and half, we have developed 7 different versions of the prototype, and after extensive testing, we are finally happy with the current design and have a prototype that is ready to be manufactured. 

And now, we need you so we can:

  • Convert our prototype to production-ready models
  • Get all the regulatory approvals
  • Place our first production orders with our manufacturing partners

 

Rewards

$139 Early Birds

$189 Suited Up

$199 Your Own Unique Instabeat

$249 For Two

$489 For Four

$1,189 Team Love

$10,999 World Love

 

The swimming suits are designed in collaboration with Marcella M Fashion Design House. They are available in white with a pink zipper, and come in 3 sizes, S, M and L.

FAQ

*Why is my credit card not working?

Indiegogo uses PayPal as a credit card payment processor, and PayPal does not support Lebanon among 19 other countries. In agreement with Indiegogo, we have developed a separate payment gateway to receive contributions from these countries. All the money will be transfered into the Indiegogo website at the end of the campaign.

If your country is not supported by PayPal, you can contribute to the campaign here: http://instabeat.me/payment/

 

What is Instabeat?

Instabeat is the first modular, all-in-one training monitor adapted to the intricate biomechanics of swimming.

Why do I need to monitor my heart-rate during swimming?

Measuring your heart-rate during your exercise is the optimal way of assessing how effective your workout is. It is a direct indication of whether your body is responding to your training and reaching your target, and a tool for you to decide whether you should maintain the same effort, push harder or take it easy.

How does the technology work?

Instabeat has developed a (patent-pending) optical sensor that can accurately read the heart rate from the temporal artery.

The mechanical casing is designed to be flat so that:

The sensor is always positioned over the temple area on any head, allowing it to constantly read the heart rate from any head frame.

The device stays in place despite the constant motion.

Instabeat has multiple embedded motion sensors, that in addition to calculating the calories, flip turns and breathing pattern, act as a filter to reduce the noise created by the motion of the head, ensuring the accuracy of the heart rate reading.

What parameters can I monitor with Instabeat?

You will be able to monitor your heart-rate in real-time all throughout your training. Instabeat will turn on automatically as soon as it detects a heart rate and will only turn off once it is off your head.

On the dashboard, you will be able to see any other heart-rate feature such as your average or maximum heart rate, but also:

  • Laps

  • Flip Turns

  • Breathing Pattern

What about shipping charges?

Shipping costs are included in the price. For customs duty - please check the policy in your country. 

How is Instabeat different from what's available in the market?

Instabeat is the first heads-up display that is designed to be perfectly adapted to the complicated mechanics of swimming. Instabeat’s differentiation lies in the combination of belt-free, non- intrusive heart rate measurement with real-time visual feedback 

Lap and stroke counting devices are essential, however they only refect on your exercise and not on your body's response to that exercise. Real-time feedback of your heart rate will allow you to make better training decisions, understand your body better and optimize your swim.

Does Instabeat work on any head size and any goggle frame?

Instabeat is designed so that it fits all head sizes and goggle frames.

Will Instabeat's optical light sensor work in the sun? On bright days? In open water?

We have tested our sensor in all of these different conditions and have succedeed in making it work anywhere at anytime.

Will Instabeat work with a swimming cap?

At Instabeat, we like swimming with our cap under our goggles- and that works perfectly fine. But if you like wearing yours above, that works too, just make sure you put it over the clip.

Will Instabeat sync with my Android or iPhone?

For this first version, Instabeat syncs with your dashboard through the USB port; the data is stored and then synced across all your devices. However, if we hit the 100K mark, we will add the bluetooth edtion perk, and you will be able to sync your device directly to your phone! Help us get there faster! 

Can I upgrade my Perk at a later stage?

http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20517401-how-to-upgrade-your-perk

Who is the team behind Instabeat? 

Instabeat is a sports technology startup based in Lebanon, founded in 2011 by Hind Hobeika out of a need for a heart rate monitoring device for her swimming practices. Find out more on http://instabeat.me/about

More Questions?

Ask us here in the comments thread or email us: indiegogo@instabeat.me

We did it! Thanks everyone, we are only getting started.
Stay tuned,
The Instabeat Team

FAQ
*Why is my credit card not working?
Indiegogo uses PayPal as a credit card payment processor, and PayPal does not support Lebanon among 19 other countries. In agreement with Indiegogo, we have developed a separate payment gateway to receive contributions from these countries. All the money will be transfered into the Indiegogo website at the end of the campaign.
If your country is not supported by PayPal, you can contribute to the campaign here: http://instabeat.me/payment/
 
What is Instabeat?
Instabeat is the first modular, all-in-one training monitor adapted to the intricate biomechanics of swimming.

Why do I need to monitor my heart-rate during swimming?
Measuring your heart-rate during your exercise is the optimal way of assessing how effective your workout is. It is a direct indication of whether your body is responding to your training and reaching your target, and a tool for you to decide whether you should maintain the same effort, push harder or take it easy.
How does the technology work?
Instabeat has developed a (patent-pending) optical sensor that can accurately read the heart rate from the temporal artery.

The mechanical casing is designed to be flat so that:
The sensor is always positioned over the temple area on any head, allowing it to constantly read the heart rate from any head frame.
The device stays in place despite the constant motion.
Instabeat has multiple embedded motion sensors, that in addition to calculating the calories, flip turns and breathing pattern, act as a filter to reduce the noise created by the motion of the head, ensuring the accuracy of the heart rate reading.
What parameters can I monitor with Instabeat?
You will be able to monitor your heart-rate in real-time all throughout your training. Instabeat will turn on automatically as soon as it detects a heart rate and will only turn off once it is off your head.
On the dashboard, you will be able to see any other heart-rate feature such as your average or maximum heart rate, but also:


Laps


Flip Turns


Breathing Pattern


What about shipping charges?
Shipping costs are included in the price. For customs duty - please check the policy in your country. 
How is Instabeat different from what's available in the market?
Instabeat is the first heads-up display that is designed to be perfectly adapted to the complicated mechanics of swimming. Instabeat’s differentiation lies in the combination of belt-free, non- intrusive heart rate measurement with real-time visual feedback 
Lap and stroke counting devices are essential, however they only refect on your exercise and not on your body's response to that exercise. Real-time feedback of your heart rate will allow you to make better training decisions, understand your body better and optimize your swim.

Does Instabeat work on any head size and any goggle frame?
Instabeat is designed so that it fits all head sizes and goggle frames.
Will Instabeat's optical light sensor work in the sun? On bright days? In open water?
We have tested our sensor in all of these different conditions and have succedeed in making it work anywhere at anytime.
Will Instabeat work with a swimming cap?
At Instabeat, we like swimming with our cap under our goggles- and that works perfectly fine. But if you like wearing yours above, that works too, just make sure you put it over the clip.
Will Instabeat sync with my Android or iPhone?
For this first version, Instabeat syncs with your dashboard through the USB port; the data is stored and then synced across all your devices. However, if we hit the 100K mark, we will add the bluetooth edtion perk, and you will be able to sync your device directly to your phone! Help us get there faster! 
Can I upgrade my Perk at a later stage?
http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20517401-how-to-upgrade-your-perk
Who is the team behind Instabeat? 
Instabeat is a sports technology startup based in Lebanon, founded in 2011 by Hind Hobeika out of a need for a heart rate monitoring device for her swimming practices. Find out more on http://instabeat.me/about
More Questions?
Ask us here in the comments thread or email us: indiegogo@instabeat.me

story:
My name is Shelby Teipel. I am a fun, energetic, loving, 19 year-old that thought she had everything planned out and on the right path to medical school; that is until recently.

I got hired for a new job at a Doctor’s office.  Just before I was due to start I took ill and was in severe pain.  I went to the ER and they could not find anything.  I started work in pain and disorientation.  I worked for 2 days before I took my next trip back to the ER to seek help again for the pain and disorientation.  Again, they could not find anything wrong.  At that time my new employer gave me a leave of absence.  I went to my primary care physician and he diagnosed me with “anxiety” and prescribed anti-depressants.  I did not agree with his diagnosis and decided to seek another opinion from a trusted family doctor.  The only problem is that he did not accept my insurance plan, but I needed to find out what was wrong.  He scheduled a series of tests and with those results he ordered a series of more tests.  In the end I was diagnosed with Lupus.

Lupus is an autoimmune disease where the body's immune system becomes hyperactive and attacks normal, healthy tissue. This results in symptoms such as inflammation, swelling, and damage to joints, skin, kidneys, blood, the heart, and lungs. There is no cure for lupus but a long road of discovery and fulfilling exactly what your body needs. 

I am awaiting an appointment with a Rheumatologist that accepts my insurance (Medicaid) and have started the steps to get into University of Michigan’s Lupus Program.  http://www.med.umich.edu/lupus/index.htm  this is the link that gives more information about their program.  It will take about 2-3 months to get in to see one of their doctors.

This campaign will allow me to get the right treatment I need and get back on my path of success and to the fullest extent of a normal life. It will allow me to pay off past bills from doctors and future bills I will be receiving throughout this process.

Even if you aren’t able to contribute to this cause, you can still make a difference and contribute by sending this to all your family and friends.

Every little bit helps!

story:
My name is Lakesha Philyaw and I am advocating and being the voice for my stepmother, Carolyn Smith.  In March of 2013, Carolyn Smith had six brain aneurysms.  The doctor that performed the surgery was able to clamp all but one.  We were told that because of the seriousness of her brain trauma, she may not ever regain consciousness again.  She was hospitalized for 3 months, and as of today has not regained consciousness since.  Carolyn was released from the hospital in the care of her husband, my dad, Estervan Smith in early July 2013.  She is in need of around the clock care.

Estervan is an average hard working man that is 100% dedicated to taking care of his wife.  He is in need of financial help to assist with the constant care of her. This campaign means a lot to me because these are two people that I love dearly and both have been impacted significantly in a major way.  My stepmother was an outgoing person whose never gotten sick until this.  Seeing her this way breaks my heart.  My dad has worked and taken care of his family; and for me to see him struggle financially breaks my heart. I am asking for sincere contributions to be made to assist with caring for this sleeping beauty.

Any and all funding will be donated to my Dad to assist with the purchase of medications and to help pay the nurse that comes out to care for her.  I always say that any little bit helps, whether it be 5 or 10 dollars.  You would be making a difference, especially if it's coming from the heart.

If you are reading this, you are one of the many special people that can not only help financially, but you can spread the word to your friends, and their friends.  Thank you in advance for reading.  Thank you in advance for contributing.  Thank you in advance for spreading the word.


God Bless.

story:
Please Support Our 

**Healthcare for the Homeless** Campaign

"Of all of the forms of inequality, injustice in health is the most shocking and most inhumane."  -Martin Luther King, Jr.

                                        

Hello!

Thanks for visiting our fundraiser page. We are the Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign (AHAC)!

The Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign is a volunteer-run 501(c)3 that was established in 1999 and began offering alternative healthcare services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population in 2000.  Our volunteer licensed practitioners offer services such as naturopathic medicine, acupuncture, and massage at five clinics at various homeless shelters and transitional and low-income housing facilities in Seattle.

At AHAC, we believe that access to quality healthcare is a right, not a privilege, and it should not be denied or limited because of economic status. Holistic healthcare practices such as acupuncture & oriental medicine, naturopathic medicine, massage therapy, clinical nutrition, botanical medicine, midwifery, and homeopathy are important options in modern healthcare and should be available to all. Homeless and low-income people have the right to participate in the creation of public policies and programs that affect their access to healthcare.

Your support is needed to help continue our holistic health services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population.

What We Need

                                                

                                               

We are aiming to raise $2500 by January 1, 2016 to support our standard operations.  Funds donated will go towards the following:

  • Clinical supplies which include exam tables, massage tables, first aid supplies, acupuncture needles, and medical equipment.
  • Treatment supplies which include supplements, vitamins and minerals, herbal therapies, and nutritional supplementation.
  • Payroll funding for AHAC employees which include the Volunteer Operations Manager and Executive Director.  
  • Office supplies which include upgrades to EMR software as well as new computers and internet accessibility for charting for our volunteer practitioners.
  • Homelessness 101 training for all AHAC volunteers.


"There are no words. It's beautiful. If I were a rich man, I would fund what you do... The entire world is all about business... all about money.  But this.. it is free for us. It feels like taking a shower; it feels clean. I feel like I'm flying. You've made us feel human again."  -Hana, Massage Patient, Angeline's Women's Day Shelter


The Impact of Your Contribution

                                           

Unfortunately, the largest and most common barrier to healthcare it cost.  Coupled with lack of knowledge about where to get treated, lack of access to transportation, embarrassment, and self-consciousness about hygiene, many homeless and low-income individuals never receive medical care. The Alternative Healthcare Access Campaign works to both provide preventative care and treatment for existing conditions, with the aim of educating low-income and homeless individuals, as well as the community, on self-care and resources for treatment.  Doing so helps to keep homeless and low-income individuals from seeking treatment in hospital emergency rooms, which is often their most effective form of care.  This type of care often lacks continuity and is expensive for both the hospitals and local government.

Since 2000, AHAC has provided treatments to over 5,000 patients.  Our volunteer practitioners at our clinics at Compass Cascade Women's Program and the Frye Apartments have the opportunity to work with residents throughout their stay in these transitional and low-income housing facilities, easing their transition back from life on the streets and providing them with the resources for self-care and wellness going forward.  Some of our clinics are at emergency homeless shelters, such as Peace for the Streets by Kids on the Streets (PSKS) in Capital Hill and ROOTS Young Adult Shelter in the University District. And for the past 13 years, AHAC has had the opportunity to provide holistic healthcare services to the transitory residents of Tent City 3.

For every $100 donated, we are able to provide 30-50 individuals with free healthcare.  Your contribution to AHAC's Healthcare for the Homeless Fundraiser helps to provide greater continuity in our offering holistic healthcare services to Seattle's homeless and low-income population. 


Other Ways You Can Help AHAC

                                            

                                 

We know that not everyone can contribute financially to our mission of increasing access to healthcare for Seattle's homeless and low-income population, but that doesn't mean that we still couldn't use your help! 

  • Please consider volunteering! We are always looking for volunteers to ensure that our clinics run smoothly and our supply dispensary is maintained.  Specifically, licensed practitioner volunteers are especially in short supply.  You can visit our website for volunteer applications, or contact our Volunteer Manager at volunteer@ahacseattle.org for more information about our volunteer needs.
  • Please help spread the word about our work and community goals by 'liking' us on Facebook. Doing so will also help to keep you informed about AHAC news, volunteer opportunities, supply needs, and local happenings.

story:
How Valuable is the Peace of Mind Knowing Your Elderly Loved Ones are Never Alone?

What is it worth to you to extend the age, well being and quality of life for your elderly loved ones?

It is well documented in the medical literature that preventative health care and wellness programs significantly reduce the onset of many diseases, and extend life expectancy. Less often discussed are the gains in non-physical health parameters. Improved quality of life, reduced anxiety, autonomy and hope, are all specifically identified improvements that patients with proper wellness programs. (US National Institute of Health)

An absolutely essential element of effective wellness and preventative health care program is frequent (preferably daily) monitoring of a person's vital signs.

Using commercially available components, IPLTELEHOMECARE has designed a system using state of the art remote monitoring technology that will provide vital sign monitoring for live alone family members and loved ones. This fee-for service monitoring will be performed by registered nurses, will be available 24/7, and will include a variety of monitoring parameters tailored to the specific monitoring needs of those you care for.


Please reset the video back to the beginning when finished viewing by clicking on the small circle icon in the lower left hand corner of the video.  


Video courtesy Honeywell HomeMed division. 

Some Success Stories: 

The benefits to your loved ones of remote vital sign monitoring cannot be over-emphasized:

  • A remote monitoring program implemented by  the Canadian Ministry of Health involving more than 800 patients with congestive heart failure or COPD, demonstrated a 65% reduction in hospital admissions and a 72% reduction in Emergency Room visits.

  • Partners HealthCare in Boston found that patients receiving remote monitoring were 31% less likely to require re-hospitalization than the general population. 

  • The Veteran's Administration found a 25% reduction in the average number of days hospitalized and a 19% reduction in hospitalization for patients using home telehealth monitoring.

  • Geisinger Health Plan reports telemonitoring helped reduce 30-day hospital readmission rates by 44% among patients with congestive heart failure

  • A UK report indicates telehealth can reduce mortality rates by 45%.

  • Telemonitoring studies in Germany have focused on patients with heart failure showed 21% fewer hospitalizations and a 51% reduction in mortality within the first year

Don't deny your loved ones the benefits of this life enhancing and potentially life saving service. 


Please reset the video back to the beginning when finished viewing by clicking on the small circle icon in the lower left hand corner of the video.  

Video courtesy Honeywell HomeMed division. 


The Principals

The founding members of the IPLTELEHOMECARE team include a former S&P 500 CEO (who also published his PhD dissertation on remote telemedicine), a corporate controller who has been the CFO of three previous start-up companies, and the Senior Nursing Director of a large hospital. Please see our profiles in the Gallery. Through technology, innovation and exemplary service, we are committed to improving the health care for at risk patients.

The Impact

Remote telemedicine is a well established methods used by doctors and hospitals for patients under a doctor's care. But there is currently no comparable service for in-home monitoring for individuals not under direct physician's care. IPLTELEHOMECARE intends to provide such a service and help avoid major medical conditions from developing through the power of preventative medicine resulting from daily in-home vital sign monitoring. Starting in Southern Nevada, we plan to rapidly expand this service nationwide.

     


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $500,000 to launch this venture. About half of these funds will be needed to develop our IT monitoring infrastructure. The other half will provide working capital until a sufficient customer base is in place to become self funding.

Keep in mind, your "contribution" is not a general contribution to the company, but rather the first month (or more) payment for your contract for care.

Take Advantage of the Discounts  During This Funding Period

Contributors who join during this campaign by taking advantage of the "Perks" offered will receive discounted premiums for the telehome monitoring services to be provided. Starting with the Silver Plan, with an initial contribution of $300, you will receive one free month during your initial one year contract.(An 8.3% discount).  Larger contributions will earn more significant discounts for the individual contribution levels shown on this page. Again, for example, the Platinum Plan, for an initial contribution of $1800, you will receive 5 months free basic service spread over a two year contract. That's a 21% discount! Check out all the discount plans and choose the one best suited to you needs. The higher initial contribution, the more substantial the discount.  SIGN UP NOW!!!


         


Other Ways You Can Help

According to the U.S. Census, almost 30 percent of persons aged 65 and older in the U.S. live alone. For women aged 85 and older, that number grows to more than half. Many of these persons need the service that IPLTELEHOMECARE can provide but are unaware such a service exists. So please, in addition to enrolling your loved ones, use your personal contacts and social networking sites to spread the word about the availability of home vital sign monitoring. Many of your friends and associates may have live alone family members that would greatly benefit from this service.

 

                   


IPLTELEHOMECARE Basic Services

IPLTELEHOMECARE services are provided on a contract basis, with fees paid monthly in advance. The minimum Basic Services Contract is a one year contract with automatic yearly extensions as part of the contract. 

Our price for the Basic Services Contract is $300/month. 

Longer term contracts can be created based on the client's needs and desires. Early termination of the contract many result in termination fees, except in the case of hospitalization, or the passing away of the client being monitored.

An IPLTELEHOMECARE registered Nurse will welcome the client to our family, take their medical history to start our records, and obtain the client's signature on some required forms. At the same time an IPLTELEHOMECARE technician will install the appropriate monitoring equipments and insure correct operation and proper connection to the outside network. 

The basic equipment installed will include the basic monitoring control box, a blood pressure cuff, a pulse oximeter clip, and a scale.

Our IPLTELEHOMECARE nurse will instruct the client on the correct use of all the monitoring equipments to insure accurate readings, demonstrate the medical features of the equipment, and demonstrate the proper manner to respond to the questions on the monitor device.    

Level 1 basic service:  

1.  Every day, the clients will self-administer the testing and when the entire process is completed, the clients will send the data to the IPLTELEHOMECARE monitoring center.
The parameter measurements that will be recorded and reviewed at this level 1 are:

a.  Blood Pressure

b.  Heart Rate

c.  Blood Oxygen Percentage

d.  Weight

e.  Temperature…can be added at no extra cost if required.

Level 1 service can be enhanced with special options, including, but not limited to: Diabetes, COPD (e.g. asthma, emphysema, and chronic bronchitis), CHF and other applicable acute disease processes.  For option pricing contact IPLTELEHOMECARE These special options are normally priced individually, and in addition to the standard pricing for Level I service.   

1.  IPLTELEHOMECARE will use the client's existing glyclose monitor if compatible. Otherwise we will provide a compatible monitor. 

If compatible IPLTELEHOMECARE will setup our internal monitoring system to accept readings from your glucose monitor. If the system is not electronically compatible, IPLTELEHOMECARE will provide a monitor. Your glucose measurements will then be included with the client daily monitoring.  

2.  IPLTELEHOMECARE will provide a Peak flow Metering instrument and include it's measurements into the daily monitoring regime. 

A test specifically designed to measure how well your lungs are functioning.for clients is the Peak Flow Metering (PFM).   If needed, IPLTELEHOMECARE will provide a PFM equipment that will be compatible with our main monitoring equipment so your PFM can be incorporated into your overall data records.

3.  IPLTELEHOMECARE can provide a PT/INR (Prothrombin Time/ International Normalized Ratio) if necessary and will include it's measurements into out daily monitoring regime

Some clients may be taking a blood-thinning medication in addition to other medications.  Monitoring blood’s ability to coagulate correctly is a critical test that is required of certain disease processes. CHF patients.

Basics of Monitoring


Please reset the video back to the beginning when finished viewing by clicking on the small circle icon in the lower left hand corner of the video.  


Video courtesy American Telemedicine Association. 

The process starts out with the client self monitoring all their parameters by themselves in their homes, using the equipment provided by IPLTELEHOMECARE. 

                      

The client takes their vital signs and then answers a few questions depending on their diagnosis. Depending on the diagnosis such as diabetes, the client may be requested to take their reading more than once a day. When the client is finished, they push a "send" button and their measurements are instantly transmitted to the IPLTELEHOMECARE monitoring center and reviewed there by a registered nurse. 


                   IPLTELEHOMECARE

                  "Caring for you and you loved ones using advanced innovation"


MAKE YOUR LOVED ONES' GOLDEN YEARS TRULY GOLDEN, HEALTHY AND LONG LASTING. 

ENROLL THEM TODAY IN THIS LIFE ENHANCING PROGRAM. 


JOIN TODAY AND TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE MANY "PERKS" OFFERING SIGNIFICANT DISCOUNTS ON THE BASIC CONTRACT. 

WHEN THE FUNDING PERIOD IS OVER, THE DISCOUNTS WILL NO LONGER BE AVAILABLE. 


QUESTIONS???  

CONTACT DEL ROBERTS 

888-211-0573


Visit our Website


THE NEW IPLTELEHOMECARE WEBSITE

www.ipltelehomecare.com



Copyright 2013 IPLTELEHOMECARE
story_txt:
How Valuable is the Peace of Mind Knowing Your Elderly Loved Ones are Never Alone?

What is it worth to you to extend the age, well being and quality of life for your elderly loved ones?
It is well documented in the medical literature that preventative health care and wellness programs significantly reduce the onset of many diseases, and extend life expectancy. Less often discussed are the gains in non-physical health parameters. Improved quality of life, reduced anxiety, autonomy and hope, are all specifically identified improvements that patients with proper wellness programs. (US National Institute of Health)
An absolutely essential element of effective wellness and preventative health care program is frequent (preferably daily) monitoring of a person's vital signs.
Using commercially available components, IPLTELEHOMECARE has designed a system using state of the art remote monitoring technology that will provide vital sign monitoring for live alone family members and loved ones. This fee-for service monitoring will be performed by registered nurses, will be available 24/7, and will include a variety of monitoring parameters tailored to the specific monitoring needs of those you care for.


Please reset the video back to the beginning when finished viewing by clicking on the small circle icon in the lower left hand corner of the video.  
Video courtesy Honeywell HomeMed division. 
Some Success Stories: 
The benefits to your loved ones of remote vital sign monitoring cannot be over-emphasized:

A remote monitoring program implemented by  the Canadian Ministry of Health involving more than 800 patients with congestive heart failure or COPD, demonstrated a 65% reduction in hospital admissions and a 72% reduction in Emergency Room visits.

Partners HealthCare in Boston found that patients receiving remote monitoring were 31% less likely to require re-hospitalization than the general population. 


The Veteran's Administration found a 25% reduction in the average number of days hospitalized and a 19% reduction in hospitalization for patients using home telehealth monitoring.


Geisinger Health Plan reports telemonitoring helped reduce 30-day hospital readmission rates by 44% among patients with congestive heart failure


A UK report indicates telehealth can reduce mortality rates by 45%.


Telemonitoring studies in Germany have focused on patients with heart failure showed 21% fewer hospitalizations and a 51% reduction in mortality within the first year



Don't deny your loved ones the benefits of this life enhancing and potentially life saving service. 

Please reset the video back to the beginning when finished viewing by clicking on the small circle icon in the lower left hand corner of the video.  Video courtesy Honeywell HomeMed division. 

The PrincipalsThe founding members of the IPLTELEHOMECARE team include a former S&P 500 CEO (who also published his PhD dissertation on remote telemedicine), a corporate controller who has been the CFO of three previous start-up companies, and the Senior Nursing Director of a large hospital. Please see our profiles in the Gallery. Through technology, innovation and exemplary service, we are committed to improving the health care for at risk patients.
The Impact


Remote telemedicine is a well established methods used by doctors and hospitals for patients under a doctor's care. But there is currently no comparable service for in-home monitoring for individuals not under direct physician's care. IPLTELEHOMECARE intends to provide such a service and help avoid major medical conditions from developing through the power of preventative medicine resulting from daily in-home vital sign monitoring. Starting in Southern Nevada, we plan to rapidly expand this service nationwide.



     



What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking $500,000 to launch this venture. About half of these funds will be needed to develop our IT monitoring infrastructure. The other half will provide working capital until a sufficient customer base is in place to become self funding. 
Keep in mind, your "contribution" is not a general contribution to the company, but rather the first month (or more) payment for your contract for care. 
Take Advantage of the Discounts  During This Funding Period

Contributors who join during this campaign by taking advantage of the "Perks" offered will receive discounted premiums for the telehome monitoring services to be provided. Starting with the Silver Plan, with an initial contribution of $300, you will receive one free month during your initial one year contract.(An 8.3% discount).  Larger contributions will earn more significant discounts for the individual contribution levels shown on this page. Again, for example, the Platinum Plan, for an initial contribution of $1800, you will receive 5 months free basic service spread over a two year contract. That's a 21% discount! Check out all the discount plans and choose the one best suited to you needs. The higher initial contribution, the more substantial the discount.  SIGN UP NOW!!!


         



Other Ways You Can Help
According to the U.S. Census, almost 30 percent of persons aged 65 and older in the U.S. live alone. For women aged 85 and older, that number grows to more than half. Many of these persons need the service that IPLTELEHOMECARE can provide but are unaware such a service exists. So please, in addition to enrolling your loved ones, use your personal contacts and social networking sites to spread the word about the availability of home vital sign monitoring. Many of your friends and associates may have live alone family members that would greatly benefit from this service.
 
                   

IPLTELEHOMECARE Basic Services

IPLTELEHOMECARE services are provided on a contract basis, with fees paid monthly in advance. The minimum Basic Services Contract is a one year contract with automatic yearly extensions as part of the contract. 
Our price for the Basic Services Contract is $300/month. 
Longer term contracts can be created based on the client's needs and desires. Early termination of the contract many result in termination fees, except in the case of hospitalization, or the passing away of the client being monitored.

An IPLTELEHOMECARE registered Nurse will welcome the client to our family, take
their medical history to start our records, and obtain the client's signature on some
required forms. At the same time an IPLTELEHOMECARE technician will install the appropriate monitoring equipments and insure correct operation and proper connection to the outside network. 
The basic equipment installed will include the basic monitoring control
box, a blood pressure cuff, a pulse oximeter clip, and a scale. 
Our IPLTELEHOMECARE nurse will instruct the client on the correct use of all the monitoring equipments
to insure accurate readings, demonstrate the medical features of the equipment,
and demonstrate the proper manner to respond to the questions on the monitor
device.    
Level 1 basic service:  
1. 
Every day, the clients will self-administer the
testing and when the entire process is completed, the clients will send the data
to the IPLTELEHOMECARE monitoring
center. 
The parameter measurements that will be recorded and reviewed at this level 1
are:
a. 
Blood Pressure
b. 
Heart Rate
c. 
Blood Oxygen Percentage
d. 
Weight
e. 
Temperature…can
be added at no extra cost if required. 
Level 1 service can be enhanced with special
options, including, but not limited to: Diabetes, COPD (e.g. asthma, emphysema, and chronic bronchitis), CHF and other applicable acute disease processes.  For option pricing contact IPLTELEHOMECARE
These special options are normally priced individually, and in addition to the
standard pricing for Level I service.
