el total de los prototipos de nuestra revolucionaria ropa de deporte.
Gracias a la colaboración de nuestros socios, expertos en
producción textil o en instalaciones eléctricas, hemos conseguido obtener
unos productos de insuperable calidad para la serie ANTELOPE. 




Fuimos fundado en marzo de 2014. Actualmente nuestra organigrama
consta de 14 miembros. Todos y cada uno de los departamentos reúnen una larga
experiencia profesional sumada a años de trabajo en ámbitos internacionales.
Nos apoya un gabinete de asesores con su experienca profunda.




Por falta te capacidad no podemos poner las FAQs en español aquí. Si quieres leerlas, escribe nos un mail a info@antlope.club.

story:
What is the Wringo360™?

The revolutionary Wringo360™ (Patent Pending) is an exercise and rehabilitation device designed to actively engage the body’s kinetic chain through the brain’s conscious thought patterns. Specifically, the Wringo360™ allows your body to fluidly move within a 360-degree, 3 dimensional plane-based range-of-motion. This is called ‘functional flexibility’, because it mimics the movements our bodies make countless times everyday, simply by existing in our 3-dimensional world—including bending over, reaching, lifting, and rotating. This 2.5lb exercise device employs constant and consistent resistance, and you control the resistance through the intensity of your motions. This makes the Wringo360™ perfect for anyone to use regardless of pre-existing strength, coordination and endurance levels.

Who Needs the Wringo360™?

Everyone! The Wringo360™ helps strengthen, rehabilitate and retrain your body’s posture. This makes it the perfect solution for body fatigue and muscle wasting in people who remain seated or immobile for long periods of time. Its variable resistance also makes the Wringo360™ excellent for people who struggle with weight and health issues that render classical exercise difficult. Because it works the body’s kinetic chain from head to toe and everywhere in between, the Wringo360™ also benefits those who exercise regularly, including athletes, by strengthening coordination and the independent interaction of muscles, ligaments, tendons, bones and joints. Its patented Rotational Friction Resistance (RFR) technology is clinically proven to increase EMG muscle activity and bone density levels. Regardless of your fitness or health level, and whether for exercise and/or rehabilitation purposes, the Wringo360™ can help train and tune your entire body to be both fitter and healthier than it is right now.

86% of the American workforce sits for 7.7 hours per day
-American Journal of Epidemiology

Why Fluid and Functionally Flexible Movements?

Because even though we are functionally flexible creatures, so much of our lives are spent in lineal motion that we actually inhibit our own health and wellness through performing our everyday routines. Whereas many fitness devices and methods rely solely on lineal, or static movements our bodies don’t mimic in everyday motions, and our minds don’t innately recognize—the Wringo360™ encourages dynamic, active and soothing rotational stretching that requires a constant engagement of the mind and body as one holistically congruent organism. It also employs Non Exercise Activity Thermogenesis, or NEAT technology. Simply stated, working with the Wringo360™ just a few minutes at a time periodically throughout the day stimulates muscle activity and also increases heart rate. This causes increased metabolism of body fat, which means strength training and weight loss all in one, and from the comfort of homes, offices, or anywhere else…isn’t that NEAT?! 


Where Can You Wringo360™?

Anywhere you want! Its portability means that you can exercise at the office, on vacation, on the golf course, or even lying down in bed watching television. Think about it: Sitting at your desk, or back at the hotel after a long and seated business meeting. How about sitting on your couch watching television, or even laying in bed? What about on the golf course, in the clubhouse, or the warm-up area of your gym or fitness center? Anywhere you are in need of fluid and functionally flexible movement—that is where the Wringo360™ will be.  Anywhere you need to strengthen and rehabilitate your body from the effects of your static, lineal lifestyle…and anywhere else you can and will benefit from increased circulation, heart rate, flexibility, coordination, range-of-motion and overall health and wellness, is where you can rely on the Wringo360™ to help you realize the holistic, happy and healthy you! 

How Can I Get Involved, and Why Should I?

The Wringo360™ is already designed and engineered. We have several thoroughly tested, functional prototypes. In fact, our manufacturer is currently awaiting our first order. We plan to market the Wringo360™ through health and wellness outfits including fitness centers and stores, online e-commerce sites, and of course from us directly to customers worldwide. Through this campaign, we are offering you several exciting ways to become involved in the Wringo360’s™ success, which can then become your success too. These include gifts to donors; investment shares in our company, and even additional creative participation depending on donation size. Basically stated, we want you to share in the Wringo360™ revolution—which of course then allows everyone across the globe to experience the revolutionary Wringo360™ for themselves too! 

The benefits of  the Wringo360's patented Rotational Friction Resistance, or RFR Technology, have been featured in many respected publications including The LA Times, Mens Health Magazine, Shape Germany Magazine, Grazia Magazine, Shape USA Magazine, The New York Times, The American Chiropractor, and Competitor Magazine.

One of a kind photo, taken at Larry Hagman's Malibu colony home where I trained him for many years. This is from my personal collection. Michael W. Whitis

Testimonials

"As a chiropractor, I frequently encounter patients who are sedentary for eight hours a day or more. Sitting for prolonged periods of time can cause problems with poor posture, chronic back pain and even potentially deadly illnesses such as diabetes, heart disease and obesity. Using 360-degree rotational exercise technology, patients are able to move their bodies in three-dimensional movement patterns, improving their circulation, posture, strength, flexibility and mobility. Many people will greatly benefit as a result of this technology, showing positive results with frozen shoulders, tendinitis, bad backs, poor posture and overall well being."

Dr D Lipman | Chiropractor | Boca Raton, FL

"As a woman in my 60's, with extensive arthritis throughout my joints, I have struggled to find ways to exercise without causing additional pain and injury.  Bone on bone in my knees prevented me from doing strenuous exercise but since I started using Wringo360, I have been able to maintain a regular exercise regime. This amazing device provides me with an all round workout. I use it to stretch my back, strengthen my core muscles, tone and strengthen my arms, as well as my upper and my lower body. I have used it to reduce pain and inflammation caused by tennis elbow, rehabilitate my wrist after a fall and I even used it to help me rehabilitate after my bilateral knee replacements! Wringo 360 is simple to use, its light weight makes it perfect to pack and go, if I want to take it to the office, or on a trip. I highly recommend this product to anyone, at any fitness level, particularly if you have any difficulty using regular weights and machines at a gym or have injuries."

Sandy J. | Tarzana, CA


"We are currently researching the relationship between Mind/Body---Body/Mind through NeuroFeedback brain mapping, and we are evaluating movement efficacy allowing three-dimensional tailored feedback. When exercise is more fluid and effortless, blood flow efficiency in the brain is improved considerably, contributing to increased exercise effectiveness. This type of research will greatly impact and significantly benefit human beings on multiple levels."

Ron F | San Francisco, CA

"The first time I used the Wringo360 I was really surprised by how fluid and smooth it was. I thought there was no way this small, lightweight; single piece of equipment was going to give me a workout or cause me to work up a sweat, let alone increase my heart rate. Boy oh boy was I wrong. The best thing about it is that I could determine exactly what muscle group I wanted to target in a fun way. I could focus on my biceps till I felt the burn, then instantly switch to my triceps, without having to adjust a pin, or move to another machine. All right there, on the spot! It's the perfect training tool for anyone on the go since it's light and compact. I think everyone should have one of these, especially for toning. I can't think of a better way to give your muscles a good stretch and strengthening. Perfect for athletes who don't want to pull anything. You can easily achieve a full body workout in less than 15 minutes with this thing. This is a truly revolutionary fitness product. Not a gimmick. Love my Wringo!"

Gary S. | Trumbull, CT
__________________________________________________________
Check out our blog here for more information:
Wringo360 Blog

story:
As many of you will know, my mother, grandmother and great grandmother all suffered and died from the disease. I want to help- raise funds for SMND in Glasgow and am asking you to help me. Even a donation of £2 would go some way to helping them.

The Scottish MND Association was

founded in 1981 by John MacLeod and is

the only charity providing care,

information and funding for research to

improve the lives of people affected by

Motor Neurone Disease (MND) in

Scotland.

The Association aims:-

To ensure that the right help, care

and support is available to

everyone with MND and their

families in Scotland

To inform, educate and

support health and social

care professionals working

with people affect by MND

To raise awareness of MND

To promote research into all

aspects of MND

Please donate, thank you, Gabrielle x

story:
Transforming & Healing Lives

The Noble Touch (TNT) is a New York City based organization that provides an integrative approach to health and wellness. We use an Energy Medicine system called Pranic Healing which is no touch and drug free to improve your physical, spiritual, mental and emotional well-being by eliminating stress and trauma.  Did you know that the medical community states that nearly 90% of all major illnesses are stress related?  

                                     

What is so dangerous is that most people like you don't realize how stressed you really are and how stress is affecting your health RIGHT NOW. However, a session with a Noble Touch practitioner will help you release the years of stress in a matter of minutes. 

Our $2,000 campaign is to help pay for the vendor registration fee ($1500) and materials ($500) for The Noble Touch to provide stress and pain relief sessions at the 11th Anniversary of the Circle of Sisters Expo held in New York City at the Jacob Javits Convention Center on October 17th and October 18th, 2015.  We are committed to being a blessing by serving and helping people reduce stress that can lead to major illnesses and to decrease the suffering from emotional and physical pain by introducing them to a method of healing that complements conventional medicine.  

We've been attending Circle of Sisters for the past 3 years, and during that time we have offered Pranic Healing sessions at no cost to 1,014 people.  This year it is estimated that nearly 40,000 people (record numbers) will attend the annual event and our goal is to provide mini sessions to at least 300 attendees at a minimum cost of $10 per treatment. 

The Noble Touch is committed to the health and well-being of humanity so even if we don't reach our goal we will still attend Circle of Sisters. Any money that we receive over our goal of $2,000 and the funds that we receive for the sessions that we provide will be used to support our work at community health fairs and wellness events in low-income communities which are FREE of charge.  Each session has a true value of $75 so even with the $10 charge per session this year we are still giving away nearly $19,500 in services because Healing people that are suffering is a priority for TNT.  

More About The Noble Touch

This year has been an exciting one for The Noble Touch. Thus far, our trained volunteer Pranic Healing practitioners have provided stress relief treatments to 593 people FREE of charge at community health fairs and events with Healthfirst, Mount Pisgah Baptist Church in Brooklyn, First Corinthian Baptist Church in Harlem, Mount Sinai Hospital, SUNY Downstate Hospital and many more. We've also trained nearly 50 people in Pranic Healing to date, including 21 Doctors, nurses, social workers and other integral support staff members in Pranic Healing at Harlem Hospital in New York City.   

Other Ways You Can Help

The power to affect the health and wellness of YOU, YOUR family and others is within your reach. Please share this campaign information with your family and friends.  You can also prioritize your health and learn how to heal yourself and your loved ones. The next Basic Pranic Healing class will be held the weekend of October 31st and November 1st so if you want to Join the Healing Revolution and learn how to heal yourself and others please contact us at info@thenobletouch.com. 

Your support of The Noble Touch organization is greatly needed and appreciated. 

Thank you in advance for helping us to transform lives because "Suffering is an Option. Health is a Choice".

story:
This isn't about having amazing abs, it's about helping your community...

We (Randy & Kate Crafton) moved to Siloam Springs almost three years ago and began training friends and strangers in our garage. Since then, God led us to open a gym in Siloam Springs that encourages wellness and overall fitness. Our members have been able to come off medications, use their strength to help in crisis situations and live better lives. Three weeks ago we had the opportunity to put an offer in on a building downtown that will be the future location for Red Beard Fitness, Cross Country Cyclery and a small market for local, healthy foods. But now we need your help! Our vision for our complex is to have a central meeting place where people can experience diverse areas of fitness and encourage each other.  If we can come up with $24,000 in 30 days we'll be able to help our neighborhood, surrounding areas and our own children with learning how to live a healthier lifestyle. This is an uphill battle when our local obesity rate is 39% and our diabetes rate is nearly THREE TIMES the national average! We need our community to get involved!

The breakdown of what we want to provide:

    • 100% of your donations will go toward the down payment and renovation of our health complex, making it ADA accessible so we can help more people!
    • If our Indiegogo campaign ($24,000) is fully funded Red Beard Fitness will be able to sponsor two families, every 6 months, and provide them with nutrition counseling and gym access three times a week...giving them the tools they need to create a better lifestyle for them and their children in the future at no cost! According to Bridges To Wellness, one of the biggest problems that we face in the area is people being able to afford health centers and gyms. We currently sponsor individuals that otherwise couldn't pay for a gym membership and will be able to do it on a larger scale with a new facility. Do you know of someone who is trying to change their life but can't because of finances?  Email us at redbeardfit@gmail.com.
    • We want to show you that we appreciate you! Do you want to create and name a workout to test the mental toughness our members? Do you want some great bearded gear? Do you want to come to our opening party at this amazing warehouse that used to be a hula hoop factory? We have lots of ways you can support a great cause and still get some fun goodies as well. We will contact you about shirt types/sizes and backpacks when the campaign is fully funded!

Why we want to support Siloam Springs:

If you live in Siloam or surrounding areas you know that our poverty and obesity rates are extremely high. Arkansas was named the 9th most obese state in 2011 and moved up to 4th most obese in 2015. Community Clinic reported 70% of patients have chronic illnesses including obesity, hypertension, congestive heart failure and diabetes. We want help residents make better food choices and get out and get moving in all different ways! This isn't just a gym that thinks that their way is the ONLY way to stay fit. We want anyone, including non-members, to be able to walk in the door and be connected with any type of fitness that they're interested in. Weight lifting, walking, running, biking, kayaking, yoga, dance, jiu jitsu and more! We can give you the names and information of people in the community that are interested in the same sports and activities!
Until 3 years ago neither of us had interest in being a healthy example for our children. Then we found an area of fitness that we fell in love with and through that we discovered how to help others. It takes daily support and teaching someone the tools of clean living to truly change habits that you've had for life. Our facility also has plans to become a meeting place for Bridges to Wellness, to hold healthy lifestyle programs for residents.

    But it has to happen NOW!

    We have a VERY short time to raise funds for this beautiful, historic building in downtown Siloam Springs. It's all or nothing! Without your help we won't be able to buy and renovate the building, which has potential to grow and expand to change even more lives! In less than a year our membership started with 3 people and has grown to over 70 members. Those members are encouraging their friends, family, coworkers and even strangers to make changes that lead to lower healthcare costs and better quality of living. The more people that we reach the better we can make this community with that domino effect! Take a minute to watch our videos so you can hear some of the stories that have come out of just a few months of teaching people to value health and wellness. When our facility brings more people to Main Street it will also increase revenue for our small businesses in the downtown area!  #siloamsgotit

      Other Ways You Can Help...

      Don't have the funds to support the campaign? You can still help! Share our story with your friends and family through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and through email! Or do you have books that you can donate to our little library? Feeding your mind is just as important as taking care of your body. We let anyone in our community take or donate books from the RBF little library and we're always looking for more!

      Want to more more about RBF?
      Follow us on Instagram (@redbeardfit) or on Facebook (facebook.com/redbeardfitness).

chronic illnesses including obesity, hypertension, congestive heart

and get out and get moving in all different ways! This isn't just a gym 
that thinks that their way is the ONLY way to stay fit. We want anyone, 
including non-members, to be able to walk in the door and be connected 
with any type of fitness that they're interested in. Weight lifting, 
walking, running, biking, kayaking, yoga, dance, jiu jitsu and more! We 
can give you the names and information of people in the community that 
are interested in the same sports and activities! Until 3 years ago 
neither of us had interest in being a healthy example for our children. 
Then we found an area of fitness that we fell in love with and through 
that we discovered how to help others. It takes daily support and 
teaching someone the tools of clean living to truly change habits that 
you've had for life. Our facility also has plans to become a meeting 
place for Bridges to Wellness, to hold healthy lifestyle programs for 
residents.   But it has to happen NOW!
We have a VERY short time to raise funds for this beautiful, historic 
building in downtown Siloam Springs. It's all or nothing! Without your 
help we won't be able to buy and renovate the building, which has 
potential to grow and expand to change even more lives! In less than a 
year our membership started with 3 people and has grown to over 70 
members. Those members are encouraging their friends, family, coworkers 
and even strangers to make changes that lead to lower healthcare costs 
and better quality of living. The more people that we reach the better 
we can make this community with that domino effect! Take a minute to 
watch our videos so you can hear some of the stories that have come out 
of just a few months of teaching people to value health and wellness. 
When our facility brings more people to Main Street it will also 
increase revenue for our small businesses in the downtown area!  
#siloamsgotit   Other Ways You Can Help...Don't have the funds to support the campaign? You can still help! Share 
our story with your friends and family through Facebook, Twitter, 
Instagram and through email! Or do you have books that you can donate to
 our little library? Feeding your mind is just as important as taking 
care of your body. We let anyone in our community take or donate books 
from the RBF little library and we're always looking for more!Want to more more about RBF? Follow us on Instagram (@redbeardfit) or on Facebook (facebook.com/redbeardfitness).

story:
My name is Jeff Brunner, I was married to Susie for just over 22 years.  We have one child, our daughter Chelsea.  Susie battled triple negative breast cancer for 3 years, but lost the war to the disease on December 11th, 2013.  During her fight, our office, which she ran for 21 years with me, nearly came to a standstill.  With no family in the area and none able to come and help, I was Susie's sole caretaker except when Chelsea was able to come home from school.  It was very important to Susie that Chelsea continue her studies and not change course due to her illness.  As the overhead of the office continued to accrue, patient visits dwindled to only a handful each week. During those 18 months the medical supplies and pharmaceutical bills not covered by the limited insurance drained all savings and took most of the severely reduced income. 

Chelsea not only lost her mother, who was also her best friend, but now her childhood dream of working with me as a doctor of chiropractic is in jeopardy as the whole ordeal has left the office finances in arrears and attending chiropractic college not fiscally likely.  While some may think this campaign is self serving, my intent is to utilize any and all funds raised to get out of arrears, hire the quality help I need and to begin regular advertising to ensure an ongoing supply of new people we can help.  The campaign goal of $40,000 is the estimated amount needed to attain these business objectives. I am certain that with this boost we will regain the momentum we built over the last two decades, and all the patients who count on our office will be taken care of for many more years to come.

During all of this, Chelsea, thanks to her faith, and work ethic instilled in her in large part by Susie, has been able to persevere with her studies. She is now more determined than ever to earn her degree, which we know makes Susie smile. 

Please help us continue to serve our community as well as help Chelsea honor her mother's wishes by letting a many as you can know about this sincere effort. Indiegogo makes it easy with the share tools they provide.  Thank you, and God Bless.

story: As most of you probably know our dad has been in a hospital in Portugal for 5 weeks now and the doctors have said that they can fly him home now so we are trying to raise money to go towards this.  We are going to be doing a sponsored walk on Sunday the 5th of October and any sponsors would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Mama Doe and Baby Fawn...

Did you know that the Environmental Working Group did a test on umbilical cords of newborn babies and found an average of 232 chemicals? Some of these chemicals included BPA, a plastic component and synthetic estrogen. They are chemicals found in a wide array of common household products -- a list that is as long as it is familiar -- shampoos and conditioners, cosmetics. (source cnn.com) 
Recently my son was diagnosed with OCD, Sensory Processing Disorder, and Anxiety Disorder. He didn't have any of these issues when he was small, he had no signs of being on the spectrum. I believe that our children are being affected by our environment, what they eat, and what we put on their bodies. 
My commitment to bringing safe and truly chemical free skin and body care to the world is almost an obsession. I think it's a healthy obsession. We need to keep ourselves and our children safe. I look at it this way... If you start with one bottle of cleanser or jar of face cream, you are bound to start thinking about what else you use that has chemicals and if you are going to use one organic product than why not branch out and keep that ball rolling. We all have to start somewhere and what the earth needs is for us to go back to ORGANIC. No more GMO's, pesticides, insecticides, synthetics, or dyes. our children don't need these things in their bodies and our planet doesn't need it in the soil. 
My passion is in the earth... dirty hands make me happy. I started Fawn and Willow because I was tired of reading labels on "Organic" and "Natural" skin care that listed off cancer causing, hormone disrupting, and allergy causing ingredients (just to name a few) and were deemed natural. The FDA does NOT regulate the skin care and body care industry and it's ingredients.  If it's an "approved" chemical for market or food, companies can dump whatever they want into your products. By now it's a well published fact that we absorb up to 60% of what we leave on our skin all day. Words like Organic and Natural have been used in one marketing ploy after another, in the end meaning nothing. A product may hold actual organic ingredients but once you add DMDM Hydantoin and urea, propylene glycol, parabens, and phthalates, it doesn't matter if those ingredients are organic because these chemical negate their positive effects.
I started growing my own Organic herbs and making my own tinctures and serums. And you know what? They work. They work 10 times better than anything I have ever spent hundreds of dollars on in a department store. I always had this dream of returning to the old ways, to really trusting flowers and herbs to do what they were created to do. It's beautiful. I have been studying botany, biology, and herbal medicine since I was a teen wandering through the woods in Massachusetts. 
When we can we purchase local like beeswax from local PA apiaries and organic honey when we are in Maine. Our packaging even comes from a company here in PA, just an hour away in Lancaster so we can pick it up and reduce our footprint on shipping.
But we can't do this without your help...

Why We Need Funding... 

Your contribution will go directly to the build Baby Fawn and Mama Doe line. Sourcing high end organic ingredients with chemical preservatives is expensive and I never wanted to go to investors. I believe that investors can have affect on the original goal and while I'm still building and fulfilling the dream I would rather depend on YOU.


Your Contribution Helps the Planet...

By supporting small organic farmers you are directly contributing to healing the planet. Not only are we passionate about our product and how it's made... we are even more passionate about our Earth and reversing the effects of Global Warming and Climate Change so that our future generations can spend their days outside in the sun. 

We also actively plant bee and monarch friendly plants and flowers because there is a severe shortage of these very important pollinating insects. Saving the bees is crucial to all of us, not just farmers but the world in general. 1/3 of our food supply comes from pollinators! Without them we would lose so many of our precious amazing fruits and vegetable.

Your contribution will go to plant purchases for our greenhouse and our butterfly garden as well.


    Risks & Challenges

    As a entrepreneur and business owner all of my adult life, I have complete confidence that we will meet our goals of obtaining USDA Organic Certification, Non-GMO Verification status, and making our farm what it is meant to be. The beautiful thing about this project is that it brings my true love and passion for the environment and farming into my everyday life and allows me to share and teach YOU in the process.  

    Certification is challenging, and can take years. We are not daunted because it's worth it to show farmers that they too can become completely organic and give up dependance on pesticides and insecticides.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute right now, thats ok! If you can share our goal and tell your friends about us, thats all we need. The more people who know, the better. Education is power and we need to be educated to help our planet. 

      Stay tuned as well and follow us on FB so you can watch our progress and maybe learn a thing or two about organic gardening!

story:
What is Laughing Sprouts?

We make healthy lunches and deliver them. $5 a pop.

Our mission: To provide a high quality, healthy, affordable, socially responsible lunches to daycare children and staff, schoolchildren, teachers and administrators in the greater Chattanooga area.

We're going to be the first lunch delivery service in town. We’ll also be sourcing organic and locally-grown sustainable ingredients from farms and community-supported agriculture. Good for the planet, good for the body.



Sample menu items

We've tested a mountain of recipes and figured out how to make them as healthy as possible with veggies and fiber added in ways that you'd never suspect. But we don't need to tell the kids that.  ;)

Mac & Cheese Muffins
Macaroni and cheese is one of the easiest foods to add healthy ingredients to without sacrificing taste. Our muffins have egg, sweet potato and carrots tucked inside.

Enlightened Enchiladas
We use low-fat cheese, low-fat turkey/beef, and veggies like zucchini, spinach and cauliflower cut so small you'll never notice that they're snuck in.

Spaghetti & Meatballs 
100% grass fed and organic beef with tiny undetectable spinach, broccoli, green peas and wheat germ.

Grass-fed Burger
100% grass-fed and organic beef, prepared low-fat with locally grown veggies on top. 

We even have a healthy Brownie recipe that has half the sugar and fat of box brownies, and is tricked out with pureed spinach, blueberries, oat bran and wheat germ hidden in it — it tastes amazing and the kids are none the wiser!

We have tons of recipes and will include other lunchtime classics like butternut squash soup, turkey wraps, veggie sushi, chicken tenders, healthy pizza, caesar salad, quesadillas, taco salad, mozzarella pesto sandwich, and lots of healthy sides like fruit kebabs, veggies, berries, banana bread, applesauce, etc. 


Proven business model

Lots of other places in the country have extremely successful lunch delivery services like this:


• Kids Deli in Miami
• Smart Lunches in Boston, Philly, Chicago, DC
• Wholesome Tummies in Florida
• Munchery, Spoonrocket and Sprig in the Bay Area
• SoupCycle in Portland
• ....but there’s nothing like this in Chattanooga which is why we want to do it!

Our unique twist is that:
1. We're the first-to-market in this area. That gives us a tremendous leg up since there's no competition.
2. All the meals are made with locally-grown produce, as organic as possible. This way we’re supporting our customers and the local economy at the same time.

Why this is needed

We know that parents get stressed and have busy schedules so preparing lunches is a chore. We also know that regular school lunches are yucky — their taste and often questionable ingredients. Having two kids of our own, we know that it's possible to get kids to eat healthier and try new foods. And we're pretty crafty with how we sneak veggies into traditional recipes that kids already like eating.


What We Need 

All funds raised in this campaign will go towards covering the costs needed to get the business off the ground and running for the first 6-9 months.

This is our big chance. Family and friends have offered us some seed money, and we believe crowdfunding can help us make our plan a reality.  We have worked hard for over a year, writing and editing our business plan. We have tested recipes for over three years, and our heart and soul are completely in this. We met with the local branches of SCORE and the Small Business Association who went over our business plan with us. We received high praises for our work, and most importantly they believe this will be a successful business in Chattanooga! 
Here's our budget breakdown:




Who we are

We’re a small working-class family with big hearts, big dreams, and a lot of experience in the food industry and community-based service programs. 

Celebrated 10 wonderful years of marriage this October :)


Michelle has 10+ years of experience in the food service industry.

• Managed Bagelicious Cafe & Bagel Shop in St. Augustine FL

• Created farm-to-table menus at Nolichucky Bluffs Bed & Breakfast, TN

• Worked as a server at numerous fine dining establishments


Sumner has successfully started, run, and managed businesses and community programs before:

• Earned a B.A. in Business at Flagler College

• Managed a fitness center in Ames, IA

• Co-founder and manager of Loose Screws gift shop, rare video, and music venue in St. Augustine FL from 2003-2007. Held numerous film screenings, speaking engagements, workshops, and  provided free meeting space to various community groups in St. Johns County. (5 years)

As a part of Loose Screws' commitment to the community, Sumner also spearheaded the following projects:

• Co-founder of Loose Sprockets. This group collected used, old or trashed bicycles, fixed them up and gave them to migrant farm worker families. In the first year, over 100 bikes were given out for free. All bikes, parts and labor was donated. (2 years)

• Helped with local Food Not Bombs chapter, providing a free meal 7 nights a week, serving primarily the homeless population of St. Augustine FL. Received donations from local restaurants and had a waiting list of church groups and volunteers who wanted a night to serve. (7 years)

• Gathered clothes, blankets, bug spray and toiletries for homeless residents four times per year. (5 years)

• Co-founder of the local awareness group “People United to Stop Homelessness” (PUSH). Raised awareness on homelessness in county and eased tension between police, business community, residents and homeless population. Presented at Florida Coastal School of Law on homeless issues.

• Bicycle Advocacy: Convinced all county commissioners to commit that any time a county road was redone or built, bike lanes would be included in the plans.

• Co-founder and operator of the local independent newspaper “The Collective Press”. It was the only not-for-profit, citizen-run newspaper in St. Augustine FL. (4 years)

• Big Brother of St. Johns County mentorship volunteer (2 years)

• Helped construct a community garden on a neglected property in a low income community in St. Augustine FL.

• Sumner currently works with the Chattanooga Mobile Market, bringing fresh and healthy food to the city's food deserts and low-income neighborhoods where fresh fruits and veggies are hard to come by.



Why we're doing this

Having two little girls of our own made us realize how important it is that all people,  especially kids, have healthy meals during the day, and we strive to make that easier for families in the Chattanooga area. And it goes beyond a good meal — we believe that all of this contributes to a healthier world and better planet too.

We don’t have rich parents or inheritances to back us up, and we don’t want to rely on fancy investors that will take half the ownership of our business away from us.

We have always been DIY, and using Indiegogo allows lower income families like ours to start a business — something formerly out of reach for a large segment of Americans. We moved up to the mountains and started Sassafras Farms to provide healthy food for our local community, and to provide a gathering space for people working creatively to make a more just and equitable world.

Through Laughing Sprouts and our network, we aim to provide affordable healthy lunches while also building an alternative business community. We believe it’s a pretty radical thing and we’d love for you to be a part of this journey with us.

Here's a couple pics of what we had going on this summer:



Risks & Challenges

We need startup capital. But that's why we're here on Indiegogo asking you to join our friends and family with helping us get the funds to launch this baby. Kicking off the Indiegogo campaign now (and succeeding!) means that we'll be able to make Laughing Sprouts a reality with the start of 2016.

First time in this business. Even though Sumner has owned his own business and Michelle has experience in a similar field as Laughing Sprouts, neither has directly participated in the school lunch delivery business. But we've spent hundreds of hours on research and development of our business plan, outreach strategy, and we're prepared to hit the ground running once we launch.

Building traction. Every startup has to think about getting enough customers quickly  enough to be immediately profitable. We're planning on starting small, and building slowly if necessary. Our combined years of experience starting and running previous businesses gives us the insights and the know-how to leverage local business/personal relationships. Also, our business model is based on numerous successful companies all across America. We are very fortunate to be the first company doing this in Chattanooga's market and that will give us a tremendous leg up.


FAQs

How will we get access to so much locally-grown food?
Sumner has been ordering from local farmers for over three years for the Chattanooga Mobile Market — a not-for-profit bringing healthy foods to food deserts which lack grocery stores and fresh produce. There is more than enough food grown locally to support Laughing Sprouts as we grow.

How can such high-quality lunches be this cheap?
Easy. The larger quantity of food you order the cheaper it becomes — and one of our long term goals is to use organic food that we grow right at Sassafras Farms.  And our network of local farmers have fair, comparable pricing that will help keep our lunches affordable for working class families. 

Will there be a good variety of dishes?
Yep, we already figured this out, testing recipes over the last 3 years. We have dozens upon dozens of healthy alternatives to traditional foods. See the sample menu items above, and feel free to write us with any questions.


...and since you made it this far, so here's a laugh to get things going :)

Video Outtakes

https://youtu.be/UZXiFP6qDRI


Thanks for your donation! Please continue to spread the word about our campaign!
Thank you so much for your support,
Laughing Sprouts
Sumner, Michelle, Amaya and Phoenix



Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate! Ask your friends to donate too :)
  • Get the word out! Forward this campaign to anyone you know in the Chattanooga metropolitan area that might like to sign up for Laughing Sprouts lunch delivery and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Blast it on social media
  • Tell a buddy in the press, or friends with blogs, to cover our story
  • Host a local dinner in your area and ask guests to make a contribution to our campaign

Raised awareness on homelessness in county and eased tension between police, business community, residents and homeless population. Presented at Florida Coastal School of Law on homeless issues.• Bicycle Advocacy: Convinced all county commissioners to commit that any time a county road was redone or built, bike lanes would be included in the plans.• Co-founder and operator of the local independent newspaper “The Collective Press”. It was the only not-for-profit, citizen-run newspaper in St. Augustine FL. (4 years)• Big Brother of St. Johns County mentorship volunteer (2 years)• Helped construct a community garden on a neglected property in a low income community in St. Augustine FL.• Sumner currently works with the Chattanooga Mobile Market, bringing fresh and healthy food to the city's food deserts and low-income neighborhoods where fresh fruits and veggies are hard to come by. 




Why we're doing this

Having two little girls of our own made us realize how important it is that all people,  especially kids, have healthy meals during the day, and we strive to make that easier for families in the Chattanooga area. And it goes beyond a good meal — we believe that all of this contributes to a healthier world and better planet too.

We don’t have rich parents or inheritances to back us up, and we don’t want to rely on fancy investors that will take half the ownership of our business away from us. 
We have always been DIY, and using Indiegogo allows lower income families like ours to start a business — something formerly out of reach for a large segment of Americans. We moved up to the mountains and started Sassafras Farms to provide healthy food for our local community, and to provide a gathering space for people working creatively to make a more just and equitable world. 
Through Laughing Sprouts and our network, we aim to provide affordable healthy lunches while also building an alternative
 business community. We believe it’s a pretty radical thing and we’d 
love for you to be a part of this journey with us.
Here's a couple pics of what we had going on this summer:





    Risks & Challenges 


 We need startup capital. But that's why we're here on Indiegogo asking you to join our friends and family with helping us get the funds to launch this baby. Kicking off the Indiegogo campaign now (and succeeding!) means that we'll be able to make Laughing Sprouts a reality with the start of 2016.
 First
time in this business.  Even
though Sumner has owned his own business and Michelle has
experience in a similar field as Laughing Sprouts, neither has
directly participated in the school lunch delivery business. But we've spent hundreds of hours on research and development of our business plan, outreach strategy, and we're prepared to hit the ground running once we launch.

Building traction. Every startup has to think about getting enough customers quickly  enough to be immediately profitable. We're planning on starting small, and building slowly if necessary. Our combined years of experience starting and running previous businesses gives us the insights and the know-how to leverage local business/personal relationships. Also, our business model is based on numerous successful companies all across America. We are very fortunate to be the first company doing this in Chattanooga's market and that will give us a tremendous leg up.
  


FAQs


How will we get access to so much locally-grown food? Sumner has been ordering from local farmers for over three years for the Chattanooga Mobile Market
 — a not-for-profit bringing healthy foods to food deserts which lack 
grocery stores and fresh produce. There is more than enough food grown 
locally to support Laughing Sprouts as we grow. 

How can such high-quality lunches be this cheap? Easy. The larger quantity of food you order the cheaper it becomes — and one of our long term goals is to use organic food that we grow right at Sassafras Farms.  And our network of local 
farmers have fair, comparable pricing that will help keep our lunches 
affordable for working class families. 


Will there be a good variety of dishes? Yep,
 we already figured this out, testing recipes over the last 3 years. We 
have dozens upon dozens of healthy alternatives to traditional foods. See the sample menu items above, and feel free to write us with any questions. 
...and since you made it this far, so here's a laugh to get things going :)Video Outtakes

 https://youtu.be/UZXiFP6qDRI


Thanks for your donation! Please continue to spread the word about our campaign!
Thank you so much for your support,
Laughing SproutsSumner, Michelle, Amaya and Phoenix
Other Ways You Can Help 
Donate! Ask your friends to donate too :)
Get the word out! Forward this campaign to anyone you know in the 
Chattanooga metropolitan area that might like to sign up for Laughing 
Sprouts lunch delivery and make some noise about this campaign.
Blast it on social media
Tell a buddy in the press, or friends with blogs, to cover our story
Host a local dinner in your area and ask guests to make a contribution to our campaign

story:
For a second year the Bay Area DIY Bio community is entering the Internationally Genetically Engineered Machine Competition (iGEM). This year’s project is just as ambitious as last year's Real Vegan Cheese.

What is BioSunblock?

BioSunblock is comprised of organic compounds called Mycosporine-like amino acids (MAA’s). MAA’s, also known as “microbial sunscreen,” compounds exhibit UV-protective qualities. MAA’s are naturally produced by organisms that usually live in marine environments with high amounts of UV exposure. The plan for this project is to genetically engineer bacteria to produce these compounds for sunscreen applications.

Why BioSunblock?

PABA and its derivatives are used in conventional sunscreens - however, PABA is was shown to induce DNA damage when applied to human skin cells in vitro and exposed to this UV light, despite it’s UV protection of the skin from incident UV rays. PABA’s use in sunscreens has been banned in the EU since this study. Other sunscreen compounds can cause coral reefs to bleach and cause mutations in its DNA leading to the degradation of the coral.
Mycosporine-like amino acids (“MAA’s”) are not known to be toxic to humans. In fact, many MAAs have simultaneous anti-oxidant properties in addition to their UV absorbing properties and thus may actually be beneficial in certain human conditions and when used for certain applications.

More about coral and BP-2 -> http://oceanservice.noaa.gov/news/feb14/sunscre...

More about PABA ->
http://www.livestrong.com/article/303974-negati...
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2405022

How does it work?

Genetic Engineering is arguably the greatest leap forward in human understanding and manipulation of nature in the whole history of mankind, above and greater than the invention of fire and the wheel combined. This project makes use of Genetic Engineering to force a bacteria to create a compound that it would never make and then use the tools of evolution to enhance that ability.

E.coli normally live in the human gut (large intestine) and thus in total darkness. We will to inject several modified genes so that e.coli are tolerant of UV (Ultra Violet Light). One of the possible chemical compounds that can make the bacteria tolerant to UV is Mycosporine. However that is a compound and DNA is only good at making proteins; therefore, we need to have the bacteria create proteins and enzymes that modify the proteins to become compounds.

After designing the process, we want to make it better, so we will employ “directed evolution” to enhance the process. We believe that if we stress the bacteria with UV that they will start to evolve better and more efficient mechanisms to protect themselves from UV.

So that is our project; start with some bacteria making sunscreen then subject them to a lot of sunshine and they will evolve to make more and better sunscreen.

Last year our team entered Real Vegan Cheese and took best in category and a Gold Medal at iGEM. We hope to top that this year with your support!

story:
Putter Cube- the simple way to a better putting stroke

The Putter Cube is a new golf training product from Perfect Pitch Golf. It is designed to let you feel what the pro’s feel when putting. The Putter Cube teaches you how to set your wrists in the proper position and maintain the position throughout the putting stroke.



How the Putter Cube Works

The Putter Cube is the easiest, most effective way to make more putts

  • Simply attach the Putter Cube to your grip using the Velcro strap
  • Position your wrist flush against the Putter Cube
  • Start rolling putts

You'll immediately feel a more secure, solid stroke. The kind of stroke that gets the ball rolling to the target every time.



How the Putter Cube Helps You Become a Better Putter


Sets your forearm and putter shaft on the same angle

Great putters setup with their forearm on the same angle as their putter shaft. This allows the arms and the putter to swing in unison producing a straighter stroke.

The Putter Cube ensures that you do this correctly. By positioning your wrist against the Putter Cube your forearm and putter shaft are setup correctly.

 

Maintains your wrist angle through impact

Any good putter will tell you that you need to maintain your wrist angle through impact to be successful. Breaking or flipping your hands will lead to the putter face opening or closing, off center contact, and missed putts.

The Putter Cube ensures that you maintain the wrist angle through the stroke. By placing your wrist against the Putter Cube your hands and wrist simply cannot break or flip. This ensures a solid stroke through impact and more made putts.


Makes your practice more effective

Everyone wants to putt better; however most golfers don't know what to do to become a better putter. By using the Putter Cube you ensure that you are developing the fundamental aspects of a better putting stroke.

Within a short time of using the Putter Cube you will start to make more putts. The more efficient your practice is the better a putter you will become.


Awesome Perks


$5 Great Golf Mojo

After intense negotiations we’ve come to a deal with the golf gods. For $5 here’s what you get: the next time you hit your tee shot in the trees, it will kick out in the fairway. Can’t go wrong with this perk and it never expires! Limit 1 per golfer.  

$15 Putter Cube- Super Early Bird Special

You are way ahead of the crowd and will get a Putter Cube for the lowest price possible. If you want make more putts and don’t want to spend much $$ this is for you. Don’t wait as we’re only offering 25 Putter Cubes at this price.

$20 Putter Cube- Early Bird Special

You missed the Super Early Bird Special but are still getting a great deal. Get a Putter Cube for a discounted price and take control of your putting stroke. We’re only offering 50 Putter Cubes at this price so don’t miss out on the discount.

$25 Putter Cube

Get a Putter Cube and start making more putts. Perfect your setup, solidify your stroke, and stop losing shots on the greens. This is the regular price the Putter Cube is going to sell for but it’s well worth it to improve your game.  

$39 Putting Improvement Package

Get a Putter Cube plus a 2 pack of the Putter Wheel. Using these training products separately will have you making more putts, but together you will be unstoppable on the greens. Click below for more info on the Putter Wheel.
Learn more about the Putter Wheel



$79 Short Game Improvement Package

Have the best short game in your foursome this year! Get a Putter Cube, 2 pack of the Putter Wheel, and a Perfect Pitch Golf Mat. This has everything you need to be your best around the greens. Click below for more info on the Putter Wheel and Perfect Pitch Golf Mat.
Learn more about the Putter Wheel
Learn more about the Perfect Pitch Golf Mat

story:
Get to Know Dorothy:

My name is Dorothy Bartomeo, and I'm a proud mom of 5. My health has always been a little off, it all started when I was younger but got worse as I grew up. I started having the most trouble with my health in 2007 when I suffered a stroke just before heart surgery. I became half paralyzed on my left side, continues to have seizures and was diagnosed with more diseases than I can count. On Christmas Eve I found out I was not only half paralyzed and dying, but also pregnant with twins. The pregnancy was practically me living at Long Island Jewish Medical Center in New Hyde Park NY due to lack of weight gain, seizures, heart failure, and eventually a blood clot to my lung (pulmonary embolism). The twins were born early and I became ill after the birth. The c-section wasn't done right and I was bleeding into my belly (which took months to discover). The hospital called me an hour after they discharged me to tell me to come back immediately, I needed a blood transfusion now or I'd die. After they discovered the ball of blood in my belly the size of a grapefruit they had to remove it. During that surgery they accidently cut my bladder which left me with a catheter in to take care of my newborn twins while my husband worked. Eventually I healed up and was "super mom", I had stopped taking all of the medication prescribed except my basics from my life, my heart medicine, breathing, and tummy. I cooked and cleaned like an energizer mommy & I loved it! I felt better than ever, got married, and had my 5th child. I was 252lbs.. Today I am a staggering 125lbs... I cannot remember when I was this small, even if 5th grade I was a size 5, today a size 5 falls to the ground and I find myself "borrowing" my children's clothes. What happened? Who knows! Since the stroke I've seen doctors of all specialties - literally (gastroenterology, pulmonologist, endocrinologist, hematologist, cardiologist, rheumatology, infectious disease, if you can think of it, I've seen it). My bloodwork has little things wrong but nothing that signified what was wrong, high white count with no symptoms and extreme weight loss with continuous vomiting and gastric obstructions. No diseases, nothing wrong... Literally... They are making things up at this point, I have "mini clots" micro emboli - yet my bloodwork is normal. They've named that "A Hypercoaguable state of undetermined origin". I was told I have gastroparesis, SVT, asthma, hypoglycemia, hypotension, and Chronic Obstructive Bronchitis, but those are symptoms. I've got in touch with a few doctors and scientists who have discovered through my old tests and current that I need abdominal reconstruction. My intestines, ovaries, and uterus are stuck to my abdominal wall and need to be reconstructed. My ovaries are losing blood supply along with parts of my intestine and uterus which is causing me to suffer from so many symptoms... 

1. Hot flashes, flushes, night sweats and/or cold flashes, 
clammy feeling, chills

2. Bouts of rapid heart beat

3. Irritability

4. Mood swings, sudden tears

5. Trouble sleeping through the night (with or without night sweats)

6. Crashing fatigue - Chronic Fatigue

7. Anxiety, feeling ill at ease

8. Feelings of dread, apprehension, doom (inevitable death)

9. Difficulty concentrating, disorientation, mental confusion

10. Disturbing memory lapses

11. Prolapse of uterus do to rapid decrease in estrogen levels.

12. Itchy, crawly skin 

13. Aching, sore joints, muscles and tendons 

14. Increased tension in muscles

15. Headaches, severe migraines that are unstoppable and last for days

16. Gastrointestinal distress

17. Sudden bouts of bloat

18. Exacerbation of existing conditions

19. Chronic sinusitis

20 Nasal infections-necessitating antibiotics

21. Weight loss

22. Dizziness, light-headedness, episodes of loss of balance

23. Electric shock or stabbing sensation under the skin.

24. Tingling in the extremities, 

25. Gum problems, increased bleeding

26. Stabbing pains in pelvic area at time of ovulation

27. Extreme Weakness every 3 hours

28. Swollen Glands & Nodules 

29. Random Blood Clots through body

and so many more... I only take my prescribed medicine from my doctors that are required for me to stay alive.. I'm 28 years old and a mom of 5, I love my family with all of my heart, please help me be here for them. I included as much information as I could - I'm a little shaky and my eyes are blurry so I'll fill anyone in if I missed something. Thank you for the support.

-----

Peter came up with a wonderful idea to setup a donation fund in which every member of Camry Nation donates $10! We would reach the goal in no-time!

story:
Knowing how to prevent or at least spot it early is the key to minimize the devastating consequences of cancer. Talent Yakado, herself a survivor of cervical cancer, has established Tanyaradzwa Cancer Trust to take on the battle. Help her take the effort of her organisation to the next level.

Cancer is a huge problem, world wide. Focus is often on treatment, which is mostly expensive and too often of limited avail. Prevention, if possible, and early discovery are therefore extremely important.

Talent Yakadzo from Harare, Zimbabwe, supporting her family working as a full time waitress, discovered this when she was diagnosed with cervical cancer in 2011. After successful treatment she was surprised to learn how easily this cancer form can be either totally avoided, or at least treated with a very good outcome if discovered early. What she realized at the same time, though, was that this knowledge is almost a secret, because nobody talks about the subject.

She therefore established Tanyaradzwa Cancer Trust with the purpose raising awareness towards the problem. Tanyaradzwa was acknowledged by the Zimbabwean health authorities in 2012, and has since been staging a number of events: talks, meetings, conferences, sharing her experiences with numerous women and men, often supported by leading health professionals and experts. But, without external funding the drive has depended on Talent's spare time and resources, with organisational backing from the Book Cafe, the place where she works.

This crowdfunding campaign is thus aimed at enabling the next step for Tanyaradzwa Cancer Trust.

  • A host of public events in the first half of 2015.

  • Staging events outside Harare, in Mashonaland East, as stated in the agreement with the Ministry of Health.

  • The further development of goals and strategies.

  • Securing cooperation with external partners, both for financial purposes and to widen the exchange of experiences made in the effort.

  • The establisment of a homepage to make the work of Tanyaradzwa Cancer Trust more visible, and to make information and links easily accessible.

  • Initiating a membership drive, giving TCT a broad, public base

  • Enabling Talent to concentrate more on the work with events and administration.

This is only an outline of important tasks in the near future. As a new organisation, founded by people with no previous experience in this line of work, and with numerous other obligations in life, we strive to develop fast. A contribution to this campaign will supply invaluable support in the strive to provide important information about cancer to all Zimbabweans, to get them to talk about the subject, and convince them that things can and must be done to minimize the effect of the disease, both for the individual, the family, and the whole society.


http://www.thezimmail.co.zw/2014/02/04/cancer-d...

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100005820311693&fref=ts

http://www.afro.who.int/en/clusters-a-programmes/frh/sexual-and-reproductive-health/programme-components/prevention-of-cervical-cancer.html

about cancer to all Zimbabweans, to get them to talk about the
subject, and convince them that things can and must be done to
minimize the effect of the disease, both for the individual, the
family, and the whole society. 
http://www.thezimmail.co.zw/2014/02/04/cancer-d...

https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100005820311693&fref=ts

http://www.afro.who.int/en/clusters-a-programmes/frh/sexual-and-reproductive-health/programme-components/prevention-of-cervical-cancer.html

story:
About the Project

Ebola is real, and it's killing thousands of people. A cure needs to be developed quickly, but the reality is that hardly anyone is working towards that. Neither is there a way to contribute to cure research- until now. We will be working with top researchers all over the world to learn even more about Ebola so that we will be able to develop a cure and save lives.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Research is incredibly expensive. However, we've tried to find top scientists that are willing to contribute to finding a cure at a very low cost. That's why we've set an initial campaign goal of $50,000 to get research started.
  • We won't be offering amazing perks. Since this is a charity project, we don't have the ability to offer expensive stuff in return. However, you should know that you're contributing to something very important- and that's what matters the most.
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, depending on research costs and progress we will still try to get as far as possible. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Feel free to share this campaign with others. Right now, we're the only place to go for donations to Ebola cure development.

    Financial Info

    Our plan is to manage financial aspects as follows:
    - >99%: Will go directly into cure research
    - <1%: Will be used to cover costs of the campaign. Since we will rely on sharing by contributors for this campaign we won't have any marketing costs and thus we  expect and hope to be able to keep campaign costs extremely low.

    Progress

    Throughout the campaign we will keep you updated on research progress and cure developments.

story:
Seen On

 
 

Let QTemp Help You

Whether you're monitoring the UV index for medical reasons, or spend a lot of time outdoors, QTemp sends alerts to help you keep on top of your skin health. It helps you protect your loved ones, too.

Don’t be fooled - the UV index doesn’t depend on temperature. QTemp helps you protect yourself in both hot and cold locations. It also makes a great travel companion or gift!

UVA radiation accelerates aging while UVB radiation causes sunburns. According to the Skin Cancer Foundation, car windows let in over 60% of UVA radiation. 50% of UVA radiation can pass through windows. 80% of UV radiation can penetrate thin clouds, so you can still experience overexposure on overcast days.

Closer Look

 

 

International Backers: We ship QTemp worldwide. 

 

Join the QTemp family and let everyone know that you’re at the forefront of technology.
story_txt:
QTemp provides a simple way to measure the UV index in your immediate surroundings. It estimates Safe Sun Time based on your skin type, location, and UV index to help you safely spend time outdoors.  
Seen On  

   QTemp continuously measures UVI and transmits the readings to your smartphone. QTemp has a replaceable regular coin cell battery and is compatible with iOS 9.3 and later, and selected Android devices with 5.0.1 and later with Bluetooth 4.

 
Key Features
QTemp is a wearable gadget with a companion app that helps you make healthier choices. QTemp is simple, convenient, and durable.

Main App Features

Safe sun time reminder
Personalized sun safety tips
Easy sun exposure tracker
Accurate hourly, daily, and weekly weather forecasts
Compatible with Android and iPhone

Main Device Features

Accurate readings of UVA/UVB and temperature
Wireless: uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) connectivity
Internal data recorder stores data for up to one month
Long battery life (45 days with a non-rechargeable coin battery)
Durable, small, and ultra-light

 
Sleek, comfortable and wearable Clip it to your clothes, keep it on your keychain or mount it to a wall. With its weather resistant design, you can wear QTemp all day, every day.  
          Download from App Store                                  
          Download from Google Play                                 

Let QTemp Help YouWhether you're monitoring the UV index for medical reasons, or spend a lot of time outdoors, QTemp sends alerts to help you keep on top of your skin health. It helps you protect your loved ones, too.Don’t be fooled - the UV index doesn’t depend on temperature. QTemp helps you protect yourself in both hot and cold locations. It also makes a great travel companion or gift!  Why You Need QTemp 
Stay aware of harmful UV rays
1 in 5 Americans, 1 in 7 Canadians and 2 in 3 Australians are developing skin cancer in their lives, mostly because of overexposure to the sun. Overexposure to the sun is the leading cause of skin cancer. It’s time to stop risking our health, and start protecting ourselves and our loved ones. Allow QTemp to help you live a healthier and more comfortable lifestyle.

 

UVA radiation accelerates aging while UVB radiation causes sunburns. According to the Skin Cancer Foundation, car windows let in over 60% of UVA radiation. 50% of UVA radiation can pass through windows. 80% of UV radiation can penetrate thin clouds, so you can still experience overexposure on overcast days.

A 35-year-old melanoma survivor’s skin under normal light and UV light. Know the real temperatureSmartphones don’t detect the air temperature, only a rise or fall in internal battery temperature. QTemp measures the temperature of your immediate surroundings.
 Weather Apps vs. Actual Weather
 
 

Closer Look







 
How We Got HereWe started with a simple concept of improving people's health through analyzing weather data. We worked through countless research papers, development projects, prototypes, tests, and early marketing activities. We've received amazing encouragement and support along the way. Now we’re ready to hit the market and we’re asking for your help to gear up for manufacturing and development

 


 

 


 

Key features and functionality
 Who We AreWe’re a team of designers, engineers, and marketing professionals with a passion for developing new products. We have worked on several projects to enhance outdoor thermal comfort over the last few years. We’re constantly working to improve QTemp to ensure our users receive optimal benefits.

 
International Backers: We ship QTemp worldwide. 
 

Join the QTemp family and let everyone know that you’re at the forefront of technology.

story:
Here is the short and sweet version of our story. We opened our restaurant in June of 2014. We opened with 1/4 of the money that you should, but we wanted to attempt our dream. Success or failure, at least we tried and owned our own restaurant for awhile. The building left ALOT to be desired. The day we opened, all funds were gone and we overlooked one little thing. Money in the cash register to make change!!! So we borrowed some cash and we began our voyage. Our building is 120 years old, resting on a creek bank. Over the years it has developed a little bit of a lean. From one side to the other is a 9 inch difference in elevation. The basement floods (alot), and there is no public restroom. 


The electrical is over 50 years old so we blow breakers rather frequently. But just as the first time you moved out, into your own place, you are in love. All the imperfections, become cute and lend character to your dwelling. And then how quickly you outgrow them. For us it is a little more than just tired of the imperfections. Our guest have been understanding and got the charm of the place....but they deserve better. 


We have been given the opportunity to move a mere mile away, to a new building with level floors, two public restrooms and, the ability to seat up 40 people. The only hangup is we need a piece of equipment that cost 12,000 dollars. This is what we are aiming for. Raise this money to move to our new location, same menu, same hours, same great food, and still delivery service. Only now we will have monthly dinners, late night service, and the ability to cook even better food, and faster too. We can do more amazing specials, and in this particular spot we can move into the dinner service that we want to be doing. 


If we do not reach our goal, we will need the funds to get more equipment for our current place. We need more tables (that aren't warped) more seats, picnic tables and, more equipment to be able to cook faster. Right now we have only two pans that we cook for our guests with. As soon as we cook, we hurry and wash that pan after each time. We will also have better ventilation with your help. We will be very busy this summer, and the last thing we want is to not be able to take care of our regulars or give a bad experience to anyone, first time or not. 


We want to be around for the long haul. Check out our facebook, perfect reviews!! Look into tripadvisor and yelp. Perfect reviews. Well nearly, the only complaints were about the building, which is something that we cannot control. Help us get to a better venue. For us..For you!!!

story:
It is constantly repeated that most Ukrainian soldiers are dying from bleeding to death and not from lethal shots. Celox can save a life and each package only costs $22. Please contribute. I am asking those who trust me since I am not representing any official organization. The celox will be delivered directly to the hands of the soldiers. I will post all receipts of my purchases. Indiegogo has transaction fees but so far this is the quickest and most efficient way for me to raise finances for medical supplies.

Please contribute.

story:
Short Summary

At Happy Ears, the parent company of Happy Jr, we love sounds and we want kids to be exposed to sounds. Sounds are critical for a child’s learning, discovery and development. The sound of a bee in the garden, screams from a rollercoaster or that first concert with mom or dad; sounds are wonderful. Sound though is not necessarily noise. There is a difference between sounds and noise and even noise pollution. A child may scream or cry if a siren goes off in their vicinity, but not even notice “noise”. Noise and noise pollution though is a growing problem in modern society and more needs to be done to protect kids from its harm. It is now well documented that repeated exposure to even moderate noise levels are harmful to a child’s health. Once an adult, hearing loss leads to increased risk of heart disease. Often underappreciated are the long-term effects on mental health. 

Strangely, consumers spend to purchase organic foods to protect their children from chemicals and pesticides and they spend to protect their children’s skin and eyes from the sun yet nothing to protect their ears? Happy Ears discovered when you create a discreet, comfortable, reusable earplug that can be used during sleep, travel or to attend a concert, adults do choose to protect their ears.

Happy Ears created Happy Jr. to offer kids the same ability to protect their hearing and health. Another high quality product from Happy Ears that was designed in Sweden and will be “Made in Sweden”; Happy Jr. is the hearing protection device parents will want their kids to wear. It will turn down the volume in your child’s life and dare we say it’s even stylish.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 10.000 USD to be able to take this product to production. 
  • The total cost of the tool and testing is 40.000 USD, but we can finance the remaining part our selfs. But if we reach the stated 30.000 USD and go above we can speed up the process and add on extra cotton bags and cardboard boxes to the final product. 

 

​

 

 

 

The Impact

There isn't a satisfying product on the market that is targeted towards kids (infants to teenager). Thats why we created Happy Jr. 

  • Areas of use: music festivals, in school, while commuting and in noisy environments. 
  • We did launch Happy Ears earplug a couple of year ago, and it was a great success. Today we´re selling it all over the world and have been featured in New York Magazine (as worlds best earplug for sleep), Forbes Magazine, Womens Health, Vogue Japan, Coolhunter and Times Magazine UK (a must have accessory). Just to name a few.

 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Happy JR will be produced at the same ISO Certified factory in Stockholm, Sweden where we have successfully produced Happy Ears since 2012. For over two years we’ve worked on the development and theory behind our new innovation and recently we filed our patent. Thus in theory we’re all set with the world’s best hearing protection for kids and teenagers. In detail that means: 
1) Even attenuation = so your kids can hear their class mates, teachers and enjoy events (music, sports) just like we as parents do with high quality ear plugs in noisy environments.  
2) Light and comfortable to use. 
3) Look smashing.

Although we’re done in theory the risk and challenges of a new production line is always present as the first batch is going to be rolled out. We have both internal as well as external risks. 

Internal risks 
We’ve learned a lot from our previous project launches over the last decade, and (this time), engaged top Swedish engineers, patent lawyers, product developing experts etc already from the start in order to minimize all potential obstacles. We’re a solid team. 
Nonetheless, there are risks and challenges to get any physical item right in production and in regards to Happy JR the ones that still exists at this point are the following ones; 

#1: we don't know how exactly how even the attenuation is going to be. With Happy Ears we managed to get the best attenuation in the market. For Happy JR we have a pretty good hunch that it will be good, but if we hit the bulls eye again is up to the gods.

#2: We know for a fact that it is going to be light. Very light. About four times lighter compared to what’s out in the market for kids today and thereby much more comfortable to wear. 

What we don't know though is exactly how comfortable they will feel when finally produced. We have 3D SLA models and various clay and rubber castings which has been tested on all our kids, our kids friends and their friends friends to get the perfect fit. (But these 3D SLA models are not that comfortable. Obviously.) 

#3: Hey, here we evaluate the risk to approximately 50% that we are going to design an ugly and corny hearing protection like all others have been doing for the 30 years. We are not really that worried about this part, although you never know in product development what surprises will pop up (production, material, or a combination of these).

External risks 
We have created a solid production plan for all you backers and done our very best to forecast demand for this campaign. Nonetheless, sometimes our forecasts aren’t always right on the spot but if we would miss our projections this time we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible. 

Supply Chain Risk 
As already mentioned the manufacturing will take place at the factory in Stockholm which has over 30 years experience and with whom we’ve build a steady relation to over the past 5 years. However, unexpected shortages can occur and component delays may occur so we must take that into account. If it happens, we’ll keep you updated along the progress and do everything in our power to solve the problem as quickly as possible.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not all of you out there can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can always help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. If you share on social media: please direct them to our Indigogo campaign or to our instagram: @happyearsonline. Plus Indigogo has great tools to share content. 

Tack, och hoppas ni vill backa oss!

story:
About

We’ve tried other “smart” bike lights, and none of them really worked correctly. They were too sensitive, not sensitive enough, or they would stay on using a timer instead of actual braking force. Utter garbage. So we decided to create a smart light that actually works.

When you apply the brake, the ultra-bright brake light turns on. When you stop applying the brakes, the lights go back to normal. Plain and simple, and G-Light does it really well.

If you get the remote with your G-Light, you'll be able to use the integrated turn signals. You'll never have to hand signal again! Please note that turn signals will only work if you get the remote with your G-Light.

G-Light is the world's first bike light with 90º turn detection technology. The turn signals stop automatically when you've finished turning, just like a car!

We specifically designed the G-Light to be compatible with electric skateboards from the start. Its low profile design and included baseplate clip will have you shredding the streets in style. And of course, the smart brake light works just the same.

We’ve loaded G-Light's memory to the brim with eye-catching presets! It’s got loads of red strobes, fades and static presets. And for countries that allow them, we’ve included a bunch of colorful presets too. Your friends will all want one!

With G-Light’s seven ultra-bright LEDs, drivers will see you from farther away, keeping you safer than with any other light.

If you find that your G-Light’s sensitivity has changed, it might be out of level. Not to worry! With its easy leveling tool, it takes a mere 10 seconds to get it perfectly level again.

The no-fuss magnetic remote holder guarantees that there will be zero time wasted. Just place and go!

Plug any micro USB cable into your G-Light to get it ready for your next ride.

Timeline

Risks and challenges

While we don't anticipate any major problems, we must always be prepared for events which are outside our control. The most likely of events would be delays during the tooling and manufacturing stage. To minimize any delays, we will be sourcing manufacturers with good capabilities in production, but also in engineering as well.

Our timeline accounts for the holiday season and Chinese new year, so we don't expect these events to have any effect on our delivery date.
