story:
Allbaro Air is not like an ordinary posture corrector. Allbaro’s innovative air cell technology provides personalized spinal support to align, strengthen, and correct your posture.

 

 

 

 

Allbaro Air is the world’s first and only posture corrector that uses a patented ergonomically-designed air pressure cell to fit your unique body. The air cell technology allows you to adjust the air pressure and create the most comfortable back support while effectively realigning your balance.

 

 

While the air cells offer comfort and effortlessly realign and balance your posture, they provides  incredibly firm spinal support with a powerful resistance strength of up to 300 pounds.

 

 

Allbaro’s innovative air cells are super easy to use. Simply twist the included hand air pump to the air valve and start pumping. To release the air, simply press the button on the air valve. 

 

 

Allbaro Air exhibited at CES 2020 and received amazing responses! Thank you so much for visiting us. As promised, we offer Allbaro Air at 50% OFF retail price here on Kickstarter as our Launch Day Special. 

 

 

 

Most posture correctors in the market simply focus on reminding you how slouching you are or holding only your shoulders backward, which often creates distractions with non-stop alerts and pain without much help to correct the posture.   

However, proper posture is a habit. It requires practice and consistency. Allbaro Air is designed to fit your body, NOT to fight your body, so that you can wear it comfortably anywhere any time.

 

 

Simply adjust the length of the band that goes over your shoulder and to the waist to create the best fit for your body. 

 

By pumping the air into the air cell, you can also adjust the air pressure to get the best support for your back.

 

 

The success of posture correction products depends on consistent use. Consistency depends on comfort. Allbaro Air is designed to provide a real and lasting solution for your health and comfort.

 

 

Dr. Kim says, ‘an increasing number of people regularly complain about back pain across all age groups. Our waists bear heavy weight with constant movement, increasing the chances of back injuries. The back is a sensitive, complex system of bones, discs, nerves, muscles, and ligaments forming and surrounding the spine.’

He also adds, ‘Our posture determines whether we experience back pain or develop spinal cord diseases. It is critical to correct bad posture as soon as possible. Correct posture alone can guarantee a healthy back.’

 

 

 

 

Allbaro Air is the only posture corrector that provides personalized spinal support with its patented air cell technology.  The air cells are developed based on the medical device standard of 300 KPa with the maximum internal air pressure resistance. 

 

 

Inflating and deflating the patented air cells takes minimal effort. The specially-designed hand pump fits easily onto the air valve. You can easily release the air with a simple press of the button on the valve.

 

 

The ergonomically-designed air cells softly wrap around the back and waist to gently correct bad posture.

 

 

The breathable mesh fabric prevents overheating and sweating through the day. The mesh is durable and protected fabric, and does not inconveniently attach to Velcro straps. 

 

 

Allbaro Air offers wide shoulder bands in order to prevent pain under armpits while wearing it. It is also made of high-quality neoprene fabric for durability. 

 

 

Excellent durability by double fabric sewing provides long-lasting comfort and fit even with extended use. 

 

 

Allbaro Air is tested safe from toxic substances such as arylamine, pH and formaldehyde.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Posture is not only about how you look. Posture determines how you feel and how others feel about you. Wear Allbaro Air and hold yourself high. Meet the attractive and powerful you.

 

 

Proper posture is a habit. A continuing choice. It requires practice and consistency. Allbaro Air, as comfortable as air, lightweight and breathable, is the posture corrector that you can wear every day. Start today!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PLEASE NOTE: 

1. You can choose your sizes for Double, Family, and Business Rewards after the campaign. We will be sending out surveys to collect your shipping information along with your selection of sizes after the campaign successfully ends. 

2. Duties and taxes may apply in some countries. We will make sure to safely deliver Allbaro Air at your door, and we'd like to kindly ask our backers to take care of duties and taxes if applied. If you have any questions, please contact us at hello@allbaroair.com.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We are thrilled to introduce our new product, Allbaro Air, through Kickstarter and cannot wait to meet with Kickstarter backers. We are confident to claim that Allbaro Air is the revolutionary solution for your perfect posture.

It all started from this one question:  “Why can’t we make a posture corrector that can be comfortably worn every day?”

Good posture is a habit that requires consistency. And consistency depends on comfort. However, we found most of the posture correctors in the market uncomfortable, difficult to wear and even causing pain.

Our goal was obvious and simple:

Our team searched for solutions and EUREKA! It was a paradigm shift: we’ve been trying to fit our body into a posture corrector. What we need is a Posture Corrector that Fits Our Body!

Now we are ready to present our innovation to our backers, Allbaro Air: A Posture Corrector redefined. Product production is fully ready and we will start shipping as soon as the campaign closes.

Start today! Your Day 1 of Perfect Posture with Allbaro Air!

story:
I started my yoga journey a couple years ago after a back injury left me unable to work for several months. I had always been a fan of fitness, but after my injury I needed to find a gentle, restorative workout that would help me rebuild my strength as well as provide therapy for my injury. I began entering yoga challenges and pushing myself to give at least an hour a day to my practice. It became so much more than just poses and pictures, it became a way of life. I woke every day excited to warm up on the mat, excited to find another challenge and post a photo. I found a community full of fun loving, beautiful souls who shared the same passion I do. I also realized there was a demand for it in my area but there weren't many options for classes or teachers. I had friends ask me to teach them and I love to yoga with anyone, but I feel having my license and learning how to properly align them is very important. If you help me achieve my goal of obtaining my RYT you'll be bringing yoga to a community that really needs it. Even one hour of yoga every few days could help relieve so much pain and stress.

Any money from this fundraiser will go toward the books I need for the course, my RYT and my tent space at the school I will be learning from. This also includes any props or gear I may need for the course.

If the fundraiser does not meet its goal I will still be saving every penny and adding to it with every extra dime I have until the goal is reached. I have until June to raise this money and save my space at the school. I appreciate all of your help. Even a few shares goes a long way if you can't donate please please  share. Thank you so much for your valued time!

Thank you so much for your valued time!

story:
Fort Robinson Outbreak Spiritual Run - 400 miles

January 8-14, 2015


"Today they are not running from bullets and gunfire, today they are running for their future, they are running for the future generations that have yet to come" - Lynette Two Bulls, Yellow Bird, Executive Director
100+ Youth run 400 miles in 5 days 

Yellow Birds' Fort Robinson Outbreak Spiritual Run was founded by Phillip Whiteman Jr. originally, to pay homage to those Northern Cheyenne ancestors that broke out of Fort Robinson on January 9, 1879. Most of them were killed at this time, but a few survived and made it to their homeland, the Powder River country in Southeastern Montana. Because of the sacrifice of Chief Dull Knifes band, and the determination of Chief Little Wolfs people, they now have the Northern Cheyenne Reservation. Today the 19th Annual Fort Robinson Run has grown to be much more: It is about healing, wellness, and empowerment.

The runners include over 100 Northern Cheyenne youth from the reservation who range in age from 10 to young adults. We bring  youth from all backgrounds together . Many of the participants are considered “at risk” youth and come from disadvantaged backgrounds, and some come from strong families, they come together to mentor one another. The runners make a commitment to undertake a five day journey across 400 miles that commemorates their ancestry by replicating their epic journey from Nebraska to their homeland in Montana. They run day and night enduring January temperatures and physical hardships, much like their ancestors of 136 years ago. They learn valuable lessons of unity, responsibility to self and others, and how to overcome adversities. They encourage one another through winter weather, running through the sand-hills of Nebraska, the sacred Black Hills of South Dakota, and the plains and mountains of Montana. They gain a strong connection to the sacrifice of their ancestors, and a greater appreciation for life. The run instills in them a sense of pride, higher self-esteem, a deeper respect for their identity and sincere respect for their homeland, and connection to mother earth.

Your donation will help these youth complete this journey. Contributions will help pay for food, transportation, lodging, warm clothing, and empowerment programming for the youth.

story:
The UnaBASHed Smiles Foundation was conceived by three friends, Allison Colson, Kalynn Amundson, and Scotty Zollars, who through the difficulties of a good friend became aware of the dental trauma suffered by many victims of LGBT bullying. He had endured several years of bullying and gay-bashing and was faced with the progressive demise of his upper teeth. Following several serious dental emergencies and a series of consultations and second opinions, he received a two-phase treatment plan with a total cost $25,000. Being self-employed as a professional singer, he clearly couldn’t afford this treatment on his own. To support him and others like him, in August of this past year the three friends created a crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo called UnaBASHed Smiles. The campaign raised 62% of the $10,000.00 goal (the amount needed for the first phase of treatment) and after the Indiegogo crowdfunding fees were deducted, the campaign earned a total of $5,472.72. Although this first campaign did not succeed in reaching the initial $10,000 goal, the campaign committee unanimously agreed to search out alternative means to fund the dental treatment plan for their friend and first campaign recipient.

Failure to reach the fund-raising goal, was not going to be allowed to result in failure to reach the campaign's initial objective, dental restoration for their friend and campaign recipient. 

The campaign organizers needed a victory for their friend; they needed to show its generous donors the amazing achievement their financial support provided; and, most importantly, the campaign needed a success story with which to move forward and to become a vital non-profit organization in order to help the countless others who have suffered dental trauma from LGBT assaults.

As the committee explored ideas for funding the needed dental treatment, a campaign donor suggested seeking treatment outside the United States, specifically in Mexico where medical expenses are considerably less expensive. The committee, immediately and with caution, began to explore this option. After examining multiple clinics, the team was delighted to find one that considerately addressed all its concerns and would be able to complete the work with the limited campaign donations that had been received.

This clinic, the ConfiDent Smile Studio in Los Algodones, Baja California, Mexico, operates under the leadership of Dr. Danilo Gaspar who specializes in dental implantology. Working with Dr. Gaspar, the committee moved forward with the campaign and organized a treatment plan for their recipient. 

The results were better than could have been imagined. The campaign recipient received impeccable dental care and amazing customer service; furthermore, the campaign saved over $17,000 by having the treatment completed in Los Algodones.

The success of this campaign is completely due to the kindness and generosity of its donors, and for that the committee is truly humble and thankful. The donors' commitment and support brought the campaign one step closer to helping LGBT people who have suffered dental trauma from assault.

It is clear that UnaBASHed Smiles can be successful, that it is a desperately needed organization, and that it must move forward and become a non-profit, charitable organization. The committee met on May 15, 2015, and worked on the following agenda: 

1. Begin the process of establishing a non-profit foundation.

2. Establish a clear statement of purpose for the UnaBASHed Smiles Foundation.

3. Create articles of incorporation and by-laws.

4. Elect and establish a board of directors.

5. Determine terms of offices for the board of directors.

6. Establish the governing rules for the board of directors.

7. Explore and begin the process of officially applying for Section 501(c) (3) status. 

8. Determine the foundation start-up expenses and begin researching methods for launching the foundation start-up funds campaign.

9. To publish a press release providing a status update on the foundation.

Once the foundation has voted on moving forward with its chosen start-up funding campaign, another update will be released and the start-up funding campaign will begin.

Again, this campaign could not have achieved its first success without all of its donors. Their generosity gives the committee great hope that many more LGTB youth and adults will soon have reason to smile.

story:
Send Quidditch Darmstadt to EQC'16 in Gallipoli

Update: 

unfortunately we have seperate deadlines for our fancy perks! Keep this in mind:
Deadline for the team jersey: 25.03.2016
Deadline for the fancy T- Shirts: 08.04.2016

[English below]

Wer sind wir?

Jetzt fragst du dich sicher: Quidditch? Was ist das?  

Quidditch basiert auf dem gleichnamigen Sport aus den Harry Potter Romanen.

Wir spielen auf Besen in gemischt-geschlechtlichen Teams. Chaser machen mit dem Quaffel Punkte, Beater verhindern das durch die Klatscher und natürlich beendet der Seeker durch den Schnatz- Fang das Spiel. Quidditch ist ein Vollkontakt- Sport und nichts für schwache Nerven oder Knochen!

Klingt verrückt, ist auch so!  Wir sind die Darmstädter Quidditch- Mannschaft und wir wollen uns jetzt endlich auch international beweisen!

So sah unser Team vor einem Jahr aus. Seitdem haben wir viel gelernt, viel trainiert und viele neue Spieler gewonnen, die alle unbedingt in Italien spielen wollen:

 


Was wollen wir?

Wir haben es geschafft! Bei der 1. deutschen Quidditch- Meisterschaft hat sich Darmstadt für den European Quidditch Cup (EQC) in Italien, dem größten europäischen Turnier, qualifiziert! Nach einem genialen Turnier und hartem Training sind wir bereit für diese Herausforderung. Doch für das "Brooms Up" brauchen wir jetzt eure Hilfe! 

Unterstütze uns auf unserem Weg. Durch die Geldspenden von euch wird es unserem Team ermöglicht nach Gallipoli in Italien zu reisen. Die Reise und die Teilnahme am Turnier sind nicht ganz günstig. So muss das Team die Flüge, die Unterkunft und die Teilnehmergebühren für das Team und jeden Spieler bezahlen. Mit ein bisschen finanzieller Unterstützung kann aber der Traum vom EQC wahr werden!


Wer gewinnt hier?

mit eurer Hilfe natürlich wir 


und was habt ihr davon?

Natürlich geht ihr bei der Unterstützung nicht leer aus! Für jede Spende legt sich die Mannschaft so richtig ins Zeug. Als Gegenleistung erhaltet ihr verschiedene kreative und nützliche Geschenke aus Darmstadt! 


Vielleicht wollt ihr eins unserer Trikots- komplett für euch alleine. So sehen sie aus:


oder eventuell gefällt euch ja auch eins unsere selbst- designten T-Shirts:


Falls du ein T- Shirt haben möchtest, buche den Perk "T-Shirt". Danach kontaktieren wir dich und gehen sicher, dass du dein Lieblings- Design bekommst!

[English: if you want to get one of our t- shirts, book the perk "t- shirt". Afterwards we will contact you and make sure you will get you favorite design]  


außerdem haben wir viele, viele schöne weitere Perks. Und ihr bekommt viele schöne Kleinigkeiten von uns, zum Beispiel unsere Buttons oder Sticker:



was will man noch alles wissen? FAQ:

  • "Wie funktioniert der Schnatz?"
Der Schnatz wird von einem Schiedsrichter gespielt. Dieser hat einen Tennisball in einer Socke (=der Schnatz) hinten an seiner Hose befestigt. Die Sucher versuchen ihm diese abzunehmen und beenden dadurch das Spiel. Doch ganz so einfach ist das nicht - schließlich kann sich der Schnatz ja verteidigen 

  • "Wie fliegt ihr eigentlich?"

Leider fliegen wir gar nicht. Quidditch wird auf dem Boden laufend gespielt. Bei fliegenden Besen macht die Technik leider noch nicht mit 

  • "Echt? Ihr lauft mit Besen zwischen den Beinen?"

Oh ja! Bei jeder Sportart gibt es ein Handicap. Bei manchen ist es Eine Schritte- Regel und bei uns ist es halt der Besen! Er muss ständig zwischen den Beinen getragen werden.



ENGLISH Story ♥ 

Guess what? Unisportzentrum Darmstadt managed to qualify for EQC 2016 in Italy! We are so proud and very eager to play some awesome and of course very sexy quidditch in Gallipoli.

We are one of the three German teams going to Italy for EQC this April.

But first we need you to help.

Since the tournament and travelling is not as cheap as we expected we need some support. Help us to send our players to Italy and we will thank you with our special and awesome perks.

Take a look at our jersey, the different snitches and our really cool quidditch designs for t- shirts.

Due to your support the journey will become possible! Help us make our dream come true :-)

Die Sucher versuchen ihm diese abzunehmen und beenden dadurch das Spiel. Doch ganz so einfach ist das nicht - schließlich kann sich der Schnatz ja verteidigen 

"Wie fliegt ihr eigentlich?"
Leider fliegen wir gar nicht. Quidditch wird auf dem Boden laufend gespielt. Bei fliegenden Besen macht die Technik leider noch nicht mit 
"Echt? Ihr lauft mit Besen zwischen den Beinen?"
Oh ja! Bei jeder Sportart gibt es ein Handicap. Bei manchen ist es Eine Schritte- Regel und bei uns ist es halt der Besen! Er muss ständig zwischen den Beinen getragen werden.



ENGLISH Story ♥ 


Guess what?
Unisportzentrum Darmstadt managed to qualify for EQC 2016 in Italy!
We are so proud and very eager to play some awesome and of course
very sexy quidditch in Gallipoli. 

We are one of the
three German teams going to Italy for EQC this April.


But first we need
you to help.
Since the tournament
and travelling is not as cheap as we expected we need some support.
Help us to send our players to Italy and we will thank you with our
special and awesome perks. 



Take a look at our
jersey, the different snitches and our really cool quidditch designs
for t- shirts.
Due to your support
the journey will become possible! Help us make our dream come
true :-)

story:
We hear it all the time.  “I tried everything.”  My mystery pain in my shoulders, back, arm, knee etc.  I just can’t figure out what it is!  I’ve tried acupuncture, chiropractic care, doctors, Physical and Occupational Therapy, injections, and even surgery, and still nothing works!

The real secret is that the body reliably maintains a somatic expression of the internal landscape of the individual.   All disease is due to imbalances within the individual.  

This book is the first of it's kind, integrating the medical and metaphysical perspective with a step by step comprehensive guide to treatment.  

When you truly excavate and unlock from the pain from it's roots, this can completely turn your life around.   

This will be a novel and unique remake of the #1 selling self help book in the world by Louis Hayes, "You can Heal Yourself."

story:
Dementia in Ghana

The world population is getting older and along with aging the prevalence of dementia is on the rise, as the syndrome is most common among elderly. This phenomenon is especially taking place in low-to middle-income countries. With regard to the African region, Ghana is one of the countries affected most with an expected population growth of 147% by the time of 2030. With the expected increase of older people in Ghana, the prevalence of dementia will also rise for which it is becoming a major problem. When affected with dementia the need for care increases resulting in dependency. However, the awareness about dementia in Ghana is low and formal care for mental health is lacking. As a result, the persons affected with dementia become reliant on the informal care provided by their family members, which impact their lives drastically. 

Burden on families

People affected with dementia eventually need 24 hour care which the family has to provide due to lack of support and limited health care facilities. As a result, it is seen that family members have to give up their jobs and social lives, as there is no other solution for them. Giving up their jobs and high hospital costs creates high financial burden on the families. The care that is needed cannot be provided and the lives of family members are affected considerably on physical and emotional levels. It is therefore to bad that the government of Ghana acknowledges and supports mental health only limited and dementia is not supported at all. The awareness about dementia in Ghana is very low. Many people have never even heard of dementia and perceive it as something that is belonging to old age, which is not the case.

What is dementia?

Dementia is used as an umbrella term for a range of diseases, which cause a progressive deterioration in the brains structure and cognitive function. Some examples are diseases like Alzheimer’s, Pick’s Disease, Vascular Dementia and Lewy Bodies Dementia. The symptoms of dementia can vary. The most common symptoms are confusion, memory loss, slurred speech, repeatedly asking the same questions, depression, changes in mood and personality. 

Who am I?

My name is Jente Bosma, a student at the VU University in Holland. I study International Public Health and am currently performing my internship at Alzheimer’s and Related Disorders Association of Ghana (ARDAG) to finish my master programme. In Holland I have been working in an elderly home for more than 5 years and my own grandmother is suffering from dementia, which triggered my interest for elderly care and in particular dementia. When reading the latest report of Alzheimer’s Disease International it became clear to me that the prevalence of dementia is mostly present in low- and middle income countries and is growing fastest in these regions. That is why I decided to do my research in Ghana.

When coming to Ghana, I was surprised. The awareness about the existence of dementia is low. Many people have never even heard of it and perceive it as something belonging to old age. As dementia is not acknowledged as a disease, the government is not doing anything for people suffering with dementia laying a heavy burden on family members who are doomed to take care of their relative with dementia. My research is about the impact of living with someone with dementia on family members and caregivers. In order to retrieve data I visit the families and see how they are suffering both financially and emotionally. With no support from the government, someone has to stand up for them.

Alzheimer’s and Related Disorder Association of Ghana

ARDAG is the only association in Ghana that addresses the needs of people with dementia and their families and who tries to create a society where people with dementia can live with honour and dignity. ARDAG is an NGO, which is a non-governmental, non-religious and non-profit making organization, established in 2012, with charity number: CG015022012. The reason for the establishment was an incident in 2010 in Tema, Ghana, where a 72-year-old woman was burned to death, in the belief that she was a witch. In fact, the women showed signs of dementia. The organisation is aimed at raising awareness of all forms of dementia throughout Ghana. The aim is to eliminate the stigma attached to the disease through available media, and also to create a society, which is dementia friendly, dementia literate and where a person with dementia can live with dignity and honour.

What does ARDAG do?

In order to achieve our aims, ARDAG performs multiple activities. The main activities of ARDAG include:

  • Awareness creation

Awareness is the major key to break the silence and stigma surrounding Dementia. In view of these, ARDAG has started intensive awareness campaign programmes with the general public as a target including the government and policy makers.

  • Care consultation services

We provide educational programmes on topics such as home care, patient management and caregivers’ well-being. We conduct regular home visits to our clients to offer care and support services.

  • Advocacy

ARDAG provides guidance in legal matters to people with dementia and families, intervenes in cases of abuse, stigmatisation and label

  • Training

We organize training programmes and workshops for volunteers, professionals, and educational institutions. We also offer information and advice on a wide range of dementia related subjects.

Purpose of the campaign

The reason we started this campaign is to increase the health care for people with dementia in Ghana and to decrease the burden on their families. Many people in Ghana live in poverty and the high financial burden on families, who are living with someone affected with dementia, makes it important to intervene on this issue.  Providing home care for every person affected with dementia is costly and difficult to arrange. With the establishment of a day care centre the family is released of caregiver stress and less caregivers are needed to take care of multiple persons with dementia making this approach more cost-effective and sustainable.

Recently, ARDAG was generously offered a land in order to establish the first health care centre for dementia in Ghana. However, this has not yet been realised since the NGO receives no financial support from the government and funding from companies and other institutions is small and hard to retrieve as many people don’t know what dementia is. As the land in Ghana is in fact very costly, it is of great importance to collect enough funding and start building the place before it will be taken away for other purposes.

The establishment will function as a ‘day care centre’ in order to give families of people with dementia the opportunity to bring their relative for a period of time during the day. In this way people affected with dementia will get proper care and the family members are able to go to work, to do groceries or other important daily activities. At the day care centre, dementia trained staf will provide care consisting out of a psychologist, a neurologist, social workers and nurses. The day care centre will offer shelter, food, medicines and other essential needs for meeting the health needs of people with dementia.  

Benefits of a day care centre for people with dementia:

  • The day care centre offers people with Alzheimer's and other dementias the opportunity to be social and to stay in a safe environment
  • Family members can continue to execute their occupation and other daily activities while their relative is at the day centre
  • Less caregivers are needed to take care of multiple cases of dementia in comparison with individual care
  • Family members of people with dementia are able to meet other families dealing with the same difficulties creating social support

What we will do with the funds raised

  • Build the first day care centre for people affected with dementia in Ghana
  • Providing food, medicines and other essential needs for meeting the health needs of people with dementia during their stay in the day care centre

Other ways you can help

As we are aware that not everybody is able to contribute money to this project, we want to ask you to inform others with this story by making use of the sharing tools on Indiegogo. Your contribution is much appreciated!

story:
Mike has been handicapped from birth. He has Cerebral Palsy and needs a wheelchair to get around. He was given one by a rehabilitation home that wanted money rather than help him be able to get out into the community. With the correct chair he would be able to get out and go around his neighborhood, even drive his van, and get out of his apartment. The chair he was given is now coming apart and is worn out, and Medi-Care only wants to make repairs, not replace the chair for one that would work better for Mike. 

The $9000 would be used to help Mike get a new wheelchair. He is looking at several chair sales agencies to determine which chair would help him most to be mobile and  visit his town as well as visit his girlfriend back east. 
Mike is unable to get onto his current chair without help from is aide. A new chair would allow him to get himself into his chair, get out of his apartment by himself, and get into his van to drive wherever he wants to go. He has been in his apartment since last December with only doctor visits to get out. He is bored out of his mind looking at the four walls of his apartment. 

Please contribute to help Mike get his chair.

story:
Short Summary

 

After visiting Haiti weeks after the earthquake in 2010 to assist a friend find a new location for his small safe home for children I was burdened for the people met.  I had anticipated that Haiti could be "saved" from the earthquake's devastation but the wounds of that event were just the surface. So many in Haiti have nothing to hope for. There is very little to be encouraged by.  There seemed to be little national pride which leads people to be about self not community. At the same time there was a clear love of futball/soccer.

Upon returning home I began to dream, with my then 9 year old son, of running a futball/soccer camp and giving out Haiti shirts to those attending to help bring happiness, even if for only a few days, and hopefully begin the seeds of national pride in even just a few. 

There are no quick remedies to broken societal structures, but if we each do what we can, we become a part of healing.  Some heal with medicine, some with money, but we are attempting to heal with a Vision and a Ball.  

What We Need & What You Get

 

In this first year we are running a camp for 60 boys and girls.  Each child will receive a custom Haiti shirt as well as food and drinks while at camp.  There will be awards including medals for skills competitions, top player awards, and new balls given to the winning team of our concluding tournament.  All of these items add up quickly for one person but here is how you can help.

  • For $35 you can pay for one child to receive a week of camp and take away a lifetime of memories. 
  • For $25 you can pay for a ball to be used at camp.  All balls are being left in the community to be used when we are gone.
  • For $12 you can pay for a Haiti shirt for a child at camp OR for food and water for that child for the week.

Both lead coaches are licensed and trained while my son (who will be coaching the younger players) has 9 years of playing experience. He looks forward to the day when he runs this camp in Haiti and beyond.

   
Risks & Challenges

Though I am hopeful and excited there are some great difficulties ahead.  It is often challenging getting items of value through customs.  Occasionally money is needed to speed the process or you may never find your bags when you disembark your plane. But even if these barriers get in our way we are determined to not only run camp this Summer, but for many yet to come.

 


Be sure to follow this journey on:

Facebook: Freedom FC

Instagram: Freedom_Futball

Twitter: @freedom_futball

story:
Hello!

I'm Monica. My friend Jude, who is like my nephew, is having really rough time right now. It's been very hard for him to find a job, he can't afford to eat, or really even pay bills. He's living on about 8 dollars at this moment. I can't have my friend not being able to buy groceries. Anything you can give, anything, $1 or two, it does not matter. I would just like to be able to present my friend some money to get by until he can find a job.

 

 If you can't donate, that's fine, just please SPREAD THE WORD!! Thank you so, so much for reading this! Your actions are very much appreciated on a astronomical level!

story:
After numerous setbacks over the past couple of years, including my loss of two jobs (after holding the earlier job for over 19 years!), deaths in the family, serious accidents and illnesses, having to replace a car, to name only a few things, my wife has been diagnosed with breast cancer.  Although she has health insurance - thank god! - the deductibles/co-payments and loss of her income will be a major set-back for our family (we have four kids) as I continue to struggle to find another job.

My kids ASKED to help somehow, and are making ribbons to sell, and my wife bracelets (image included), but this cannot make up for the income issues that are arising, and will continue to accrue.  We need your help.

ANY contribution will be greatly appreciated as we currently expect $3000-4000 in expenses just to get us through the surgery, let alone the costs for her medications (several hundred dollars a month even after insurance) over the next five years and loss of income (roughly $1500 a month over the next couple of months) - plus misc. expenses:  such as clothing, transportation expense, etc. Asking for help is not easy, begging for it is even worse.  With the rise of breast cancer awareness, and many women now going public to expose the cause, we have to step forward to also ask for help when needed.

Your help will provide one less worry for my family - especially my wife, who seems to feel "guilty" about the financial woes associated with this disease/illness even though I contually assure her this is not something within her control (especially considering there is no family history of breast cancer so she had no warning whatsoever!).  Other ways you can help?  Not only your contributions to assist our family, but also to breast cancer awareness causes, and to encourage those you care for to get regular exams even if they have no family history of the disease. 

Please don't just give, whether to us or elsewhere, but spread the word so you and yours are not in the situations my family is now in...and please, help get the word out to others, of our need, by using the Indigo share tools provided, not just for us, but for all!  Thank you for your time, patience, and any donation you may have provided, it will mean more than I could ever express in words...

story:
Update on a veteran I am working with, with our BRE brain program. He used to have 4-5 explosive bouts of anger per week. Last week he had only had one in the last ten days. That was when someone was in his face that he could not physically get away from. Even then it was not as intense as previous. He also found that the anger triggered many of his other symptoms that had disappeared. This week an event happened that pushed all his old buttons and he walked away from it without reacting, and none of his old symptoms were triggered. He has been in counseling on and off since '83 which has helped a lot, but nothing has helped to this level. He has also gone from sleeping for 10 minutes at time a few times a night to sleeping a solid 3.5 hours straight. He is a new person. 

This is what this campaign is all about. Thank you all who have contributed, because it has made his therapy possible. Now we are asking for your to help more Veterans.

Although what we have raised here is small we have gotten amazing results and have raised much more in the office from private donations. Our Veterans thank you so much.

story:
Summary

Our passion is helping you ,our student, play better golf and in doing so have more fun.  We have always been on the cutting edge of golf theory, performance and technology because we know you deserve the best.  To continue giving you the best available learning experience we would like to implement new technology into our teaching.  This new technology will help us achieve the level of data needed to quickly and exactingly pinpoint needed changes in equipment and technique.

  • Dave Cahill PGA Master Professional, 35 years. 
  • Mike Cahill PGA Class A, 10 years.
  • Students include PGA, LPGA Professionals, Tour Professionals, Top University Players.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding detail:

  • The total funding goal is $14,500, this amount includes $12,000 Flight-Scope X2, FS Pressure Plate, tax, shipping, and FS training/ travel. http://flightscope.com/products/flightscope-x2/
  • If we don't meet our funding goal for the Flight-Scope we will give you the option of a refund or your perk w/o Flight Scope. 
  • If we go over our goal we will use the additional funding towards the Advanced Motion Measurement - Wireless Motion Analysis tools and software. ( $1200-$11500) http://www.amm3d.com/products/amm-walkabout-6d-...

What Do You Receive For Your Funds? 

  • We have an array of perks and they happen to be discounted well below our standard prices.
  • If you have any questions on the Perks let us know.

Why Flight Scope at Cahill Golf Schools?

  • Flight Scope uses Military Grade Doppler radar technology that tracks both the club-head and golf ball precisely.  This allows us to easily and quickly visually show you exactly what the changes are accomplishing in your golf swing. 
  • We want you to play your best and we believe this tool will accomplish this goal.

story:
Our Story

It’s not every day that a new professional sports league and team comes onto to the scene.

We want to provide ways for the both the local and global community to experience the excitement of watching our team grow while supporting the development of DC Brawlers athletes. So, whether you live in the DC area, across the country, or across an ocean, we want all of our fans to have the opportunity to support the team. 

But first, here's a little about us:  

  • The DC Brawlers are an official team of the National Pro Grid League (NPGL).
  • We have a roster of some of the fittest athletes on the planet. World record holders? Check. Former collegiate athletes? Check. All around good people? Check.
  • Our team is comprised of both male and female athletes, who compete on the field at the same time - a first in any professional sport.
  • Our league has a contract signed with the NBC Sports Network to carry the matches in the first season. No really, read about it here.

By contributing to the campaign,  you'll not only be joining other fans of the Brawlers around the world, but also helping the these athletes realize their dream of becoming professionals and take home the championship.


Join The DCB - What's in it for you?

So, what exactly are we trying to do here:

  • We are looking to raise $15,000. 
  • All funds will go to supporting ways that help the DC Brawlers athletes be more competitive on the grid - especially training necessities at our facility (rig, bars, plates, etc.), athletic supplies like tapes and wraps and nutritional needs during training.
  • In return for your support, we are offering unique experiences and interactions with the athletes themselves, as well as limited-edition gear, chances to make your mark on the training facility and so much more.
  • Any contribution of $25 or more will give you access to The DCB, the official supporters club of the DC Brawlers.


Immediate Impact

By contributing to this campaign you will have a direct, positive impact on the DC Brawlers athletes as they go into the inaugural season of the National Pro Grid League. Being that all funds raised will be used to provide essential training needs, you can be sure that no matter what amount you decide to give it will make a difference.


    It's a Long Road. . .

    Starting a team from the ground up isn't easy, but it's a challenge we're up to meeting. As an organization, we're proud that we can help a group of phenomenal athletes work towards achieving their dream of becoming professionals. For us, we're all Brawlers at heart, which is why we chose the name for our team. We know that there are many challenges ahead of us, some are known (many are not), but we are committed to bringing a new professional sports team to the world - no matter the ups and downs. Won't you join us on this journey?   


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Like what we're doing, but can't offer financial support? No problem, because there are several other ways you can help out the team. "But how?" you say.

    Well, consider these options:

    • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools, and blast this campaign out to your friends and families.
    • Visit our website dcbrawlers.com to stay up on the most current happenings with the team. 
    • Come out to and support the Brawlers in person during our upcoming season.

story:
Opening Doors to the Future

A common scenario for women emerging from breast cancer treatment is that they are faced with a multitude of issues affecting their physical, emotional and spiritual well-being. Their vital functions like digestion, respiration and heart rate are impaired. And more: They often avoid touching others or being touched. They feel the need for physical and emotional revitalization. 

The medical profession does not attend to these ensuing issues once treatment is completed. In many ways these women are similar to returning war veterans with PTSD symptoms.  Like the many horse programs around the country helping returning veterans with PTSD, Riding Beyond is designed to help women recovering from breast cancer treatment to find physical and emotional revitalization .

You are probably familiar with the growing popularity of therapy animals like dogs and cats for easing people’s lives in many situations. For me, though, it’s about horses.  I believe in the power of the horse/human connection to bring new life to people and even to our world. This belief has been confirmed over and over again the past 25 years during my career in therapeutic riding — as a certified therapeutic riding instructor and certified equine specialist in mental health and learning, as well as executive director of two premier accredited therapeutic riding programs. I have personally witnessed countless examples. A child began speaking for the first time at age 6 because of a horse. A man with head injuries got out of a wheelchair and walked unaided because of riding a horse. Through a program I developed, at risk teens from a residential treatment center discovered new directions when horses introduced them to their larger lives.  This program was later the foundation for my book Riding Into Your Mythic Life: Transformational Adventures with the Horse. (New World Library, 2007) 

Last summer Riding Beyond conducted a pilot program where the horse Mystic helped women claim new vitality and a fresh sense of direction for their lives following the rigors of breast cancer treatment. 

This program is important to me personally because I have accompanied two friends closely through their journeys with Stage 4 breast cancer and as a result I have a lot of respect and compassion for the suffering and courage required to take this journey.  

Riding Beyond is based on a program developed by a woman who was dying of the effects of her radiation treatment seven years ago and through an inspired encounter with her horse, discovered the road to recovery. Since then she has offered her program to women in southern California. Exercises that she developed help to improve blood circulation and oxygenation, respiration and blood pressure, as well as to improve balance, strength and endurance in four sessions  or an all day session. I have adapted her program to include activities that expand possibilities for the future of women’s lives. Activities like story telling and riding to music explore emotionally and spiritually an expanded understanding of the participant’s larger life. 

What We Need & What You Get

We got started with two participants last September with the help of over 60 volunteers who worked throughout the summer to make the pilot program a reality. Now we need your help to expand the program to serve 36 women. If we exceed our goal, your contributions will fund the creation of training materials for establishing the program in other parts of the world. And we’ll add a second horse to the program for further expansion and to share the work when Mystic needs a break.

This year we anticipate 4 sessions of Riding Beyond June through September and two all day sessions serving a total of 36 women for this year. Our budget for this program for the year is nearly $29,000, covering horse and equipment expenses, training of volunteers, program promotion, insurance, facility rental, administration and professional fees.  Your tax deductible gift, whether it’s $5 or more, can help make Riding Beyond a reality.  Regardless of your ability to give money, your best gift to Riding Beyond is for you to share our campaign far and wide: to breast cancer survivors, their friends and families and to people who are horse enthusiasts. 

Everyone who gives to the campaign will receive a high resolution, electronic poster called Advice from Mystic with a beautiful image by professional photographer Cornelius Matteo who has contributed his extraordinary work to Riding Beyond as seen throughout our campaign, as well as periodic updates in the form of stories and photos throughout the four months that we are in session. If you give $1000 or more, I will take you or a friend on a half day trail ride on the Pacific Crest Trail, among the best trail riding available anywhere in the world. We’ll be posting more perks over the coming weeks, so check back with us. The greatest perk, though, is your satisfaction in helping to establish a program that attends to the needs of so many women. 

The Impact

Most of the women who have gone through radiation and chemotherapy treatment have ongoing issues to deal with, like these:

  • They need physical and emotional revitalization. 
  • Vital functions have been impaired, like digestion, respiration (shallow breathing) and rapid heart rate.
  • Self image is impacted by surgery and chemotherapy and radiation treatment. 
  • Tactile defensiveness: not enjoying touch or being touched. 
  • A need to reconnect to her body and to others. 
  • Physical weakness. 

Here is how Riding Beyond helps.

TOUCH

The act of touching a beautiful, calm, and sensitive large animal like a horse who responds with sighs and other signs of enjoyment opens participants to the wonder and power of touch in a non-threatening and potent environment. This experience is an important first step in Riding Beyond. 

LYING ON THE HORSE

Lying on the back of a horse for 60 seconds or longer, face-down on the horse’s rump, activates the part of the vagus nerve which runs along the front of the body.  Several things occur with this exercise.  There is a gentle compression of the diaphragm and lungs.  There is an energetic connection between the horse’s body and the woman’s body so that respiration and heart rate entrain with the slower rates of the horse.  This effect has been measured in scientific research:

Recent studies conducted by the Institute of HeartMath provide a clue to explain the bidirectional "healing" that happens when we are near horses. According to researchers, the heart has a larger electromagnetic field and higher level of intelligence than the brain: A magnetometer can measure the heart's energy field radiating up to 8 to 10 feet around the human body. While this is certainly significant it is perhaps more impressive that the electromagnetic field projected by the horse's heart is five times larger than the human one (imagine a sphere-shaped field that completely surrounds you). The horse's electromagnetic field is also stronger than ours and can actually directly influence our own heart rhythm.

Horses are also likely to have what science has identified as a "coherent" heart rhythm (heart rate pattern) which explains why we may "feel better" when we are around them. . . .studies have found that a coherent heart pattern or HRV is a robust measure of well-being and consistent with emotional states of calm and joy--that is, we exhibit such patterns when we feel positive emotions.

A coherent heart pattern is indicative of a system that can recover and adjust to stressful situations very efficiently. Often times, we only need to be in a horse’s presence to feel a sense of wellness and peace. In fact, research shows that people experience many physiological benefits while interacting with horses, including lowered blood pressure and heart rate, increased levels of beta-endorphins (neurotransmitters that serve as pain suppressors), decreased stress levels, reduced feelings of anger, hostility, tension and anxiety, improved social functioning; and increased feelings of empowerment, trust, patience and self-efficacy.

Often upon rising up from the prone position, a woman is able to take a deep, abdominal breath for the first time in months. Measurements of heart rate before and after this exercise show measurable improvements in both heart rate and oxygen levels in the blood. 

Since the vagus nerve controls the autonomic nervous system, improvements in digestion and other functions are benefitted, as well. 

Participants practice lying on a horse’s back at the beginning of each session by mounting a specially constructed barrel horse. 

SYNCHRONIZED MOVEMENT TO MUSIC

Initially, participants walk side by side with the horse and then later on the back of the horse, in synchrony with inspiring music.  This promotes a deep level of relaxation and reconnection with the horse and the others walking along.  There is often an experience of ecstasy that goes beyond words. 

MIND/BRAIN EXERCISES

Exercises develop the use of the imagination and, more, the imaginal body or the muscular imagination, to vividly focus and to align themselves with their higher purpose.  These exercises take advantage of neural plasticity and make available to the participant parts of their brains previously untapped. 

EXPLORING THE LARGER LIFE 

A fundamental purpose of Riding Beyond is to explore the threads of the larger patterns of our lives, reconfiguring one’s challenges in the context of a larger destiny.  This is accomplished through fictional and true life story telling, creative word play and reading of poetry and other relevant inspirational passages. 

STRENGTH AND BALANCE

Riding a horse at a walk and responding to the complex movement, which is side to side, back and forth and rotational, stimulates nerves and muscles to increase strength and improve balance and proprioception. 

BONDING

One of the most powerful experiences for all involved is the bonding between the horse and the people, participants and volunteers alike. Riding Beyond is full of heart-opening moments. As one participant remarked with wonder; “I discovered I was in for a profound healing of the heart.”  

HOW RIDING BEYOND CAME TO BE

After a career of teaching riding and training horses, I turned over 25 years ago to therapeutic riding because I felt that there were so many larger benefits to the horse human relationship that went beyond competition and I wanted to offer these benefits to a larger audience. 

I established the Saddle Light Center in San Antonio Texas and later reopened the HOPE Equestrian Center in the Rogue Valley.  I worked with at-risk teens in a summer program which showed them how the trials and tribulations of their lives were in actuality the whisperings of their destiny calling them on their own hero’s journey.  I wrote a book about it: Riding Into Your Mythic Life: Transformational Adventures with the Horse. 

For the past ten years I have taught Journey Horse, here and in Australia, which are modern day vision quests with horses, as well as other seminars for professionals in equine assisted activities and therapies. About a year ago I began to yearn to offer something of my work to my home community here in the Rogue Valley.

Last spring I was presenting my work at Prescott Best Practices conference and I heard about a remarkable program in southern California established 7 years ago.  There was a bit of magic about it, because I met Catherine Hand briefly when we sat next to one another at the opening address. She invited me to her presentation, which I probably would have missed otherwise. At the presentation she told how seven years ago she was in hospice, dying of damage to her heart and lungs from her radiation treatment for breast cancer. She had given away her dogs and all but one of her horses.  One day, she said, she read a book Riding Into Your Mythic Life and was inspired. It occurred to her that perhaps the story handed her by the medical profession did not need to be her own story.  (She commented that the author of that book was somewhere at the conference and to everyone’s delight I let her know right then that we had already met.)  That day seven years ago, with the help of a friend she felt inspired to climb onto the back of her one remaining horse and lay down on the horse’s rump.  Two days later a hospice nurse asked her what she was doing to be getting better.  Her rapid heart rate had improved and her oxygenation levels had increased.  It took her a while to remember that the only thing she’d done different was to climb on that horse’s back.  After that, she partnered with a medical professional and pursued her insight, and over the next weeks she left hospice care, and within the next year she got well and proceeded to establish the program that she offers in southern California. 

I came home from Arizona inspired to offer Riding Beyond to my own community. Over 60 people pitched in, helping in so many different ways.   People and a horse got trained, we gathered or constructed the equipment we needed, and then we conducted the pilot program in September. 

PARTICIPANTS IN THE PILOT PROGRAM SAID

"I came to Riding Beyond with only the expectation that I would get to know a tiny bit about horses and maybe find some small happiness for the moment. 

I’d gone through a very difficult year – a diagnosis of cancer and the loss of my beloved youngest daughter. Joy was hard to come by. Grief was an every day companion. . . 

I went to the first day of the program with pretty much no idea whether I’d get bucked off a frisky horse or have a spontaneous healing like ones I’d heard about. Trish had explained the program, but with my extremely limited exposure to horses I don’t think anything really gelled. Well, I was in for one of the most treasured and healing experiences I’ve had in this rocky road of life. This would be a healing of the heart.

Mystic’s calm, quiet presence quickly infused me, and I found myself really falling in love with something in her that was tangibly intangible. 

I found in the following weeks of the program that I was constantly bringing up her image in my mind when I felt stressed or sad or even happy. Just the thought of her would calm my mind and bring a feeling of contentment, peace, wellbeing. On one occasion I was feeling some deep angst and restlessness and couldn’t really put my finger on the cause. I then thought of Mystic, almost automatically, like some people reach for a sedative. Immediately a huge, huge wave of grief enveloped me. The release was like the wave of a tsunami and the minutes after were like floating in an endless quiet sea.

Another time I was praying and meditating but thoughts kept racing in and out, and grief and sadness and confusion kept tormenting me. Again my mind automatically went to Mystic and very surprisingly, in an instant, I became profoundly calm, very quiet, at peace. Well, I didn’t know what to think of that but hey, I’d take it. And so went the love affair with the horse, Mystic. I am so grateful.”

“I really appreciate the opportunity that I had to participate in the pilot program for Riding Beyond.  Each time I left the ranch after these sessions, I had such a feeling of peace and well-being (it reminded me that I could feel that way!).  The sessions included time to share experiences and poems.  The whole team participated in these discussions which resulted in some interesting conversations and ideas that I had not thought of previously.

In addition to the health/mind benefits, this experience helped me to overcome my fear of horses.  Trish and the volunteers shared their knowledge of horses and were there the entire time – so I felt safe.  And, of course, the star of the show, Mystic, is an amazing horse.  She is calm, sweet, and patient.  I enjoyed the time I spent with Mystic and am now looking forward to taking horseback riding lessons!

It was an extremely positive experience that I would highly recommend to others.”

SEVEN MONTHS LATER

“The program ended but Mystic is a permanent fixture in my life, coming to me in moments of stress and of joy. I had no idea a horse could do that, no idea. It has supported me through my ongoing treatment: Mystic is a huge piece of my well-being. So much had been wiped away by my diagnosis and the death of my daughter, so many of my assumptions of what life was supposed to be were gone. Maybe because of that I was able to take what she had to give. I always thought of horses as big and scary, and I found when I was with her, who she was came out, a giant presence of love and sweetness. It came into me as someone who walks beside you when you walk through these kinds of times. It's a pure relationship without all the baggage with people. She really fills me up.”

VOLUNTEERS SAID

“The individual details of our stories, we did not share. We did not need to know. By sensing together we created a place to cultivate reverence, awe, grace, dignity and respect. The courage to walk with horses, not knowing and being vulnerable, allowed us to weave together our own story, one of deep connection and belonging. Whether you are a volunteer or participant, the wisdom and magic of horses exists for you. Allow it and it will change your life. I am Jenny, a Riding Beyond volunteer and because I dared to be a part of Riding Beyond, I have grown. Thank you, Riding Beyond volunteers, participants, and of course the horses. Your courage has given me great joy.” — Jen Lieber

“Immediately I was awed by the spirits of the other volunteers, all from different backgrounds  and experiences yet I felt at home right away. My gifts were acknowledged, appreciated and cared for. Each person was  assigned a place to be of help within their comfort level,  no matter their experience with horses or cancer for that matter. People and animals were held with gentleness, grace and appreciation. Laughter rang out, a few tears ran down cheeks, warmth exploded out of our space, (in spite of one very icy Ashland day), chickens cheered us on and I even got hugged by a horse. What a way to spend a morning. Then we had the blessing of meeting the participants , brave woman finishing a tough course of treatment and trusting us to help them take a new step on their journey of healing. An intuitive horse partner, a trained facilitator and amazing volunteers. We got to watch the magic unfold. It really doesn’t get any better. Join us and be inspired.

I can also add: since I am a breast cancer survivor, I inadvertently received a healing blessing from Mystic, who took time to get to know me and nuzzled her nose on the exact area I first found my lump….how’s that for intuitive? She then proceeded to give me a horse hug , gently wrapping her beautiful neck around my leg and holding me. Guess she knew we all need love.” —Mary Piper

LARGER MATTERS

Although I have not personally experienced breast cancer, I have accompanied several friends through their own treatment, and I have witnessed first-hand the suffering and courage that is required by women who take this journey.  It is life-changing, challenging their most intimate sense of self and personal identity. My friends were huge inspirations to me. 

I believe that women who face breast cancer are ambassadors of the rise of the feminine in the evolutionary process that we are all participating in, not the rise of feminism, but the rise of the unique qualities of the feminine soul for nurturing life and finding life-giving solutions to problems instead of resorting to warfare and violence. They have the potential to be those who can pioneer a new way, having gone through a fire that hones their purpose to laser clarity. 

To have breast cancer is intrinsically involved in what it takes to overcome enormous challenges, and to gather resources to separate one's identity as a person from the disease at an intimate level, to find who they are as strong and creative beings. Breast cancer can strike at their most intimate sense of self and personal identity. Riding Beyond offers an experience of their core selves as creative and strong, keeping them in touch with creativity and strength so that they can claim their personal possibilities for this larger destiny. They are a keystone species critical to the unfolding of something new and life-sustaining for our world’s long-term future. 

DEDICATION

This work is dedicated to those friends of mine who have met the cancer challenge and other women like them around the world.  

It is also dedicated to the remarkable horses who have demonstrated their willingness, wisdom and enthusiasm for engaging with humans for such elegant and effective healing purposes. 

Along the lines of dedicating this work, I will be attending a Sundance at the Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota for the summer solstice. Although I have been invited to this sundance for many years, this is the first time that I feel compelled to attend. It is held at a wild horse sanctuary, and I intend that four days of dancing and fasting and praying will anchor and launch the future of Riding Beyond, as well as benefit our wider stewardship of the earth. 

I believe in the power of the horse human connection because it’s this kind of bridging between species, partnering with horses in this case, that is a critical practice for the survival of our world, a world  where so many bridges between peoples and between us and our planet desperately need to be forged. 

With our horses, it means making performance goals secondary to relationship goals, so that winning a blue ribbon is not nearly so important as being able to listen deeply to the language of a horse, learning their language and involving  them in our deep and ongoing life journeys as a teacher and companion.  With our fellow human beings, it leads us to new ways of living and being, bringing balance to our lives for healing, finding new ways of leadership that are essentially collaborative, and implementing what we know about our all being connected as one world on planet Earth. 

Horses are associated in our imaginations with grand tales of heroism and adventure, large movement and beauty. This is their mythic aspect. And by engaging with horses from that perspective, they introduce us to our own mythic lives and keep us connected to it, that larger life that we so easily can loose sight of, the life that’s possible for us.  By pursuing that relationship with a horse, we can go forth, you might say ride forth into that larger life.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Just about everybody knows someone who has been challenged with breast cancer.  Please share this campaign with them, their friends and families, so that they can help us bring this beneficial program to more women. 

Know someone who loves horses?  Share the campaign with them and maybe they will see new possibilities for a horse that's in their lives. 

It's easy when you use the Indiegogo share tools.
